[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-tsacue e6idgb70">Global health</p>, <h1 class="css-1s4ffep e1h9rw200" id="link-785e94e2" itemprop="headline"><span>China Identifies New Virus Causing Pneumonialike Illness </span></h1>, <p class="css-1ifw933 e1wiw3jv0" id="article-summary">The new coronavirus doesn’t appear to be readily spread by humans, but researchers caution that more study is needed.</p>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/sui-lee-wee"><span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Sui-Lee Wee</span></a> and <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/donald-g-mcneil-jr"><span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Donald G. McNeil Jr.</span></a></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">HONG KONG — Chinese researchers say they have identified a new virus behind an illness that has infected dozens of people across Asia, setting off fears in a region that was struck by a deadly epidemic 17 years ago.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">There is no evidence that the new virus is readily spread by humans, which would make it particularly dangerous, and it has not been tied to any deaths. But health officials in China and elsewhere are watching it carefully to ensure that the outbreak does not develop into something more severe. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Researchers in China have “initially identified” the new virus, a coronavirus, as the pathogen behind a <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/06/world/asia/china-SARS-pneumonialike.html" title="">mysterious, pneumonialike illness that has sickened 59 people in the city of Wuhan</a> and caused a panic in the central Chinese region, the state broadcaster, China Central Television, said on Thursday. They detected this virus in 15 of the people who fell ill, the report said. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The new coronavirus “is different from previous human coronaviruses that were previously discovered, and more scientific research is needed for further understanding,” the report said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Coronaviruses are a large family of viruses that infect animals and people. Some cause only the symptoms known as the common cold, although many other viruses also do that.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The announcement signals that researchers are making progress in containing the outbreak, but Asian officials are not likely to relax their vigilance until they learn more. The disease has evoked memories of <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2003/04/27/world/the-sars-epidemic-the-path-from-china-s-provinces-a-crafty-germ-breaks-out.html" title="">the outbreak of SARS, or severe acute respiratory syndrome</a>, in 2003. SARS, a respiratory disease and also a coronavirus, spread from southern China in 2003 and infected more than 3,000 people, killing 774. </p>, <h1 class="g-headline" id="g-inlineguide-headline">The Coronavirus Outbreak</h1>, <h2 class="g-inlineguide-list-header g-optimize-type">What do you need to know? Start here.</h2>, <p class="g-inlineguide-date">Updated Feb. 10, 2020</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">[Read: </em><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/21/world/asia/china-coronavirus-australia-wuhan-travel.html" title=""><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">China’s coronavirus outbreak tests the transparency of China’s Communist Party</em></a><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">.]</em></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China initially covered up the extent of the SARS outbreak and was criticized by health officials around the world for doing so. On Thursday, the World Health Organization praised the Chinese response to the new outbreak and said it did not recommend any restrictions on trade or travel to China because of the virus. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“Preliminary identification of a novel virus in a short period of time is a notable achievement and demonstrates China’s increased capacity to manage new outbreaks,” Dr. Gauden Galea, the W.H.O.’s representative to China, said in a statement.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Many questions about the new virus remain. While it appears to be transmitted to humans via animals, the Chinese government has not said which animals, nor has it disclosed other details about the outbreak, like the transmission route, the incubation period or the ages and genders of the patients. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“So, there are still a lot of question marks,” said David Hui, an expert in emerging infections at the Chinese University of Hong Kong.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The authorities in Wuhan are still closely monitoring 163 people who were in close contact with the patients, Dr. Hui said. He added that 15 days, the minimum incubation period for some viral infections, had not yet passed since the last reported instance of the disease, on Dec. 29.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“It’s premature to say that there’s no human-to-human transmission,” Dr. Hui said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Wuhan government <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="http://wjw.wuhan.gov.cn/front/web/showDetail/2019123108989" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">confirmed on Dec. 31</a> that the health authorities were treating dozens of cases of pneumonia of unknown cause. Symptoms of the new illness include high fever, difficulty breathing and lung lesions, according to the Wuhan health commission. Seven people have become critically ill, the Wuhan authorities have said. On Wednesday, the local health commission said eight people had been discharged.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Researchers have been encouraged by the fact that patients’ relatives and hospital workers have not been reported to have gotten sick, signaling that the virus may not spread easily among humans. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“We can assume that this virus transmissibility is not that high,” said Guan Yi, a professor of infectious diseases at the University of Hong Kong, who was part of a team that successfully identified the coronavirus that caused SARS.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Dr. Guan said he was not surprised that the virus identified was a coronavirus, because coronaviruses can pass from animals to humans easily. But he said it would probably be a while before researchers came up with treatments for the illness. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">So far, the cases in China have circulated only in Wuhan. The initial cases were linked to workers at a market that sold live fish, animals and birds. Workers disinfected and shut down the market after the city health department said many of the cases had been traced to it. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The new illness appeared just weeks before the Spring Festival, China’s biggest holiday, when hundreds of millions of people travel. The authorities have urged the public to be on alert for pneumonialike symptoms like fevers, body aches and breathing difficulties.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Until Thursday’s announcement, it was not clear what was causing the illnesses in Wuhan. The World Health Organization said Wednesday that it had concluded that it was most likely a coronavirus. “More comprehensive information is required to confirm the pathogen,” the W.H.O. said in a statement. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Early reports on ProMED, a disease-alert service, said there was no evidence of human-to-human transmission.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Last weekend, laboratory tests in China ruled out SARS; the deadly Middle East Respiratory Syndrome, or MERS; the flu; bird flu; adenoviruses; and other common pathogens that cause pneumonia.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Health officials in Asia have stepped up screenings and isolated patients with flulike symptoms who had traveled to Wuhan.<strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"> </strong>In Hong Kong, eight people with fever and respiratory symptoms who had recently been in Wuhan were hospitalized on Wednesday. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In South Korea, the authorities said on Wednesday that they had <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.scmp.com/news/asia/east-asia/article/3045249/chinese-worker-who-visited-wuhan-quarantined-south-korea" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">put a Chinese woman under isolated treatment</a> after she was found to have pneumonia after trips to China, including Wuhan. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In Singapore, the authorities placed a Chinese girl with pneumonia in isolation because she had traveled to Wuhan. On Sunday, they said doctors had determined that the child <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/update-on-local-situation-regarding-severe-pneumonia-cluster-in-wuhan-5-jan" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">had a common childhood viral illness</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Officials in Hong Kong have installed additional thermal imaging systems at its airport to monitor passengers coming from Wuhan, scanning for people with fevers.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">SARS is believed to have jumped to humans from live-animal markets. It was eventually traced to civet cats, raccoon dogs and some other species that were raised and slaughtered for the exotic food trade. The virus normally circulates in bats, and the animals may have gotten it from them, possibly by eating food contaminated by bat droppings.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Most outbreaks of MERS, which appeared in 2012, have been traced to people who raise or sell camels, which in the Middle East are kept for meat, milk, racing, hauling cargo and as pets. Like SARS, MERS can jump from person to person, particularly in hospitals. Some MERS patients infected many others after they were put on machines to help them breathe — the mechanisms helped spew viral particles into the air as they exhaled.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Despite Thursday’s announcement, many Chinese were still expressing fear that there could be a repeat of SARS.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“In fact, what people are more concerned about is the transmission route and whether it can be cured,” wrote a user on Weibo, a popular social media tool in China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">[</em></strong><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="http://on.fb.me/1paTQ1h" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title=""><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">Like the Science Times page on Facebook.</em></a></strong><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0"> </em></strong><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">| Sign up for the </em><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="http://nyti.ms/1MbHaRU" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title=""><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">Science Times newsletter.</em></a></strong><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">]</em></strong></p>, <p class="css-jwz2nf etfikam0">Sui-Lee Wee reported from Hong Kong and Donald G. McNeil Jr. from New York. Elsie Chen contributed research from Beijing.</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <h1 class="css-1s4ffep e1h9rw200" id="link-326f96aa" itemprop="headline"><span>China Reports First Death From New Virus</span></h1>, <p class="css-1ifw933 e1wiw3jv0" id="article-summary">The coronavirus, which surfaced in the city of Wuhan, has put the region on alert, but there is no evidence that it can spread among humans.</p>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/amy-qin"><span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Amy Qin</span></a> and <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/javier-c-hernandez"><span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Javier C. Hernández</span></a></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">HONG KONG — Chinese state media on Saturday reported the first known death from a new virus that has infected dozens of people in China and set off worries across Asia.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Xinhua news agency cited the health commission in the central Chinese city of Wuhan, where the illness first appeared, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="http://www.xinhuanet.com/2020-01/11/c_1125448269.htm" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">in reporting the death</a>. The health commission said the patient, a 61-year-old man, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="http://wjw.wuhan.gov.cn/front/web/showDetail/2020011109036" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">died on Thursday night</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Forty-one people have been found to have the new virus, a coronavirus, and seven patients are still in severe condition, the health commission said, according to the Xinhua report. Two patients have been discharged, it said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">There is <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/08/health/china-pneumonia-outbreak-virus.html" title="">no evidence that the virus can be spread between humans</a>, according to the commission. The initial cases were linked to workers at a market that sold live fish, birds and other animals. More than 700 people who had close contact with patients, including 419 medical workers, have been put under observation, the commission said, adding that no additional cases have been found.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Reports of the virus — a mysterious, pneumonialike illness — first appeared last month and have since aroused fears around the region, where memories of <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2013/03/15/opinion/global/how-sars-was-contained.html" title="">the SARS epidemic</a> 17 years ago, which began in China and killed more than 800 people worldwide, still linger.</p>, <h1 class="g-headline" id="g-inlineguide-headline">The Coronavirus Outbreak</h1>, <h2 class="g-inlineguide-list-header g-optimize-type">What do you need to know? Start here.</h2>, <p class="g-inlineguide-date">Updated Feb. 10, 2020</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">[Read: </em><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/21/world/asia/china-coronavirus-australia-wuhan-travel.html" title=""><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">China’s coronavirus outbreak tests the transparency of China’s Communist Party</em></a><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">.]</em></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The man who died was a regular customer at the market in Wuhan and had previously been diagnosed with abdominal tumors and chronic liver disease, said the city’s health commission.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">While no new cases have been detected since Jan. 3, questions remain. Experts have said the minimum incubation period for some viral infections is 15 days, suggesting that it may be another week before authorities can determine the full extent of the illness.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Reports of the man’s death came just before the Spring Festival, China’s biggest holiday, which begins Jan. 25, and a time when hundreds of <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/22/world/asia/china-coronavirus-travel.html" title="">millions people travel across the country.</a> That mass migration raises the potential of spreading and worsening any outbreak. According to <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2020-01/10/c_138694239.htm" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">government estimates</a>, Chinese passengers will take three billion trips in the next five weeks for family reunions and tourism.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In recent days, authorities have stationed personnel at airports and train stations across the region to scrutinize people who have visited Wuhan. The market linked to the virus is less than one mile away from a train station. Precautions include checking passengers for fever. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">[Read: </em><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/21/health/what-is-coronavirus.html" title=""><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">What we know about the Wuhan coronavirus</em></a><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">.]</em></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Authorities in the Chinese city of Hong Kong and elsewhere in Asia have also stepped up scrutiny. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Hong Kong Hospital Authority <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.info.gov.hk/gia/general/202001/11/P2020011100626.htm" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">said on Saturday</a> that seven new patients between the ages of 3 and 50 who visited Wuhan in the last two weeks and presented with fever, respiratory or pneumonia symptoms had been admitted to local hospitals in the past 24 hours for monitoring, bringing the total number of patient cases in the city to 60 since Dec. 31. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Forty-six of those patients have already been discharged and the rest are in stable condition, the authority added.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Also on Saturday, South Korean officials said the illness of a Chinese woman they had placed under isolation earlier in the week was unrelated to the coronavirus, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://en.yna.co.kr/view/AEN20200111001900320?section=science/medicine" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">according to the country’s Yonhap news agency</a>. The woman had visited Wuhan and suffered from coughing the throat irritation.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Chinese government has faced pressure to release more information about the virus. In 2002, after SARS, a dangerous respiratory disease, first broke out, the Chinese government tried to cover up the extent of the epidemic, severely undermining public trust.<strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"> </strong>Some experts have argued that China should disclose more details about the recent outbreak, such as the transmission route, the incubation period and the ages and genders of the patients. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Chinese health officials have cautioned that more research is necessary to fully understand the new virus. The World Health Organization has praised Chinese health officials’ response to the latest outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Coronaviruses are a large family of viruses that infect animals and people, and some cause only the symptoms associated with the common cold. Health officials in China have said that symptoms of the new illness include high fever, difficulty breathing and lung lesions.</p>, <p class="css-jwz2nf etfikam0">Amy Qin reported from Hong Kong, and Javier C. Hernández from Guangzhou, China. Elsie Chen contributed research.</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <h1 class="css-1s4ffep e1h9rw200" id="link-480b0fcc" itemprop="headline"><span>Japan and Thailand Confirm New Cases of Chinese Coronavirus</span></h1>, <p class="css-1ifw933 e1wiw3jv0" id="article-summary">The two new patients will add to fears that the virus will spread further outside China’s borders. </p>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/sui-lee-wee"><span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Sui-Lee Wee</span></a></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BEIJING — Thailand and Japan each reported new cases of <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/08/health/china-pneumonia-outbreak-virus.html" title="">a coronavirus</a> that has left two people dead and at least 40 sick in China, adding to concerns about the spread of the virus beyond Chinese borders ahead of a major holiday. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Health officials in Thailand on Friday said they had found a second case of <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/21/health/what-is-coronavirus.html" title="">the mysterious pneumonialike coronavirus</a> in that country, in a 74-year-old Chinese woman. The woman is in good and stable condition, said a spokesman for Thailand’s public health ministry, Rungrueng Kitphati.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The woman entered Thailand through Bangkok via a flight from the central Chinese city of Wuhan, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/06/world/asia/china-SARS-pneumonialike.html" title="">the epicenter of the outbreak</a>. Investigators were still trying to gather information from the woman but have been hindered by a language barrier, Mr. Rungrueng said. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">On Thursday, Japan’s Health Ministry said that a Chinese man in his 30s tested positive for the coronavirus. The man, a resident of Kanagawa Prefecture, just south of Tokyo, returned to Japan on Jan. 6 after traveling to Wuhan. The man, who came down with a fever on Jan. 3, was hospitalized on Friday but was discharged five days later because he had recovered, according to the Health Ministry.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The World Health Organization said it was highly likely that the virus had spread from a seafood market in Wuhan that also sells live birds and other animals. But Japan’s Health Ministry said the patient had not visited any seafood markets in China, adding that “it is possible that the patient had close contact with an unknown patient with lung inflammation while in China.” </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Malik Peiris, a public health virologist at the University of Hong Kong, said, “If that was the case, that there had been no direct exposure to animals, then that is very concerning, for sure.” </p>, <h1 class="g-headline" id="g-inlineguide-headline">The Coronavirus Outbreak</h1>, <h2 class="g-inlineguide-list-header g-optimize-type">What do you need to know? Start here.</h2>, <p class="g-inlineguide-date">Updated Feb. 10, 2020</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The disclosures on Thursday and Friday brought to three the total number of confirmed cases of the new coronavirus reported outside of China in the last week. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">[Read: </em><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/21/world/asia/china-coronavirus-australia-wuhan-travel.html" title=""><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">China’s coronavirus outbreak tests the transparency of China’s Communist Party</em></a><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">.]</em></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">On Monday, the authorities in Thailand detected the virus in a 61-year-old Chinese woman who was visiting from Wuhan, the capital of the central Chinese province of Hubei. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Dr. Sopon Iamsirithaworn, director of the communicable diseases division at Thailand’s Ministry of Public Health, said the woman had not visited the Wuhan seafood market, and had come down with a fever on Jan. 5. However, the doctor said,<span class="css-8l6xbc evw5hdy0"> </span>the woman had visited a different, smaller market in Wuhan, in which live and freshly slaughtered animals were also sold. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The woman is in good health now, according to Dr. Suthat Chottanapund<strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">, </strong>a senior official in the disease control department of Thailand’s Public Health Ministry. But, he said, the health authorities were waiting for laboratory results to confirm that the woman is free of the coronavirus before discharging her. She said that she wanted to do some sightseeing after she leaves the hospital, he said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The revelation that neither the patient in Japan nor the first one found in Thailand had visited the Huanan Seafood Market, to which most of the cases have been linked, is a troubling sign that the outbreak could be spreading in Wuhan. The market was shut down and disinfected on Jan. 1, but new cases have appeared since, suggesting the virus has not been eradicated. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Concerns have grown across the region since the Chinese health authorities announced the discovery of the mysterious new virus, which has sickened dozens of people in Wuhan with pneumonialike symptoms. The city’s health commission said on Wednesday that the risk<span class="css-8l6xbc evw5hdy0"> </span>of human-to-human transmission is low but possible. Officials also said they detected the first cluster of the virus involving members of a single family.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The new virus has stirred memories in China of the 2003 outbreak of severe acute respiratory syndrome, or SARS. That virus, which is believed to have jumped to humans from animals at markets, originated in China and <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.who.int/csr/sars/country/2003_07_11/en/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">killed more than 800 people worldwide</a> in 2002 and 2003. At the time, the Chinese <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2003/04/21/world/the-sars-epidemic-epidemic-china-admits-underreporting-its-sars-cases.html" title="">government tried to cover up the problem</a>, resulting in a backlash among its people. While flu experts have said the Chinese government is trying to be more transparent now, many in China are skeptical.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The local authorities in Wuhan and the W.H.O. have reiterated for weeks that no cases of human-to-human transmission have been confirmed.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Last week, researchers in China said they had <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/08/health/china-pneumonia-outbreak-virus.html" title="">“initially identified”</a><span class="css-8l6xbc evw5hdy0"> </span>a new coronavirus as the pathogen behind the mysterious respiratory<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/06/world/asia/china-SARS-pneumonialike.html" title=""> illness</a>. Of the 40 cases diagnosed in Wuhan, the majority of patients are middle-age and older men, the city’s health commission said on Wednesday.<span class="css-8l6xbc evw5hdy0"> </span>Five people are in critical condition, officials said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Two deaths have been reported in China, both in Wuhan: a 69-year-old man who fell ill on New Year’s Eve and died Wednesday, and a <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/10/world/asia/china-virus-wuhan-death.html" title="">61-year-old man</a> who died last week and had previously been diagnosed with abdominal tumors and liver disease.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The most recent case in China was detected on Jan. 3. The minimum incubation period for some viral infections is 15 days, suggesting that it could be a few more days before the authorities are able to determine the full extent of the outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">That timeline has fueled concerns among governments across the region, especially ahead of the Lunar New Year holiday, which begins next week. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/22/world/asia/china-coronavirus-travel.html" title="">Hundreds of millions of people in China<span class="css-8l6xbc evw5hdy0"> </span>are expected to travel</a> during the holiday. Thailand expects more than 300,000 Chinese visitors during the holiday, according to local tourism officials.<span class="css-8l6xbc evw5hdy0"> </span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Hong Kong, Singapore, Thailand and South Korea have taken precautionary measures, quarantining patients with flulike symptoms and increasing temperature screenings at their airports. Japan said it was investigating who the patient there had been in contact with since he returned from China and has asked people who experience symptoms to report them. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">While the new coronavirus appears to be less virulent and deadly than SARS, many questions remain, including the source of the virus and its transmission route. Infectious disease experts say the source is very likely to be a mammal because coronaviruses spread easily from mammals to humans. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Coronaviruses are a large family of viruses that infect animals and people. Symptoms of different coronaviruses can include those that resemble the common cold, influenza or pneumonia. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“There’s no need to panic but I think there needs to be an urgency to address these questions,” said Dr. Peiris of the University of Hong Kong. “The problem is that most of these animals are illegally sold, so that might not be so easy to do.” </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Dr. Peiris said he was encouraged that there were no cases of hospital workers falling ill, reducing the likelihood of a widespread outbreak within the community, as there had been with SARS.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Guan Yi, a professor of infectious diseases at the University of Hong Kong, said he was also reassured that the Wuhan government had not reported any new cases in recent days.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“If there are no new cases in the next few days, the outbreak is over,” said Dr. Guan, who was part of a team that successfully identified the coronavirus that caused SARS. </p>, <p class="css-jwz2nf etfikam0">Eimi Yamamitsu contributed reporting from Tokyo, and Hannah Beech and Muktita Suhartono from Bangkok. Elsie Chen contributed research from Beijing.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"></p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <h1 class="css-1s4ffep e1h9rw200" id="link-f8374b3" itemprop="headline"><span>Three U.S. Airports to Check Passengers for a Deadly Chinese Coronavirus</span></h1>, <p class="css-1ifw933 e1wiw3jv0" id="article-summary">Passengers from Wuhan, China, will be screened at J.F.K. beginning Friday night, and in San Francisco and Los Angeles starting on Saturday.</p>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/denise-grady"><span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Denise Grady</span></a></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Airports in New York, San Francisco and Los Angeles will begin screening passengers arriving from Wuhan, China, for infection with a mysterious respiratory virus that has killed two people and sickened at least 45 overseas, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention announced on Friday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Most people with the infection are believed to have contracted it through exposure to animals at a market that sells seafood and meat in Wuhan. It is not certain that the virus spreads from person to person.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But a few cases have not been linked to animals, and researchers say some human-to-human transmission may be possible. Related viruses, called SARS and MERS, have led to enormous, deadly outbreaks in recent years.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">[Read: </em><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/21/world/asia/china-coronavirus-australia-wuhan-travel.html" title=""><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">China’s coronavirus outbreak tests the transparency of China’s Communist Party</em></a><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">.]</em></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“This is a serious situation,” Dr. Nancy Messonnier, the director of the National Center for Immunization and Respiratory Diseases, said at a news briefing. “We know it is crucial to be proactive and prepared.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But while there will probably be cases in the United States at some point, “we believe the current risk from the virus to the general public is low,” she added.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The C.D.C. is also developing a diagnostic test that will be sent to hospitals and state health departments to determine whether people are infected.</p>, <h1 class="g-headline" id="g-inlineguide-headline">The Coronavirus Outbreak</h1>, <h2 class="g-inlineguide-list-header g-optimize-type">What do you need to know? Start here.</h2>, <p class="g-inlineguide-date">Updated Feb. 10, 2020</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">About 100 experts from the C.D.C. are being deployed to the three airports. The first flight to be screened will arrive at New York’s Kennedy International Airport on Friday night, Dr. Martin Cetron, director of the C.D.C.’s division of global migration and quarantine, said at a news briefing.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">J.F.K. is the only airport in New York where the screening will take place. Screenings at San Francisco International and Los Angeles International will begin on Saturday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">About 60,000 to 65,000 people a year travel to the United States from Wuhan. Over the next few weeks, some 5,000 passengers are likely to be checked for signs of the new infection, Dr. Cetron said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Only New York and San Francisco receive direct flights from Wuhan; passengers arriving in Los Angeles are on connecting flights.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Travelers will be asked to fill out questionnaires asking if they have symptoms like a cough or a fever, and whether they have visited meat and seafood markets in Wuhan, the epicenter of the outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Screeners will also use thermal scanners that can be pointed at the forehead or temple to look for fever. People with signs of illness will be examined further, along with family members or others traveling with them.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Those who seem likely to be infected with the virus will be sent to area hospitals for further testing and treatment. Dr. Cetron said hospitals in each city had been designated to handle possible cases, but declined to name them.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">It may not be easy to identify likely cases at airports, because the flu season is well underway, and winter is the peak period for common colds and other respiratory viruses that can cause coughing, fever and runny noses.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The screening could take time, Dr. Cetron said, and some passengers may miss connecting flights.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The illness was first reported in late December in Wuhan, in central China. Fears of a more widespread outbreak arose when two cases were found in Thailand and one in Japan, apparently carried to those countries by air travelers from Wuhan.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">[</em></strong><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="http://on.fb.me/1paTQ1h" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title=""><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">Like the Science Times page on Facebook.</em></a></strong><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0"> </em></strong><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">| Sign up for the </em><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="http://nyti.ms/1MbHaRU" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title=""><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">Science Times newsletter.</em></a></strong><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">]</em></strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The disease is caused by a coronavirus, a member of a family of viruses that can cause respiratory ailments ranging from colds to pneumonia.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A different coronavirus caused the SARS outbreak that began in 2003. It originated in China and was spread to other countries by travelers, infecting more than 8,000 people and killing nearly 800.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">That virus is also believed to have jumped to humans from animals at markets selling meat, poultry and sometimes live animals like civets. SARS turned out to be highly contagious among humans.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A coronavirus is also the cause of <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/mers/index.html" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">MERS, another severe respiratory ailment</a> that has been present in Saudi Arabia and other Middle Eastern countries since 2012.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The MERS virus is carried by camels, and most cases have resulted from contact with the animals, but infected people can spread it to one another. The death rate is high, from 30 percent to 40 percent of patients.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The new coronavirus appears to cause a less serious illness than SARS or MERS. But Dr. Cetron and Dr. Messonnier warned that the infection is new, little is known about it and the situation is rapidly evolving.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“Humility is important,” Dr. Cetron said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The severity of SARS and MERS puts health officials on high alert when dealing with new coronaviruses, Dr. Messonnier said. If the virus is jumping from animals to humans for the first time — which may be the case in the current outbreak — people almost certainly have no immunity to it.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Whether the new coronavirus is contagious among people is not clear. The best treatment is not known, and there is no vaccine.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“It doesn’t take much for a virus in general to go from being worrisome to being extremely worrisome, because they tend to morph and mutate a lot,” Dr. Messonnier said.</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]

<span class="byline last-byline" itemprop="author creator" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
      By <span class="byline-author" data-byline-name="TOBY BILANOW" itemprop="name">TOBY BILANOW</span>

<time class="dateline" content="2020-01-17" datetime="2020-01-17" itemprop="dateModified">JAN. 17, 2020</time>

</p>, <p>People who trained and ran a first marathon, many of them older, showed arteries that looked about how many years younger?</p>, <p>1 year</p>, <p>2 years</p>, <p>4 years</p>, <p>Running a marathon did not affect blood vessel health</p>, <p>Since 1851, when the 98.6 normal body temperature was established, body temperatures appear to be:</p>, <p>Dropping</p>, <p>Rising</p>, <p>Body temperatures have remained steady</p>, <p>Deaths from alcohol are rising, particularly among this group:</p>, <p>Men</p>, <p>Women</p>, <p>Teenagers</p>, <p>Seniors</p>, <p>A potentially fatal pneumonia-like illness in China that has spread to Thailand and Japan has been traced to a new strain of this virus:</p>, <p>Influenza</p>, <p>Herpesvirus</p>, <p>Coronavirus</p>, <p>Rhinovirus</p>, <p>Compared to men, women tend to get high blood pressure at:</p>, <p>Younger ages</p>, <p>Older ages</p>, <p>Men and women show similar patterns of high blood pressure</p>, <p>Which statement about sickle cell disease is <i>not</i> true?</p>, <p>Sickle cell disease is caused by a gene mutation</p>, <p>Africans are most commonly affected by sickle cell disease</p>, <p>Symptoms typically first appear in the teenage years</p>, <p>The disease causes progressive damage over time</p>, <p>Activists in New Jersey swayed legislators to drop a bill that would have ended religious exemptions for:</p>, <p>School prayer</p>, <p>Vaccinations</p>, <p>Providing health services to LGBT people </p>, <p>Health insurance</p>, <h2 class="section-heading"></h2>, <h2 class="story-heading">Weekly Health Quiz: Migraine, Fruit and a Mysterious Illness</h2>, <h2 class="story-heading">Weekly Health Quiz: Sugar, Brain Health and Foods for Sleep</h2>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="visually-hidden">Site Information Navigation</h2>, <h2 class="visually-hidden">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <h1 class="css-1s4ffep e1h9rw200" id="link-32ae7349" itemprop="headline"><span>Deadly Mystery Virus Reported in 2 New Chinese Cities and South Korea</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/javier-c-hernandez"><span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Javier C. Hernández</span></a></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BEIJING — The authorities in China reported a third death from a <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/08/health/china-pneumonia-outbreak-virus.html" title="">mysterious virus</a> and more than 130 new cases over the weekend, including ones found in Beijing and southern China for the first time. One new case was also reported in South Korea on Monday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The jump in cases raised questions about how the virus is being transmitted and added to concerns about the spread of the illness ahead of <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/22/world/asia/china-coronavirus-travel.html" title="">China’s busiest travel season</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The health commission in Wuhan, a central Chinese city where the virus originated last month, said early Monday that 136 new cases had been detected on Saturday and Sunday, including one who died. Nine patients in the city remained critically ill.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Two new cases were reported in Beijing, and one in Shenzhen, a booming metropolis in the south, near Hong Kong. That brought the total number of cases in China to around 200, more than double the number reported just a day earlier.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The latest cases come amid growing concern among some experts that the outbreak could be more severe than China’s government has described.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">[Read: </em><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/20/world/asia/coronavirus-china-symptoms.html" title=""><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">What we know about China’s new coronavirus</em></a><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">.]</em></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The virus already appears to have spread outside China, with the authorities in South Korea reporting on Monday that a Chinese woman who arrived at the Incheon International Airport on Sunday from Wuhan had tested positive for the illness. Last week, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/15/world/asia/coronavirus-japan-china.html" title="">three cases</a> were reported in Thailand and Japan involving people who had traveled through Wuhan.</p>, <h1 class="g-headline" id="g-inlineguide-headline">The Coronavirus Outbreak</h1>, <h2 class="g-inlineguide-list-header g-optimize-type">What do you need to know? Start here.</h2>, <p class="g-inlineguide-date">Updated Feb. 10, 2020</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">And with hundreds of millions of people in China expected to travel for the Lunar New Year holiday, which begins Friday, public health officials are working to stop a major outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">On Sunday, China’s central government sought to reassure the public that it had the situation under control. In Beijing’s most extensive remarks on the outbreak since it began last month, the National Health Commission said that experts agreed that an epidemic was “still preventable and controllable.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Still, the commission acknowledged that the source of the virus and its path of transmission were not fully understood.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“The mutation of the virus still needs to be closely monitored,” the statement said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Of the new patients found in Wuhan over the weekend, 66 were men and 70 women, and their ages ranged from 25 to 89, the health commission reported on Monday. It said that they mostly had symptoms such as fever, coughing and difficulty breathing.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Most people with the infection have contracted it through exposure to animals at a market in Wuhan that sells seafood and live animals, the authorities say. But the health commission in Wuhan said on Sunday that some people who had come down with the virus had no exposure to the market.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">That acknowledgment raises the possibility that the virus could be present in other markets in Wuhan, experts said, adding to fears that more people might be at risk.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“If you cannot find the source and control the source of the virus, you cannot extinguish the fire,” said David Hui, the director of the Stanley Ho Center for Emerging Infectious Diseases at the Chinese University of Hong Kong.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Dr. Hui said the risk of the virus spreading from human to human on a broad scale appeared to be low, though he noted that the virus could mutate.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The World Health Organization said on Sunday that while its analysis indicated that limited transmission of the virus is possible, it remained unclear whether it can easily spread from one person to another. The group said it would continue to examine the issue.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“We do not have enough evidence to evaluate the full extent of human-to-human transmission,” its Manila office said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Some experts have suggested that there are probably far more cases of the illness than the authorities have disclosed. In previous incidents, like the 2003 outbreak of severe acute respiratory syndrome, or SARS, the Chinese government <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2003/05/23/world/sars-epidemic-health-politics-some-chinese-say-government-s-response-epidemic.html" title="">withheld critical information</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">One estimate by researchers at Imperial College London suggested on Friday that there could now be <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.imperial.ac.uk/mrc-global-infectious-disease-analysis/news--wuhan-coronavirus/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">as many as 1,700 cases</a> of the new virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The W.H.O. said on Sunday that China could potentially confirm more cases in the coming days and weeks as more people were screened for it.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The new virus has brought back memories of <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2003/04/27/world/the-sars-epidemic-the-path-from-china-s-provinces-a-crafty-germ-breaks-out.html" title="">the SARS outbreak</a>, which was also caused by a coronavirus. SARS, which is believed to have jumped to humans from animals at markets, originated in China and spread to other countries, infecting more than 8,000 people and killing more than 800.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">While the new coronavirus appears to be less severe than SARS, public health officials around the world are exercising caution.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">On Friday, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention in the United States announced that airports in New York, San Francisco and Los Angeles would begin <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/17/health/china-coronavirus-airport-screening.html" title="">screening passengers from Wuhan</a> for the virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">W. Ian Lipkin, a Columbia University professor who worked to fight the SARS outbreak, said it was too early to know how dangerous the new virus might prove to be.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“Until it becomes capable of human-to-human transmission, there’s not a major threat of a pandemic,” said Dr. Lipkin, the director of the Center for Infection and Immunity at the university’s Mailman School of Public Health.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“We need to prepare for the possibility that this could be a larger outbreak, and it could become a pandemic,” he said. “But that doesn’t mean that it will.”</p>, <p class="css-jwz2nf etfikam0">Choe Sang-Hun contributed reporting from Seoul. Elsie Chen, Albee Zhang and Claire Fu contributed research.</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <h1 class="css-1s4ffep e1h9rw200" id="link-3203fee9" itemprop="headline"><span>China Confirms New Coronavirus Spreads From Humans to Humans</span></h1>, <p class="css-1ifw933 e1wiw3jv0" id="article-summary">A top Chinese government-appointed expert says a mysterious respiratory illness that has killed at least four people can be transmitted by humans, heightening concern about the outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/javier-c-hernandez"><span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Javier C. Hernández</span></a> and <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/austin-ramzy"><span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Austin Ramzy</span></a></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">WUHAN, China — The mysterious coronavirus that has killed at least four people and sickened more than 200 in China is capable of spreading from person to person, a prominent Chinese scientist said on Monday, adding to fears of a broader epidemic.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The disclosure increased pressure on the Chinese government to contain a growing public health crisis, just as China enters its <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/22/world/asia/china-coronavirus-travel.html" title="">busiest travel season of the year</a>. On Tuesday, the authorities confirmed a <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="http://wjw.wuhan.gov.cn/front/web/showDetail/2020012109083" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">fourth death</a> from the illness in the central Chinese city of Wuhan.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The authorities had previously said <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/21/health/what-is-coronavirus.html" title="">the deadly virus</a> seemed capable of spreading only from animals to humans in most cases, tracing the outbreak to a market in Wuhan.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But in recent days at least two people have become infected with the pneumonialike virus even though they live hundreds of miles from Wuhan, experts said on Monday, suggesting that the illness is spreading from person to person.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“Now we can say it is certain that it is a human-to-human transmission phenomenon,” Dr. Zhong Nanshan, a scientist who is leading a government-appointed expert panel on the outbreak, said in an interview on state-run television on Monday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The World Health Organization announced Monday that it was convening an emergency meeting on Wednesday “to ascertain whether the outbreak constitutes a public health emergency of international concern, and what recommendations should be made to manage it.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Millions of Chinese are traveling this week for the Lunar New Year holiday, adding to fears that the virus could spread swiftly and on a broader scale. Experts said the severity of the outbreak would now depend on how many people, on average, a person with virus could infect.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“There are now sufficient cases that it’s not going to die out by chance,” said Neil Ferguson, a public health expert at Imperial College London who has studied the new virus. “The real question now is, how efficiently can this virus spread from person to person?”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China’s leader, Xi Jinping, said on Monday that the outbreak “must be taken seriously” and that every possible measure should be taken to contain it, according to the state broadcaster CCTV.</p>, <h1 class="g-headline" id="g-inlineguide-headline">The Coronavirus Outbreak</h1>, <h2 class="g-inlineguide-list-header g-optimize-type">What do you need to know? Start here.</h2>, <p class="g-inlineguide-date">Updated Feb. 10, 2020</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Also on Monday, the authorities reported that new cases had been detected for the first time in Beijing, Shanghai and the southern province of Guangdong, all hundreds of miles from Wuhan. Cases have also been reported in Japan, South Korea and Thailand. In many of these cases, people infected with the virus had traveled to Wuhan.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Here is what we know about the virus, where it has been found, how it is spreading and what precautions are being taken:</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-1cc6a8ba">The virus emerged in the city of Wuhan.</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The government of Wuhan <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/06/world/asia/china-SARS-pneumonialike.html" title="">first confirmed on Dec. 31</a> that hospitals in the city were treating dozens of patients for pneumonia with an unknown cause.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Many of the cases were connected to the Huanan Seafood Market, which also sold live poultry and exotic animal meats. Considered a likely source of the virus, the market was closed and disinfected.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The health commission in Wuhan said on Sunday that the illness had also appeared in people who had not been exposed to the market, raising the possibility that the virus could be present elsewhere in the city.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Local officials have pledged to handle the outbreak with transparency. But the memory of how China initially covered up the extent of <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2003/04/27/world/the-sars-epidemic-the-path-from-china-s-provinces-a-crafty-germ-breaks-out.html" title="">a deadly SARS outbreak</a> that infected more than 8,000 people in 2002 and 2003 has not completely faded. Although flu experts have said the Chinese government is trying to be more transparent now, many in China remain skeptical.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Over the weekend, the number of reported cases <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/18/world/asia/china-virus-wuhan-coronavirus.html" title="">more than tripled to about 200</a>, mostly in Wuhan. One more person in the city died, bringing the total death toll to three, while nine others remained critically ill, the city’s health commission said. Twenty-five people have recovered.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The authorities have started detecting the country’s first cases outside of Wuhan. Five new cases were reported in Beijing, 14 in Guangdong Province, and two in Shanghai. The total number of cases climbed to at least 219.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The World Health Organization said the spike in reported cases was the result of <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://twitter.com/WHO/status/1219026530636091392" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">increased searching and testing</a> for respiratory illnesses.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-4b7c1708">The virus now appears to spread between humans.</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Researchers in China <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/08/health/china-pneumonia-outbreak-virus.html" title="">identified the mysterious pneumonialike illness</a> in early January as a new coronavirus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Experts initially said that it did not appear to be readily spread by humans, but on Monday Dr. Zhong, the scientist appointed by the government to study the outbreak, said that in Guangdong, two individuals appeared to have been infected by relatives who had traveled to Wuhan.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Dr. Zhong said the virus could be present in particles of saliva. In one case, he said, a patient appears to have infected 14 medical workers.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Coronaviruses are named for the spikes that protrude from their membranes, like the sun’s corona. Such viruses cause several illnesses of the respiratory tract, ranging from the common cold to severe diseases like SARS. Dr. Zhong was China’s <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2005/05/15/health/after-its-epidemic-arrival-sars-vanishes.html" title="">leading SARS expert</a> during that outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">According <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.who.int/health-topics/coronavirus" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">to the World Health Organization</a>, common signs of infection include fever, cough, and respiratory difficulties like shortness of breath. Serious cases can lead to pneumonia, kidney failure and even death.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-9f16ce7">Cases have been reported outside China.</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/15/world/asia/coronavirus-japan-china.html" title="">authorities in Thailand detected the new coronavirus</a> last week in two Chinese women who had flown from Wuhan to Bangkok on separate trips. The government said the women, aged 74 and 61, were in good condition.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In Japan, a Chinese man who returned from Wuhan on Jan. 6 was also confirmed to have the disease. He was discharged after five days in a hospital.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">South Korea confirmed its first case of the coronavirus on Monday in a 35-year-old Chinese woman from Wuhan who arrived on Sunday at Incheon International Airport, which serves Seoul.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The woman was found with a fever, muscle pain and other symptoms while going through customs and was immediately quarantined for tests, said Jung Eun-kyeong, director of the Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The woman was traveling with five other people intending to spend the Lunar New Year holidays in South Korea and Japan, Ms. Jung said. South Korean officials were running tests on anyone believed to have come in contact with the woman in the plane, she said.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-44fceb74">Officials have implemented precautionary measures.</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In Hong Kong, the government <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.info.gov.hk/gia/general/202001/04/P2020010400179.htm" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">initiated a disease response plan</a> after the first cases were reported in Wuhan. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.chp.gov.hk/files/pdf/enhanced_sur_pneumonia_wuhan_eng.pdf" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">Dozens of people were hospitalized</a> after returning to Hong Kong from mainland China, but none were found to have been infected with the new virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Five people who traveled from Wuhan to Zhejiang, a coastal Chinese province south of Shanghai, are being treated for fever but have not been diagnosed with the new coronavirus, the health authorities there said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">State media also reported six suspected cases on Monday, including two in Sichuan Province, one in Shanghai, one in Yunnan Province, one in Shandong Province and one in the region of Guangxi.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In the southern city of Shenzhen, the authorities have started imposing temperature screening procedures at the airport and at train and bus stations. The city said it would also crack down on the illegal trading of wild animals.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-32956296">Animals appear to be the most likely source.</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The W.H.O. says animals appear to be the most likely primary source of the outbreak, though it is still not known which animals are responsible.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Past outbreaks of similar illnesses, like SARS, were believed to have emerged from markets where people and live animals were in regular contact.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">To prevent the spread of respiratory infections, the W.H.O. recommends that people wash their hands regularly, cover their mouths and noses when coughing and sneezing, and avoid direct contact with farm or wild animals.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The health authorities in Hong Kong <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.chp.gov.hk/en/features/102465.html" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">have also advised residents</a> traveling outside the city not to touch live animals, not to eat wild animals, and to avoid markets selling fresh meat and live poultry.</p>, <p class="css-jwz2nf etfikam0">Javier C. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/javier-c-hernandez" title="">Hernández</a> reported from Wuhan and Austin Ramzy reported from Hong Kong. Choe Sang-Hun contributed reporting from Seoul, South Korea. Elsie Chen contributed research from Wuhan, and Albee Zhang contributed research from Beijing.</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <h1 class="css-1s4ffep e1h9rw200" id="link-3465f0ec" itemprop="headline"><span>Virginia, Davos, Coco Gauff: Your Monday Evening Briefing</span></h1>, <p class="css-1ifw933 e1wiw3jv0" id="article-summary">Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.</p>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/victoria-shannon"><span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Victoria Shannon</span></a> and <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/hiroko-masuike"><span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Hiroko Masuike</span></a></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">(Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s </em><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="http://www.nytimes.com/newsletters/nyt-now-evening-briefing?module=inline" title=""><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">the sign-up</em></a><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">.) </em></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">Good evening. Here’s the latest.</em></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">1. This was the capital today. </strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">President Trump and Vice President Mike Pence visited the Martin Luther King Jr. Memorial in Washington to honor the civil rights leader’s federal holiday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">And the House impeachment managers and the president’s defense team took turns touring the Senate chamber and surrounding offices, transformed into a court for <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/20/us/politics/trump-legal-team-asks-senate-for-speedy-acquittal-in-impeachment-trial.html" title="">the nation’s third-ever impeachment trial</a>, which opens Tuesday with a debate on rules for the proceedings.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Mr. Trump’s legal team called on the Senate to “swiftly reject” the impeachment charges and acquit him, arguing that Democrats would “permanently weaken the presidency” if they succeeded in removing him from office over what the team characterized as policy and political differences.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">2. Thousands of pro-gun advocates,</strong> many of them armed, converged in Virginia.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">They gathered outside the Virginia State Capitol in Richmond, most in an area where guns were allowed, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/20/us/virginia-gun-rally.html" title="">to oppose a series of gun-control measures being considered in the State Legislature</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Despite fears of potential violence, as of this writing there were no official reports of skirmishes or major incidents among the 22,000 in attendance, with 16,000 outside the perimeter and 6,000 inside.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“It was like a family gathering,” said one protester who drove from Texas to participate.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The State Senate last week approved three gun control bills, which the House of Delegates could approve as early as this week.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">3. A united front for Democrats.</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Several Democratic presidential candidates — including Senators Bernie Sanders and Elizabeth Warren — put aside their recent sparring and <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/20/us/politics/democratic-candidates-mlk-day.html" title="">marched arm in arm through the streets of South Carolina’s capital</a> to honor Dr. King.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Former Vice President Joe Biden has a strong lead in South Carolina polls and is widely favored among black voters. His rivals didn’t take him on directly but sought to make the case to African-Americans about how the next president could benefit their interests.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">After the march, most of the candidates headed to an Iowa forum focused on minority communities, a scant two weeks before the state caucuses there.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">4. A deadly Boeing 737 crash in 2009</strong> held lessons that were never learned.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Documents and interviews show that the Dutch Safety Board either <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/20/business/boeing-737-accidents.html" title="">excluded or played down criticisms of the plane manufacturer</a> in its final report on a crash near Amsterdam, after pushback from a team of Americans that included Boeing and federal safety officials.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The muted criticism fits within a broader pattern, brought to light since the more recent 737 Max tragedies, of how the company has benefited from a light touch by safety officials.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In the 2009 crash and the Max accidents, the failure of a single sensor caused systems to misfire, and Boeing had not provided pilots with information that could have helped them react to the malfunction.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">5. Just don’t call it climate change.</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">States that apply for billions of dollars in a federal natural-disaster program must first explain why they need the money. And <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/20/climate/climate-change-funding-states.html" title="">some conservative states feel compelled to avoid mentioning climate change</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A 306-page draft proposal from Texas — hit by Hurricane Harvey, above, in 2017 — doesn’t use the term, nor does South Carolina’s. Louisiana includes it in an appendix on the final page.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">There are exceptions, like Florida. “Climate change is a key overarching challenge which threatens to compound the extent and effects of hazards,” state officials wrote in their application.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">6. Disposable plastic’s new enemy: China.</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The government introduced measures to <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/20/world/asia/china-plastic.html" title="">drastically cut the amount of disposable plastic items</a> like bags and cutlery.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Previous efforts to reduce the use of plastic bags have faltered in China, but the government has indicated that, this time, it will be more serious and systematic in tackling the problem.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Chinese generally generate less plastic waste per capita than Americans, but almost three-quarters of China’s ends up in poorly managed landfills, or out in the open.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">7. A new view of President Trump at Davos.</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Mr. Trump leaves tonight for the World Economic Forum in<span class="css-8l6xbc evw5hdy0"> </span>Switzerland, where he is likely to see <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/20/business/dealbook/donald-trump-davos.html" title="">an increasing sense of acceptance</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The U.S.’s growing economy, stock market boom and trade deals speak loudly to C.E.O.s, our DealBook columnist Andrew Ross Sorkin writes.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">For this year’s forum as a whole, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/20/business/energy-environment/davos-climate-change.html" title="">climate change</a> is at the top of the priorities. Several groups will be pushing companies toward greater disclosure and action on emissions. The question for many is: Will all the talk matter?</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">8. A virus in China </strong>grows more threatening.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A top Chinese government-appointed expert says <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/20/world/asia/coronavirus-china-symptoms.html" title="">a new respiratory virus</a> is now being transmitted human to human, heightening fears of a possible pandemic.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The World Health Organization said it was convening an emergency meeting on Wednesday to evaluate the risk of the newly identified coronavirus. The known death toll so far is three, but human transmission could vastly expand its range.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Chinese authorities said cases had been detected for the first time in Beijing, Shanghai and Shenzhen, far from the original outbreak focused on a live-animal market in Wuhan. Cases have also been reported in Japan, South Korea and Thailand.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">9. “I think the sky’s the limit for her.”</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">That’s the tennis star Venus Williams talking about <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/20/sports/tennis/coco-gauff-venus-williams.html" title="">15-year-old Coco Gauff</a>, who beat Williams in first-round action at the <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/19/sports/tennis/australian-open.html" title="">Australian Open</a> in Melbourne today.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Elsewhere in Australia, dozens of fires are still burning, some out of control, in New South Wales and Victoria.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But some places were hit by <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/20/world/australia/weather-hail-sydney-canberra.html" title="">hailstones as large as baseballs</a>, wind gusts topping 70 miles per hour and an inch of rain in just 30 minutes. Thousands of people were left without power.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">10.<span class="css-8l6xbc evw5hdy0"> </span>Who’s at the door?</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Dramas are being performed daily on a new American stage: the front porch.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Images from <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/19/style/ring-video-doorbell-home-security.html" title="">video-enabled doorbells</a> linked to smartphones are meant to let owners see and speak with visitors. But more than 500 police departments have partnered with Ring, the surveillance-device maker acquired by Amazon, to use them to help solve crimes.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Not everyone is aware of the camera, which captures everything from the boring to the surprising. How about <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JaW5HbWtWbU" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">a dog who figures out how to ring the bell</a>?</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Have a resourceful evening.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">Your Evening Briefing is posted at 6 p.m. Eastern.</em></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">And don’t miss Your Morning Briefing. </em><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/briefing/global-morning-briefing-newsletter-signup.html" title=""><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">Sign up here</em></a><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0"> to get it by email in the Australian, Asian, European, African or American morning.</em></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">Want to catch up on past briefings? </em><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/series/us-evening-briefing" title=""><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">You can browse them here</em></a><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">.</em></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">What did you like? What do you want to see here? Let us know at </em><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="mailto:briefing@nytimes.com?subject=Evening%20Briefing%20Feedback" title=""><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">briefing@nytimes.com</em></a><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">.</em></p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <h1 class="css-1s4ffep e1h9rw200" id="link-3a61918f" itemprop="headline"><span>Chinese Virus, Boeing, Australia Weather: Your Tuesday Briefing</span></h1>, <p class="css-1ifw933 e1wiw3jv0" id="article-summary">Here’s what you need to know.</p>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/melina-delkic"><span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Melina Delkic</span></a></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s the <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/morning-briefing" title="">sign-up</a>.)</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">Good morning.</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">We’re covering the spread of a <strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">mysterious virus </strong>across Asia, why important details of a <strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Boeing crash</strong> from a decade ago were suppressed and the frisky<strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"> history of cocktails</strong>.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-6d6b7bc0">Viral ailment spreads in Asia, feeding fears of pandemic</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The coronavirus causing a new respiratory illness is <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/20/world/asia/coronavirus-china-symptoms.html" title="">now capable of spreading from person to person</a>, a prominent Chinese scientist said on Monday, as the authorities reported a third death and doubled the number of cases from a day earlier, including in Beijing and southern China for the first time.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Cases have also been reported in Japan, South Korea and Thailand.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">With hundreds of millions of people in China expected to travel for the Lunar New Year holiday, which begins Friday, public health officials are working to forestall a major outbreak.
