class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-79476269">If you have 8 minutes, this is worth it</h3>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-798f2350">The risky journey to Europe</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">After the great migration of 2015 — in which more than a million undocumented people landed in Europe — the authorities in Turkey, Greece and Hungary responded by reducing undocumented migration by more than 90 percent.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Now, migrants who risk the journey to Europe travel up and over <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/24/world/europe/bosnia-european-migrant-crises.html" title="">the icy hills and mountains that line Bosnia’s border with Croatia</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The terrain, pictured above, contains land mines from the Balkan wars. And the Croatian authorities typically force all who cross safely to turn around, without letting them apply for asylum.</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-554e6082">Here’s what else is happening</h3>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Impeachment:</strong> John Bolton, the former U.S. national security adviser, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/us/politics/trump-bolton-book-ukraine.html" title="">writes in a book draft</a> that President Trump wanted to continue freezing $391 million in security assistance to Ukraine until officials there investigated his political rivals. The revelation could complicate the case that Mr. Trump’s lawyers <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/us/politics/trump-impeachment-ukraine-russia.html" title="">plan to make at his impeachment trial</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Israeli politics: </strong>Middle East experts see the Trump administration’s long-awaited peace plan for the region — which the president is expected to lay out when he meets Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel in Washington today — <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/world/middleeast/trump-netanyahu-middle-east-plan.html" title="">mainly as a “booster shot”</a> for Mr. Netanyahu’s desperate campaign to stay in power.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Retired basketball star dies:</strong> Kobe Bryant and his 13-year-old daughter were <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/sports/basketball/kobe-bryant-helicopter-crash.html" title="">among the nine people killed in a helicopter crash</a> outside Los Angeles on Sunday. His death generated an outpouring of grief across the United States and beyond.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Surveillance in London: </strong>Privacy groups <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/24/business/london-police-facial-recognition.html" title="">criticized a decision by the city’s Police Department</a> to begin using facial recognition technology that identifies people on a police watch list as soon as they are filmed on a video camera.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Snapshot: </strong>Above, an archipelago off England’s southwestern coast that is part of Prince Charles’s Duchy of Cornwall. The private estate behaves like a corporation, but <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/world/europe/harry-meghan-charles-duchy-of-cornwall.html" title="">uses its royal status to skirt corporate and capital gains taxes</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Grammy Awards:</strong> Billie Eilish won record, album and song of the year, but Kobe Bryant’s death overshadowed the ceremony. We have<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/arts/music/grammy-awards.html" title=""> live updates</a>, a <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/arts/music/grammy-winners.html" title="">rundown of who won</a> and <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/01/26/style/grammys-red-carpet-moments.html" title="">a look at red carpet fashion</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">What we’re reading: </strong>This <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.bostonglobe.com/2020/01/23/metro/is-fda-ready-next-e-coli-outbreak/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">Boston Globe investigation</a> of the government’s inaction on E. coli outbreaks. The story of a 2-year-old boy who ate some of his father’s salad and developed the illness is “heartbreaking, terrifying and riveting,” writes our Times Insider editor, Jennifer Krauss. </p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-7ded7ef4">Now, a break from the news</h3>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Cook: </strong><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://cooking.nytimes.com/recipes/1020815-slow-cooker-red-beans-and-rice" title="">Slow cooker red beans and rice</a> takes only about 20 minutes to set up in the morning.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Go: </strong><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/24/arts/music/kirill-petrenko-berlin-philharmonic.html" title="">Our critic writes</a> that the<strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"> </strong>Berlin Philharmonic is playing with “enthusiasm and virtually flawless precision” under its new chief conductor, Kirill Petrenko.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Smarter Living: </strong>Wirecutter recommends five cheap(ish) things to radically <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/22/smarter-living/5-cheap-ish-things-to-radically-make-over-your-closet.html" title="">make over your cluttered closet</a>.</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-15767e9b">And now for the Back Story on …</h3>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-10ec9a2c">Bill Clinton’s impeachment</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">We asked Peter Baker, our chief White House correspondent, to reflect on a major moment in the lead-up to the last presidential impeachment and compare it with the current trial. He has covered both.</em></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Twenty-two years ago this week came a milestone moment in the last presidential impeachment drama. President <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/video/politics/bill-clinton-i-did-not-have-sexual-relations-with-that-woman/2018/01/25/4a953c22-0221-11e8-86b9-8908743c79dd_video.html" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">Bill Clinton was on the defensive</a> after The Washington Post, where I was working then, broke the news that Ken Starr was investigating whether he committed perjury to cover up an affair with a onetime White House intern.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Mr. Clinton took to the microphone at the end of an event, glared angrily at the reporters in the room, wagged his finger and, with Hillary Clinton standing behind him, forcefully said, “I did not have sexual relations with that woman, Miss Lewinsky.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">We were struck by two things: One, that he seemed to briefly blank on her name, referring to her as “that woman,” before summoning it. But the second was the intensity of his denial. He was white-hot mad. At that time, before the DNA and the grand jury testimony, we didn’t know if the story we were pursuing was bogus or if the president of the United States was lying to us and to the country. Of course, later we found out which it was.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Now, as Ken Starr re-emerges as a lawyer for President Trump in the current impeachment trial, and the administration’s explanations of what happened continue to fluctuate, it’s <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/19/us/politics/clinton-impeachment-trial.html" title="">hard not to feel déjà vu</a>.</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">That’s it for this briefing. See you next time. </p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">— Mike</p>, <p class="css-jwz2nf etfikam0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Thank you</strong><br/>To Mark Josephson and Eleanor Stanford for the break from the news. You can reach the team at <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="mailto:briefing+midnight@nytimes.com?subject=Briefing%20Feedback" title="">briefing@nytimes.com</a>.</p>, <p class="css-jwz2nf etfikam0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">P.S.</strong><br/>• We’re listening to “<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/thedaily" title="">The Daily</a>.” Our latest episode is about how the issue of fracking could determine who wins the swing state of Pennsylvania in the 2020 election.<br/>• Here’s today’s <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/crosswords/game/mini" title="">Mini Crossword puzzle</a>, and a clue: Chunk of ice (four letters). <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/crosswords" title="">You can find all our puzzles here</a>.<br/>• Monica Mark is <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytco.com/press/our-next-johannesburg-bureau-chief/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">our next Johannesburg bureau chief</a>. She has covered some of the biggest stories in Africa for Bloomberg News, The Guardian and BuzzFeed News.</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <h1 class="css-1s4ffep e1h9rw200" id="link-526f492d" itemprop="headline"><span>Wuhan Coronavirus, Impeachment, Kobe Bryant: Your Tuesday Briefing</span></h1>, <p class="css-1ifw933 e1wiw3jv0" id="article-summary">Here’s what you need to know.</p>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/melina-delkic"><span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Melina Delkic</span></a></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s the <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/morning-briefing" title="">sign-up</a>.)</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">Good morning.</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">We’re covering the global and economic impacts of the <strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Wuhan coronavirus</strong>, new revelations in the <strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Trump impeachment trial </strong>and an outpouring of grief and thanks for <strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Kobe Bryant</strong>.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-6cfde488">Coronavirus outbreak rattles countries and markets</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The death toll in China from the respiratory illness rose to at least 81. With thousands of new cases, the government extended the Lunar New Year holiday by three days in an effort to limit travel, and the spread of germs at workplaces. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/world/asia/china-coronavirus.html" title="">Here’s the latest</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A lockdown affecting 56 million people could actually be <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/world/asia/coronavirus-wuhan-china-hubei.html" title="">making the situation worse</a>, including by exacerbating shortages of medical supplies, some experts say — though they are divided. Hospital workers are calling for stricter border checks as holiday travelers return, and Chinese officials are racing to contain public anger at the government.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Stocks tumbled and oil prices <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/business/stock-market-today.html" title="">fell on Monday</a> as the virus’s spread worried investors around the globe. China’s currency also fell, while investors moved into safe havens like gold.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">The scope:</strong> Most of the nearly 3,000 people who have contracted the virus live in China, but it has spread to <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/01/21/world/asia/china-coronavirus-maps.html" title="">10 other countries</a>. At least 110 people are being tested for it in the U.S.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Inside China: </strong>In addition to antiviral H.I.V. drugs, the authorities told doctors to prescribe traditional medicine. Hospitals are overwhelmed, as the country does not have a functioning primary care system and people flock to understaffed hospitals even on a normal day. The <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/world/asia/27china-coronavirus-health.html" title="">weaknesses are most pronounced in poorer areas.</a></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Another angle:</strong> Many airlines are accommodating travelers who want to modify, delay or cancel China itineraries. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/travel/Coronavirus-travel.html" title="">Here’s what to know</a>.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-3da91eea">New Trump revelations shake Washington</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Republicans <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2020/impeachment-trial-live-01-27?action=click&amp;module=Top%20Stories&amp;pgtype=Homepage" title="">are in disarray in the wake of details</a> that emerged from a book written by President Trump’s former national security adviser John Bolton, a draft of which was provided to the White House for review on Dec. 30.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Some are angrily pressing the White House in private, saying they were blindsided by the account.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Mr. Bolton’s draft says that Mr. Trump wanted to continue freezing security aid to Ukraine until he got help with investigations into Democrats, an account that dovetails with a central aspect of the Democrats’ impeachment prosecution. Mr. Trump denied having told Mr. Bolton that.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">The impeachment trial: </strong>President Trump’s legal team ignored the Bolton account entirely and doubled down on claims that Mr. Trump withheld aid to Ukraine only because he was concerned about corruption there.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Ken Starr, a key player in the Clinton prosecution who is now serving on the Trump defense, seemed to unite the left and right — <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2020/impeachment-trial-live-01-27/starr-manages-to-unite-the-left-and-the-right-in-boredom#live-blog-list" title="">in boredom</a>, offering a thorough review of impeachment history and legal standards.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Analysis: </strong>Our chief White House correspondent writes that, in an alternate universe, this could have been the moment that changed everything. But in the current era, it’s <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2020/impeachment-trial-live-01-27/starr-manages-to-unite-the-left-and-the-right-in-boredom#live-blog-list" title="">too early to tell if it will matter</a>.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-199936f4">Kobe Bryant: brilliant, complicated, mourned</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Presidents, athletes, celebrities and fans around the world <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/sports/basketball/kobe-bryant-helicopter-crash.html" title="">shared what the basketball legend had meant to them</a>, and thousands attended memorials for Bryant, 41, and the other victims of a helicopter crash that killed everybody on board in Calabasas, Calif.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The nine victims, including Bryant’s daughter Gianna, 13, were traveling to the Mamba Sports Academy, Bryant’s athletic training facility. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/us/who-died-helicopter-crash-kobe-altobelli-chester-zobayan-mauser.html" title="">Other passengers</a> included the pilot, a college baseball coach and a mother and daughter.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Teammates and colleagues <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/sports/basketball/kobe-bryant-oscar-award.html" title="">hailed Bryant</a> as one of the greatest in the game, tearing up in public and in tribute videos. Italy, where he lived from ages 6 to 13, said it would hold moments of silence. Southern <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/us/kobe-bryant-la-california.html" title="">Californians united</a> in their grief.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“Every baby boomer can tell you where they were when they learned that J.F.K. was shot,” writes Sam Dolnick, a Times assistant managing editor. “Now basketball fans have <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/sports/kobe-bryant-fans.html" title="">their own terrible version</a>.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">The crash: </strong>The helicopter had received <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/sports/kobe-bryant-death.html" title="">special approval to fly on Sunday in thick fog</a>. Whether the pilot made the right decision in his route will most likely be at the center of the crash investigation.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Complicated legacy: </strong>Bryant earned 18 All-Star selections, among many other prestigious accolades. A sexual assault allegation against him in 2003 would change how many people saw him, though he remained hugely popular.</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-10467732">If you have 10 minutes, this is worth it</h3>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-89bee7d">When friends share your life online</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Nora Ephron once said: “Everything is copy.” But in 2020, the more apt phrasing may be: “Everything is content.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">More and more people are turning their personal lives into full-time careers on social media. But what happens when their friends aren’t so comfortable being part of the oversharing? It might be <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/style/will-you-be-my-content.html" title="">the big question of the influencer era</a>.</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-554e6082">Here’s what else is happening</h3>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">U.S. immigration:</strong> The Supreme Court allowed the Trump administration to <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/us/supreme-court-trump-green-cards.html" title="">move ahead with plans to deny green cards to immigrants</a> thought likely to even occasionally use public benefits like food stamps and Medicaid. Legal challenges to the policy will continue to move forward in courts around the nation.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Prince Andrew:</strong> Federal prosecutors in the U.S. have sought to interview him about Jeffrey Epstein, the convicted sex offender, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/nyregion/jeffrey-epstein-prince-andrew.html" title="">but he has provided “zero cooperation,”</a> the U.S. attorney in Manhattan said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Los Alamos: </strong>Newly released information on a recently discovered fourth Soviet spy at the wartime New Mexico lab, home to the U.S. atomic bomb program, indicates that <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/science/manhattan-project-nuclear-spy.html" title="">his espionage may have been the most damaging of all</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Grammys:</strong> Billie Eilish, the 18-year-old pop superstar, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/arts/music/grammy-awards.html" title="">swept the top awards with five wins</a>, including record of the year and best new artist. Many used the ceremony in Los Angeles to pay tribute to Kobe Bryant.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Snapshot: </strong>Above, residents returning to their homes in Laurel, the Philippines, a town near the Taal Volcano. The authorities said <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/world/asia/philippines-volcano-taal.html" title="">the danger of a major eruption had subsided</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">What we’re reading: </strong><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2020/02/03/the-magical-thinking-of-the-goop-lab" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">This piece</a> on Gwyneth Paltrow’s new Netflix series, “The Goop Lab.” Our television critic James Poniewozik calls it a “great debut” for The New Yorker’s new TV critic, Doreen St. Félix.</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-7ded7ef4">Now, a break from the news</h3>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Cook: </strong>A<strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"> </strong>quick <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://cooking.nytimes.com/recipes/1019925-italian-wedding-soup-with-turkey-meatballs" title="">Italian wedding soup with turkey meatballs</a> is a flavor-packed weeknight meal.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Read: </strong>The novel <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/22/books/charles-yu-interior-chinatown.html" title="">“Interior Chinatown,”</a> by Charles Yu explores Asian-American stereotypes, something that captivated the writer as he worked on HBO’s “Westworld” and other TV shows.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Smarter Living: </strong>Because small luxuries are sometimes the most essential, we have a <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/realestate/shopping-for-bathmats.html" title="">guide to shopping for bathmats</a>.</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-15767e9b">And now for the Back Story on …</h3>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-545a9ac7">Halting the Great Plague</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">For some British readers, news of <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/23/world/asia/china-coronavirus.html" title="">travel restrictions intended to stop the spread of a deadly virus in central China</a> might have brought to mind a somewhat incongruous image: <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.visitpeakdistrict.com/explore/towns-and-villages/eyam-p680381" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">a village in the English Peak District</a>, where <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.visitpeakdistrict.com/whats-on/eyam-well-dressing-p751941" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">the wells are decorated with flowers each summer</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">This village, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.eyam-museum.org.uk/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">Eyam</a>, became a symbol of self-sacrifice because of its role in <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/education/resources/great-plague/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">England’s last major outbreak of bubonic plague, in 1665</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">That autumn, plague-bearing fleas arrived in Eyam in a bale of cloth from London. As deaths began to mount, the rector of the village church, William Mompesson, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-35064071" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">gathered the villagers and asked them to quarantine themselves</a> to stop the infection from spreading.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Further encouraged by the previous rector, Thomas Stanley, the villagers agreed, and stuck by their agreement, even as <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.eyam-museum.org.uk/assets/files/Eyam-Plague-victims-in-chronological-order.pdf" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">whole families died</a>. (Mr. Mompesson survived, apparently against his expectations, but his wife, Catherine, did not.)</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">When the outbreak ended the following November, 260 people in Eyam had died — by most accounts, that was more than half the population.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But the lives they saved, in villages and larger towns nearby, almost certainly numbered in the thousands.</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">That’s it for this briefing. See you next time.</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">— Melina</p>, <p class="css-jwz2nf etfikam0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Thank you</strong><br/>To Mark Josephson and Eleanor Stanford for the break from the news. Peter Robins, an editor in our London newsroom who grew up about 40 miles from Eyam, wrote today’s Back Story. You can reach the team at <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="mailto:briefing+pm@nytimes.com?subject=Briefing%20Feedback" title="">briefing@nytimes.com</a>.</p>, <p class="css-jwz2nf etfikam0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">P.S.</strong><br/>• We’re listening to “<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/thedaily" title="">The Daily</a>.” Our latest episode is about whether American football is too dangerous for children.<br/>• Here’s our <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/crosswords/game/mini" title="">Mini Crossword</a>, and a clue: Chunk of ice (four letters). <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/crosswords" title="">You can find all our puzzles here</a>.<br/>• The R&amp;D team at The New York Times is working in collaboration with IBM Garage on the <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.newsprovenanceproject.com/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">News Provenance Project</a>, an effort to use blockchain to make valid photo information “travel with” images posted to social media.</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <h1 class="css-1s4ffep e1h9rw200" id="link-3e7799d0" itemprop="headline"><span>John Bolton, Coronavirus, Kobe Bryant: Your Monday Evening Briefing</span></h1>, <p class="css-1ifw933 e1wiw3jv0" id="article-summary">Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.</p>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/victoria-shannon"><span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Victoria Shannon</span></a> and <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/hiroko-masuike"><span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Hiroko Masuike</span></a></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">(Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s </em><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="http://www.nytimes.com/newsletters/nyt-now-evening-briefing?module=inline" title=""><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">the sign-up</em></a><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">.) </em></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">Good evening. Here’s the latest.</em></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">1. New Trump revelations shook Washington.</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Republicans <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2020/impeachment-trial-live-01-27?action=click&amp;module=Top%20Stories&amp;pgtype=Homepage" title="">are in disarray over details</a> that emerged from the draft of a book written by President Trump’s former national security adviser John Bolton.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Part of the account <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/us/politics/trump-bolton-twitter.html" title="">dovetails</a> with a central aspect of the impeachment case: that the president wanted to continue freezing security aid to Ukraine until he got help with investigations into Democrats. Mr. Trump denied telling Mr. Bolton that. Here are<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/us/politics/john-bolton-trump-book-takeaways.html" title=""> five takeaways from Mr. Bolton’s book</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In the impeachment trial, Mr. Trump’s legal team — including Ken Starr, arriving above — ignored the Bolton account entirely and doubled down on claims that the president had withheld aid to Ukraine only because he was concerned about corruption there.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">2. Five cases of a new coronavirus</strong> first identified in China were confirmed in the U.S., and scores of other possible cases are being evaluated.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The virus <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/world/asia/china-coronavirus.html" title="">has infected nearly 3,000 people worldwide</a>, with the vast majority in China,<span class="css-8l6xbc evw5hdy0"> </span>where the death toll reached 81. Above, visitors in Beijing today took precautions.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/business/coronavirus-china-economic-impact.html" title="">Global economic fears</a> are rising, and <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/business/stock-market-today.html" title="">markets are shaking</a>. The S&amp;P 500 fell 1.6 percent, with shares of airlines and companies dependent on tourism from China particularly hard hit. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The outbreak began in Wuhan, a city of 11 million people in central China, where anger over the government response has flooded social media. The <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/technology/china-coronavirus-censorship-social-media.html" title="">sheer volume of criticism</a> and the ways that critics dodge censors are testing Beijing’s ability to control the narrative.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">3. When Kobe Bryant’s helicopter crashed, </strong><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/sports/kobe-bryant-death.html" title="">the fog was so heavy</a>, a witness said people were having trouble driving.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Besides the basketball star and his 13-year-old daughter, the victims included a baseball coach, a veteran pilot, teenage girls and their parents. Here is <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/us/who-died-helicopter-crash-kobe-altobelli-chester-zobayan-mauser.html" title="">what we know about them</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The helicopter went down in rough terrain about 30 miles northwest of downtown Los Angeles, en route from Orange County, Calif., where the Bryant family lives, to Bryant’s youth basketball academy. The L.A. County medical examiner said it could take days to recover the bodies.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">We’ll be watching a news conference called by the National Transportation Safety Board at 7 p.m. Eastern.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">4. The Supreme Court gave a green light</strong> to stricter rules on green cards.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The court’s conservative justices, 5-4, let the Trump administration move forward with <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/us/supreme-court-trump-green-cards.html" title="">plans to deny permanent legal status to immigrants</a> thought to be more likely to make even minor use of public benefits like Medicaid, food stamps and housing vouchers.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Their brief order gave no reasons for lifting preliminary injunctions that had blocked the new program. Challenges to the program will continue to move forward in courts around the nation.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The court seems to expect to make a decision on the substance of the policy in the future. “The routine issuance of universal injunctions is patently unworkable,” Justice Neil Gorsuch wrote in a concurring opinion.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">5. Why do the polls diverge so much</strong> on Joe Biden?</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A week before the Iowa caucuses, Senator Bernie Sanders has the lead in the latest state survey — but the former vice president is ahead in national polling.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/upshot/poll-iowa-caucus-biden.html" title="">Our Upshot correspondent explains</a>: Many of Mr. Biden’s supporters are among the most consistent voters. But consistent voters seem uninterested in attending caucuses. And caucuses have an outsized pull on those who do not vote regularly. Above, Mr. Biden in Cedar Falls, Iowa, today.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Many <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/us/politics/iowa-democrats-bernie-sanders.html" title="">traditional Iowa Democrats</a> appear to be split between Mr. Sanders’s four leading competitors or are unsure altogether about who to rally behind — which could open the door for Mr. Sanders to win with a modest plurality.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">6. President Trump’s Mideast peace plan</strong> is due Tuesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Mr. Trump, appearing in Washington alongside Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel, said the long-awaited plan would be “the closest we’ve ever come” to <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/world/middleeast/trump-netanyahu-gantz-israel-palestinians-peace.html" title="">an agreement between the Israelis and Palestinians</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">That notion was almost unanimously rejected by analysts and foreign diplomats who saw the plan as heavily weighted in favor of Israel. Details were not disclosed.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Many analysts said the plan was relevant mainly for its impact on the embattled Mr. Netanyahu in Israel’s March 2 election and as a distraction from Mr. Trump’s impeachment trial. Mr. Netanyahu’s opponent in the coming election, Benny Gantz, also met with Mr. Trump.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">7. Need a break from the news? </strong>Maybe it’s time to get out of town.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Let our travel writers show you the environmental dichotomy that <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/travel/20Everglades-florida-restoration.html" title="">the Everglades of Florida</a> has become, and demonstrate that <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/22/travel/zanzibar-tanzania-food-culture.html" title="">the dreamlike beauty of Zanzibar</a> is more than blindingly white beaches.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Oops. Even our travel news has a hard edge: Travel providers now <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/business/cheap-airfare.html" title="">use software to re-price their offerings, sometimes dozens of times a day</a>, putting buyers at a big disadvantage.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">8. A graphic novel scored</strong> the prestigious Newbery Award for children’s literature. It was a first.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/books/newbery-new-kid-jerry-craft-caldecott-undefeated-kwame-alexander.html" title="">“New Kid,”</a> by the writer and illustrator Jerry Craft, is about a 12-year-old named Jordan who dreams of going to art school instead of the prestigious private school his parents has enrolled him in, where he is one of the few students of color.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">And <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/05/books/review/poetry-picture-books.html" title="">“The Undefeated,”</a> an ode to African-American accomplishments written by Kwame Alexander and illustrated by Kadir Nelson, won the Caldecott Medal for the most distinguished American picture book for children.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">9. Live, from Melbourne.</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Australian Open quarterfinals will be shown in real time for U.S. audiences starting at 9 p.m. Eastern tonight on ESPN.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Third-seeded Roger Federer plays Tennys Sandgren, while Novak Djokovic, the second seed, takes on Milos Raonic. Ashleigh Barty, above after winning on Sunday, is No. 1 among women as she faces Petra Kvitova, and Sofia Kenin is matched with Ons Jabeur, the first Arab woman to reach a Grand Slam quarterfinals.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Here’s <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/sports/tennis/australian-open-matches-monday-tuesday.html" title="">who they are and how they got there</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">10. Before Billie Eilish won her Grammys</strong>, the 18-year-old won the red carpet.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">That’s the assessment of our <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/fashion/billie-eilish-grammys.html" title="">chief fashion critic, Vanessa Friedman</a>. “She was happy to dress up,” our critic wrote. “Just on her own terms.” Here are some other <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/01/26/style/grammys-red-carpet-moments.html" title="">red-carpet moments</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">As for the awards themselves, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/arts/music/grammy-awards-review.html" title="">fresh young innovators</a> — including Tyler, the Creator; Lizzo and Rosalía — made a strong, welcome showing, says our pop music critic Jon Caramanica.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Here is our take on <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/arts/music/grammys-best-worst.html" title="">the best and the worst of the Grammys</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Have a winning night.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">Your Evening Briefing is posted at 6 p.m. Eastern.</em></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">And don’t miss Your Morning Briefing. </em><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/briefing/global-morning-briefing-newsletter-signup.html" title=""><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">Sign up here</em></a><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0"> to get it by email in the Australian, Asian, European, African or American morning.</em></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">Want to catch up on past briefings? What do you want to see here? [<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-4ce13206" itemprop="headline"><span>Kobe Bryant’s Death Cuts Short a Budding Business Career</span></h1>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0"> U.S. stock futures are down sharply this morning on fears about the coronavirus outbreak. More below. (Want this in your inbox each morning? </em><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="http://p.nytimes.com/email/re?&amp;campaign_id=0&amp;instance_id=0&amp;segment_id=0&amp;user_id=f4577a56bcf773214e9a1d55b5fe9d24&amp;regi_id=0nl=dealbook&amp;emc=edit_dk_20180529" title=""><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">Sign up here</em></a><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">.)</em></p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-390c7338">An early end to Kobe Bryant’s new path</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/sports/basketball/kobe-bryant-helicopter-crash.html" title="">The death of Kobe Bryant</a>, the retired L.A. Lakers star, his 13-year-old daughter and seven others in a helicopter crash yesterday has stirred up grief across the sports world. It also had corporate leaders lamenting the loss of an up-and-coming business mogul.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Mr. Bryant was </strong><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/sports/kobe-bryant-obituary.html" title=""><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">one of the greatest N.B.A. players</strong></a>, with five championship rings and 18 All-Star selections in 20 seasons.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">But he was building a business empire, too:</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">• He started the investment firm <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.bryantstibel.com/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">Bryant Stibel</a> in 2013 with the Web.com founder Jeff Stibel. Bryant Stibel has invested in companies like Dell, Alibaba and Epic Games, the maker of Fortnight.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">• He also <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2018-11-12/kobe-bryant-wants-to-sell-you-a-sports-drink-with-bodyarmor?sref=kOA1eblB" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">invested in Bodyarmor</a>, a sports drink maker in which Coke <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/coca-cola-invests-in-bodyarmor-as-it-chases-gatorade-1534237201" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">later bought a stake</a> to compete against Gatorade.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">• And he founded Granity Studios, a media company.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">“I got tired of telling people I loved business</strong> as much as I did basketball because people would look at me like I had three heads,” <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://abcnews.go.com/Sports/kobe-bryants-obsession-dominating-business-world/story?id=50776410" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">Mr. Bryant told ESPN</a> in 2017. “But I do.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">The crash raises questions about </strong><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://slate.com/news-and-politics/2020/01/sikorsky-s76-helicopter-kobe-bryant.html" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title=""><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">the increasing use of helicopters</strong></a> for business travel. Aaron Mak of Slate notes that the number of civilian helicopters has grown 30 percent since 2006, and that choppers tend to crash more frequently than other aircraft.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">What the business world said about Mr. Bryant:</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">• The venture capitalist <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://twitter.com/sacca/status/1221520757475332096" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">Chris Sacca</a>: “Not sure I will ever know anyone else with his work ethic.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">• The Reddit co-founder <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://twitter.com/alexisohanian/status/1221593435724894208" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">Alexis Ohanian</a>: “He still believed he had work to do.”</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-19679ee4">Investors fear the growing coronavirus crisis</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">U.S. stock futures are down sharply this morning, as the death toll of the coronavirus outbreak continues to rise and pressure grows on China’s political leaders and its economy.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Here’s the latest:</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">• The S&amp;P 500 looks set to open 56 points lower, while the Dow may open down 474 points.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">• The number of deaths <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/world/asia/china-coronavirus.html" title="">currently stands at 80</a>, and infections have been reported worldwide.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">• It’s still unclear how the outbreak began, since some patients never visited the seafood market in Wuhan where it is thought to have originated.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Questions have arisen over Beijing’s strategy of </strong><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/world/asia/coronavirus-wuhan-china-hubei.html" title="">quarantining more cities</a></strong> in central China. Public health experts have asked whether the travel restrictions are limiting medical care.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">President Xi Jinping has sought </strong><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/world/asia/china-coronavirus-xi-jinping.html" title="">public shows of decisive action</a></strong>, including convening an extraordinary session of the Communist Party’s top political body. But “many Chinese remain unconvinced the government is being completely forthcoming about the toll of the disease,” Steven Lee Myers and Chris Buckley of the NYT write.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">And Chinese consumer spending </strong><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/deadly-infection-keeps-chinese-consumers-from-spending-11580048219" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">continues to drop</a></strong>, according to James Areddy of the WSJ, with potentially negative consequences for China’s economy. If the outbreak continues past March, economic growth might fall past a psychologically important level of 6 percent for the first quarter, according to analysts at Société Générale.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-7ca859">Will the Saudis enter the soccer arms race?</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">An investor group led by Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund is said to be in talks to buy the British soccer club Newcastle United for about $445 million, according to <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/saudi-sovereign-wealth-fund-in-talks-to-buy-u-k-soccer-team-newcastle-united-11579950242" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">the WSJ</a> and <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.ft.com/content/daafd602-403e-11ea-a047-eae9bd51ceba" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">the FT</a>. It could mean another team with well-heeled owners willing to spend millions to chase success.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">The current state of play:</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">• Saudi Arabia’s Public Investment Fund is working with the financier Amanda Staveley and the billionaires David and Simon Reuben.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">• The Saudis would own 80 percent of Newcastle in any such deal. Ms. Staveley and the Reubens would split the remainder.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Why Newcastle?</strong> It’s one of the better-known English Premier League soccer teams, with stellar attendance at matches. And its current owner, Mike Ashley, has been criticized for not spending enough on players.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">The Saudis have been investing in businesses outside the Middle East</strong> to diversify their country’s economy away from oil. The sovereign fund, known as P.I.F., has taken stakes in companies like Uber and Tesla.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">The question is how much the Saudis are prepared to spend</strong> on Newcastle. Abu Dhabi propelled Manchester City to the heights of the Premier League by spending heavily on the team, while Qatar has done something similar with Paris Saint-Germain.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-6a786869">U.S. and U.K. are headed for a clash over Huawei</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Britain is reportedly expected to give Huawei a <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.ft.com/content/5bef8972-405a-11ea-bdb5-169ba7be433d" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">limited role in its 5G network</a> this week, George Parker and Nic Fildes of the FT report. That could set up a fight with the Trump administration, which views the Chinese tech giant as a security threat.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Prime Minister Boris Johnson is likely to approve the use</strong> of Huawei products in “noncore” parts of the next-generation wireless network, after British intelligence officials said that they could “contain” any risks of using its technology. And Mr. Johnson’s government is considering imposing a cap on Huawei’s potential market share.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Trump administration officials have </strong><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.axios.com/huawei-5g-trump-boris-johnson-china-05338af0-00a9-4950-80b6-21ddd0a44d50.html" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">repeatedly warned</a></strong> foreign governments that Huawei poses a security threat. The U.S. has sought to impose ever-tighter restrictions on the Chinese company, and has argued that it’s impossible to stop the Chinese from infiltrating a network that uses Huawei equipment.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">But British officials reportedly feel they have little choice</strong>, given Huawei’s technological prowess and a lack of alternatives.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-4802a243">Remembering Clayton Christensen, innovation guru</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Professor Christensen, whose 1997 book “The Innovator’s Dilemma” became a touchstone text for the business world, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/25/business/clayton-christensen-dead.html" title="">died on Thursday</a>. He was 67.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">His thesis was</strong> that “the factors that helped the best companies succeed — listening responsively to customers, investing aggressively in technology products that satisfied customers’ next-generation needs — were the exact same reasons some of these companies failed,” writes Glenn Rifkin of the NYT.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Successful entrepreneurs could miss out on the next big thing</strong> by focusing on their current customers and remaining married to their once-disruptive products. Professor Christensen published and spoke extensively about his findings, including at <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vrzFSL1W6aQ" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">DealBook’s Playing for the Long Term conference</a> in 2016.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Business leaders embraced his work</strong>. Andy Grove, a former C.E.O. of Intel, said soon after “The Innovator’s Dilemma” published that it was the most important book he had read in a decade.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Adam Grant, a Wharton professor and fellow sage</strong> for the business world, offered <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://twitter.com/adammgrant/status/1221078446375407617" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">this assessment</a>: “His most disruptive innovation was reminding us not to overinvest in careers and underinvest in people.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">More:</strong></em><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0"> How direct-to-consumer companies like Dollar Shave Club </em><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0"><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/23/business/Billion-Dollar-Brands.html" title="">shook up the world of retail</a></em><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">.</em></p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-58528f7">Greta Thunberg has an unlikely ally</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin stirred up controversy last week when he said that the climate change activist Greta Thunberg should take a college economics class. But Ms. Thunberg found a <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/louise-linton-steve-mnuchin-s-wife-deletes-tweet-support-greta-n1123151" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">supporter in Mr. Mnuchin’s wife, Louise Linton</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">“I stand with Greta on this issue.</strong> (I don’t have a degree in economics either),” Ms. Linton, a Hollywood actor and producer who is a public supporter of animal rescue organizations, wrote in an Instagram post on Saturday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Ms. Linton later deleted the post</strong>, and then <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://eu.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2020/01/26/louise-linton-defends-greta-thunberg/4583755002/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">posted to her Instagram Story</a> defending herself, writes William Cummings of USA Today. “I am not my husband,” she wrote to one critic. “I happen to love Greta. Whatever he says has nothing to do with my views or opinions.”</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-7c091e00">The speed read</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Deals</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">• Reporters at The Chicago Tribune really want someone to buy out their newspaper’s current owner. (<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/business/media/newspaper-reporters-hedge-funds.html" title="">NYT</a>)</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">• California regulators are becoming a big hurdle for T-Mobile in its quest to buy Sprint. (<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/california-regulators-a-potential-obstacle-to-t-mobile-sprint-merger-11580063967" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">WSJ</a>)</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">• Big investment banks are walking away from Chinese companies seeking to go public on Wall Street. (<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.ft.com/content/52ee5054-38ff-11ea-a6d3-9a26f8c3cba4" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">FT</a>)</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Politics and policy</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">• In an unpublished draft of his coming book, the former national security adviser John Bolton directly linked President Trump’s withholding of aid to Ukraine to his desire for investigations into Democrats. (<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/us/politics/trump-bolton-book-ukraine.html?action=click&amp;module=Top%20Stories&amp;pgtype=Homepage" title="">NYT</a>)</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">• Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross warned E.U. officials not to move forward with a proposed carbon tax. (<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.ft.com/content/f7ee830c-3ee6-11ea-a01a-bae547046735" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">FT</a>)</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Tech</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">• Amazon employees openly criticized the company’s environmental practices, defying a company policy against unauthorized public criticism about its businesses. (<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/01/26/amazon-employees-plan-mass-defiance-company-communications-policy-support-colleagues/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">WaPo</a>)</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">• The London police said they plan to start using facial-recognition technology, overriding privacy concerns. (<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/24/business/london-police-facial-recognition.html" title="">NYT</a>)</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">• Content moderators at a Facebook facility in Europe have reportedly been asked to sign a form acknowledging that the job may cause PTSD. (<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.ft.com/content/98aad2f0-3ec9-11ea-a01a-bae547046735" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">FT</a>)</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Best of the rest</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">• “How Under Armour Lost Its Edge” (<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/business/under-armour-struggles.html" title="">NYT</a>)</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">• Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman of Saudi Arabia reportedly courted Jeff Bezos on business matters before an alleged hack of the Amazon chief’s phone. (<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/saudi-prince-courted-amazons-bezos-before-bitter-split-11580087674" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">WSJ</a>)</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">• German prosecutors are said to be investigating payments by Deutsche Bank to win the business of a Saudi royal. (<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.ft.com/content/b203a806-3606-11ea-a6d3-9a26f8c3cba4" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">FT</a>)</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">• Where Prince Charles of Britain’s personal fortune comes from. (<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/24/business/prince-charles-duchy-cornwall-nansledan.html" title="">NYT</a>)</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">We’d love your feedback. [<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <h1 class="css-1s4ffep e1h9rw200" id="link-4379fd6e" itemprop="headline"><span>John Bolton, Kobe Bryant, Grammy Awards: Your Monday Briefing</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/christopher-stanford"><span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Chris Stanford</span></a></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s the <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/morning-briefing" title="">sign-up</a>.)</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">Good morning.</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">We’re covering new evidence related to <strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">the Trump impeachment inquiry</strong>, reaction to the death of <strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Kobe Bryant</strong>,<strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"> </strong>and the <strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Grammy Awards</strong>.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-1a40e01">New Ukraine details in John Bolton’s book</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">President Trump told his national security adviser in August that he <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/us/politics/trump-bolton-book-ukraine.html" title="">wanted to continue freezing $391 million in aid to Ukraine</a> until officials there investigated Democrats including the Bidens, according to an unpublished manuscript by the since-ousted adviser, John Bolton.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A key element of Mr. Trump’s impeachment defense has been that the aid holdup was separate from his requests for investigations. Here are <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/us/politics/john-bolton-trump-book-takeaways.html" title="">five takeaways from Mr. Bolton’s book</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Mr. Bolton has said he would testify at Mr. Trump’s impeachment trial if he were asked to do so, but lawmakers said the Senate was highly unlikely to call new witnesses.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">How we know:</strong> Multiple people described Mr. Bolton’s account of the Ukraine affair to The Times. The White House didn’t answer questions about Mr. Bolton’s assertions, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/us/politics/trump-bolton-ukraine-biden-impeachment.html" title="">which Mr. Trump denied today</a>. Mr. Bolton’s lawyer accused the White House of disclosing the book’s contents.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">What’s next:</strong> Mr. Trump’s legal team is to resume his defense today, starting at 1 p.m. Eastern. During an abbreviated session on Saturday, the president’s lawyers attacked his accusers as partisan witch-hunters trying to remove him from office because they couldn’t beat him at the ballot box. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2020/impeachment-trial-live-01-27/" title="">Here are the latest updates</a>.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-746a29b0">Coronavirus outbreak intensifies</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The death toll in China from the respiratory illness rose to at least 80 today, and the government extended the Lunar New Year holiday by three days in an effort to limit travel. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/world/asia/china-coronavirus.html" title="">Here are the latest updates</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A top Chinese health official warned on Sunday that the virus’s spread was accelerating despite a lockdown affecting 56 million people. The quarantine could <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/world/asia/coronavirus-wuhan-china-hubei.html" title="">make the situation worse</a>, including by exacerbating shortages of medical supplies.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">The details:</strong> Most of the nearly 3,000 people who have contracted the virus live in China, but it has spread to <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/01/21/world/asia/china-coronavirus-maps.html" title="">10 other countries</a>. Five cases have been confirmed in the U.S.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Go deeper: </strong>Compared with<strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"> </strong>China’s response to the SARS epidemic in the early 2000s, the government <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/world/asia/china-coronavirus-xi-jinping.html" title="">has responded faster to the current outbreak</a>. But there are signs that officials, especially those at the regional level, were slow to recognize the danger and are continuing to mishandle the crisis.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Related:</strong> <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/business/stock-market-today.html" title="">Global markets tumbled today</a> and oil prices fell, as the spread of the virus raised investor worries.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Another angle:</strong> Many airlines are accommodating travelers who want to modify, delay or cancel China itineraries. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/travel/Coronavirus-travel.html" title="">Here’s what to expect</a>.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-f5553">Mourning an N.B.A. great</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The death of Kobe Bryant, his 13-year-old daughter and seven others in a helicopter crash in California on Sunday <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/sports/basketball/kobe-bryant-helicopter-crash.html" title="">shocked the sports world and generated an outpouring of grief</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Thousands of people gathered at Staples Center, and condolences poured in from presidents and celebrities. Several entertainers <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/arts/music/grammys-kobe-bryant.html" title="">paid tribute to Mr. Bryant at the Grammy Awards</a>, which took place at the arena hours later.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The helicopter carrying Mr. Bryant, 41, went down near Calabasas, about 30 miles northwest of downtown Los Angeles, in foggy conditions. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/sports/basketball/kobe-bryant-dead.html" title="">Here are the latest updates</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Catch up:</strong> The helicopter was on its way from Orange County, where the Bryant family lives, to Mr. Bryant’s youth basketball academy, where he coached his daughter Gianna, who died in the crash. A baseball coach at Orange Coast College in Costa Mesa was also killed, as were his wife and daughter. The other victims haven’t yet been identified.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Obituary:</strong> Mr. Bryant jumped straight from high school to the N.B.A. in 1996 and won five championships with the Lakers before retiring in 2016. He was <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/sports/kobe-bryant-obituary.html" title="">an unquestioned basketball great</a>, but his legacy is not so straightforward.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-3e31fd35">Iran’s 72-hour lie</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The country’s military officials knew for three days that their own forces had shot down a Ukrainian passenger jet over Tehran this month, but it took a resignation threat from President Hassan Rouhani and an order from Iran’s supreme leader before the government acknowledged its fatal mistake.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">We have <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/world/middleeast/iran-plane-crash-coverup.html" title="">an in-depth report on the cover-up</a> and its political implications. The main takeaway: The Islamic<strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"> </strong>Revolutionary Guards Corps, the elite force charged with defending Iran’s clerical rule at home and abroad, effectively sidelined the elected government in a moment of national crisis.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">How we know: </strong>The Times interviewed current and former Iranian officials, ranking members of the Revolutionary Guards, and people close to the inner circle of the supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Another angle:</strong> The Pentagon said <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/24/world/middleeast/iran-iraq-troops-brain-injuries.html" title="">34 American service members had sustained traumatic brain injuries</a> when Iran fired missiles at an Iraqi military base this month. President Trump said last week that the troops’ concussion symptoms were “not very serious.”</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-60157767">If you have 6 minutes, this is worth it</h3>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-16590c8d">The faces of life after the Holocaust</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A ceremony today at Auschwitz will commemorate the 75th anniversary of the liberation of the Nazi death camp in German-occupied Poland.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Before the event, a photographer took portraits of 75 Holocaust survivors, from which <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/01/24/opinion/auschwitz-anniversary-holocaust.html" title="">our Opinion section published a selection</a>. Among them are, clockwise from top left: Esther Meron, Motke Weisel, Sara Leicht, Thomas Geve, Batsheva Dagan and Avraham Harshalom.</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-554e6082">Here’s what else is happening</h3>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">A Middle East peace plan: </strong>President Trump is expected this week to <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/world/middleeast/trump-netanyahu-middle-east-plan.html" title="">reveal details of his long-promised proposal</a> to broker peace in the region. But with the Palestinians refusing to participate in the process, diplomats in past peace efforts see the plan as a way to aid the re-election efforts of the Israeli prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">20 questions with Democrats:</strong> The Times interviewed six presidential candidates about foreign policy, the last book they read and more. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/us/politics/democratic-candidates-20-questions.html" title="">Watch their answers here</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Changes to your credit score: </strong>Under <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/25/business/credit-score-fico-change.html" title="">a tweak to the widely used three-digit score</a>, consumers in good financial standing should see their scores bounce higher. But those in financial distress may experience a fall.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Snapshot: </strong>Above, Billie Eilish accepted the Grammy Award for song of the year, “Bad Guy,” on Sunday. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/arts/music/grammy-awards.html" title="">The 18-year-old won five awards</a> and swept the major categories. Here’s <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/arts/music/grammy-winners.html" title="">a full list of the winners</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Metropolitan Diary: </strong>In <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/nyregion/metropolitan-diary.html" title="">this week’s column</a>,<strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"> </strong>a fresh start, a table at Grand Central and more reader tales of New York City.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">What we’re reading: </strong><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.bostonglobe.com/2020/01/23/metro/is-fda-ready-next-e-coli-outbreak/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">This Boston Globe investigation</a> of the U.S. government’s inaction on E. coli outbreaks. The story of a 2-year-old boy who ate some of his father’s salad and developed the illness is “heartbreaking, terrifying and riveting,” writes our Times Insider editor, Jennifer Krauss.</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-7ded7ef4">Now, a break from the news</h3>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Cook: </strong><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://cooking.nytimes.com/recipes/1020815-slow-cooker-red-beans-and-rice" title="">Slow cooker red beans and rice</a> takes only about 20 minutes to set up in the morning.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Read: </strong>In <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/24/arts/roxane-gay-darkness-graphic-novel.html" title="">her latest comic book endeavor</a>, Roxane Gay adapts a short story, “The Sacrifice of Darkness,” from her 2017 collection “Difficult Women.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Watch: </strong>“<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/24/movies/taylor-swift-documentary-miss-americana.html" title="">Miss Americana</a>,” a Netflix documentary about Taylor Swift, premiered at the Sundance Film Festival last week.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Smarter Living: </strong>Wirecutter recommends five cheap(ish) things to <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/22/smarter-living/5-cheap-ish-things-to-radically-make-over-your-closet.html" title="">make over a cluttered closet</a>.</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-15767e9b">And now for the Back Story on …</h3>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-10ec9a2c">Bill Clinton’s impeachment</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">We asked Peter Baker, our chief White House correspondent, to reflect on a major moment in the lead-up to the last presidential impeachment and compare it with the current trial. He has covered both.</em></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Twenty-two years ago this week came a milestone moment in the last presidential impeachment drama. President <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/video/politics/bill-clinton-i-did-not-have-sexual-relations-with-that-woman/2018/01/25/4a953c22-0221-11e8-86b9-8908743c79dd_video.html" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">Bill Clinton was on the defensive</a> after The Washington Post, where I was working then, broke the news that Ken Starr was investigating whether the president had committed perjury to cover up an affair with a former White House intern.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Mr. Clinton took to the microphone at the end of an event, glared angrily at the reporters in the room, wagged his finger and, with Hillary Clinton standing behind him, forcefully said, “I did not have sexual relations with that woman, Miss Lewinsky.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">We were struck by two things: One, that he seemed to briefly blank on her name, referring to her as “that woman,” before summoning it. But the second was the intensity of his denial. He was white-hot mad.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">At that time, before the DNA and the grand jury testimony, we didn’t know if the story we were pursuing was bogus or if the president of the United States was lying to us and to the country. Of course, later we found out which it was.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Now, as Ken Starr re-emerges as a lawyer for President Trump in the current impeachment trial, and the administration’s explanations of what happened continue to fluctuate, it’s <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/19/us/politics/clinton-impeachment-trial.html" title="">hard not to feel déjà vu</a>.</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">That’s it for this briefing. See you next time.</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">— Chris</p>, <p class="css-jwz2nf etfikam0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Thank you</strong><br/>Mark Josephson and Eleanor Stanford provided the break from the news. You can reach the team at <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="mailto:briefing@nytimes.com" title="">briefing@nytimes.com</a>. </p>, <p class="css-jwz2nf etfikam0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">P.S.</strong><br/>• We’re listening to “<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/thedaily" title="">The Daily</a>.” Today’s episode is about whether football is too dangerous for children.<br/>• Here’s today’s <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/crosswords/game/mini" title="">Mini Crossword</a>, and a clue: Chunk of ice (four letters). <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/crosswords" title="">You can find all our puzzles here</a>.<br/>• Monica Mark is <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytco.com/press/our-next-johannesburg-bureau-chief/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">our next Johannesburg bureau chief</a>. She has covered some of the biggest stories in Africa for Bloomberg News, The Guardian and BuzzFeed News.</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <h1 class="interactive-heading css-1s4ffep e1h9rw200" id="interactive-heading" itemprop="headline">Coronavirus Map: Tracking the Spread of the Outbreak</h1>, <p class="interactive-byline e1n4ps4i0 css-ua5ckx e1jsehar1" id="interactive-byline" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/kk-rebecca-lai"><span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">K.K. Rebecca Lai</span></a>, <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/jin-wu"><span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Jin Wu</span></a>, <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/allison-mccann"><span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Allison McCann</span></a>, <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/derek-watkins"><span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Derek Watkins</span></a>, <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/jugal-k-patel"><span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Jugal K. Patel</span></a> and <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Richard Harris</span><time class="css-wcxsge">Updated <!-- -->Feb. 10, 2020</time></p>, <p class="g-body ">
	The <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/02/10/world/asia/coronavirus-china.html">coronavirus outbreak</a> has sickened more than 40,500 people in Asia, according to statements from health officials. Many other cases are suspected but not confirmed. As of Monday afternoon, at least 910 people have died, all but two in mainland China.
</p>, <h3 class="g-caption_heading ">Confirmed cases</h3>, <p class="g-body ">
	As these maps show, the disease has been detected in at least 24 other countries, most involving people who traveled from China.
</p>, <p class="g-body ">
	Twelve cases have been confirmed in the United States, including a <a href="https://www.nejm.org/doi/full/10.1056/NEJMoa2001191#.XjSWBjmO7T4.twitter">35-year-old man</a> in Washington state, a couple in their 60s in Chicago and six people in California.
</p>, <p class="g-body ">
