[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-6fdfe235" itemprop="headline"><span>France Confirms Fourth Case of Coronavirus in Elderly Chinese Tourist</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">PARIS — France on Tuesday reported that a fourth person was infected with the coronavirus, an elderly Chinese tourist. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Health Ministry director Jerome Salomon said the patient, hospitalized in Paris, was a Chinese tourist believed to be about 80 years old. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"His medical situation is serious, as he is requiring resuscitation," Salomon told reporters.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Matthieu Protard and Henri-Pierre Andre; writing by Geert De Clercq; editing by Bernadette Baum)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <h1 class="css-1s4ffep e1h9rw200" id="link-596263f" itemprop="headline"><span>Coronavirus, Kobe Bryant, Israel: Your Tuesday Briefing</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/christopher-stanford"><span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Chris Stanford</span></a></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s the <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/morning-briefing" title="">sign-up</a>.)</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">Good morning.</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">We’re covering the effect that <strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">John Bolton’s coming memoir</strong> is having on the impeachment trial and the frustrations of people of color who work for <strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Pete Buttigieg’s campaign</strong>. We’re also looking ahead to the unveiling of President Trump’s long-awaited <strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">peace plan for the Middle East</strong>.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-62badb4b">President Trump’s lawyers wrap up</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The defense is expected to complete its presentation at the impeachment trial today, including a strong argument against calling witnesses who could shed more light on the president’s actions. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/us/politics/impeachment-hearings.html" title="">Here’s what to expect</a> when the proceedings resume around 1 p.m. Eastern.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">On Monday, a handful of Republicans, including Senator Mitt Romney, appeared to be moving closer to joining Democrats in <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/us/politics/john-bolton-impeachment-witness.html" title="">voting to subpoena John Bolton</a>, the former national security adviser whose upcoming book corroborates a central piece of the case against Mr. Trump.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The president’s lawyers largely ignored Mr. Bolton’s book, saying the investigations of political rivals that Mr. Trump encouraged Ukraine to pursue were an effort to root out corruption and not tied to U.S. aid.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">What’s next:</strong> A 16-hour question-and-answer session begins once Mr. Trump’s team concludes. The Senate will also vote this week on whether to call witnesses.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Go deeper:</strong> In his book, Mr. Bolton says that he and Attorney General William Barr were concerned by <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/us/politics/john-bolton-trump-book-barr.html" title="">Mr. Trump’s seeming embrace of authoritarian leaders</a>, including those of China and Turkey.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">The Daily:</strong> <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/thedaily" title="">Today’s episode</a> is about Mr. Bolton’s revelations.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Another angle:</strong> <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/theater/bolton-hamilton.html" title="">“Hamilton” fans might recognize the title</a> of Mr. Bolton’s memoir, “The Room Where It Happened,” which is nearly the same as a song title from the Broadway hit.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-3f123cbb">Coronavirus infections skyrocket in China</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Confirmed cases of a mysterious respiratory illness increased nearly 60 percent overnight to more than 4,500, the Chinese health authorities said today. At least 106 people have died. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/world/asia/china-coronavirus.html" title="">Here are the latest updates</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">U.S. health officials have recommended avoiding all nonessential trips to China. We have <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/travel/Coronavirus-travel.html" title="">tips for travelers</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Hong Kong’s top official said today that <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/world/asia/coronavirus-hong-kong-border.html" title="">the city would limit the number of visitors from mainland China</a> in an effort to control the spread.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Related:</strong> The outbreak has provoked alarm that <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/business/coronavirus-china-economic-impact.html" title="">the global economy may be in for a shock</a>. Markets in Asia that aren’t closed for the Lunar New Year holiday <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/business/coronavirus-financial-markets.html" title="">fell today</a>, but stocks in Europe were steady.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Another angle: </strong>The Chinese government <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/world/asia/china-coronavirus-social-media.html" title="">has faced growing public anger</a><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"> </strong>over its management of the crisis. The mayor of Wuhan, the epicenter of the virus, said on Monday that he was prepared to resign, although the offer wasn’t immediately acted upon.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-4e50c06f">Kobe Bryant’s helicopter flew into dense fog</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Investigators in the crash that killed the former N.B.A. star haven’t ruled anything out, but the hillsides around the flight’s destination near Los Angeles were enveloped in a nearly blinding fog at the time. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/us/kobe-bryant-death.html" title="">Here are the latest updates</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The helicopter was not carrying a cockpit voice recorder, and federal officials aren’t expected to reach a conclusion about the cause of the accident for months.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">The details:</strong> Mr. Bryant was traveling to a youth basketball tournament with his 13-year-old daughter, Gianna, who was also killed in Sunday’s crash. Two of her teammates and their parents also died. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/us/who-died-helicopter-crash-kobe-altobelli-chester-zobayan-mauser.html" title="">Here’s what we know about the victims</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Go deeper:</strong> Mr. Bryant’s two-decade career coincided with the N.B.A.’s international expansion, in which <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/sports/basketball/kobe-NBA-global.html" title="">he played an important role</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Closer look:</strong> Our sports columnist Michael Powell <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/sports/basketball/kobe-retirement.html" title="">remembers the player known as “Black Mamba”</a> as “a confounding and intriguing star, complicated and intelligent and self-aware and nasty, and accepting of all of that in himself.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Another angle:</strong> A 2003 rape accusation <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/sports/basketball/kobe-bryant-rape-case.html" title="">changed how many saw Mr. Bryant</a>, but not the trajectory of his career.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-574f1770">Why Iowa is so crucial</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The state’s caucuses, which are less than a week away, are an important part of the presidential election cycle, but it hasn’t always been that way.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Protests in the 1960s, a mimeograph machine and a long-shot candidate all contributed to Iowa’s unlikely role. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/article/iowa-caucus-explained.html" title="">Our video explains</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The caucuses are the start of a four-month period that will determine the parties’ presidential nominees. We answered <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/01/24/us/politics/presidential-primary-election-guide.html" title="">some common questions about the process</a> (including “Are we going to be O.K.?”).</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Another angle:</strong> As Pete Buttigieg has struggled to attract the support of minority voters, people of color <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/us/politics/buttigieg-campaign-black-hispanic-staff.html" title="">spoke to The Times about their frustrations</a> working for his campaign.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Go deeper:</strong> Dayton, Ohio, used to vote Democratic. As its economy soured, blue-collar workers turned to Republicans, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/01/27/business/economy/republican-party-voters-income.html" title="">a pattern that’s repeating nationwide</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">For you:</strong> The Times is introducing a morning edition of the On Politics newsletter, full of news, insights and analysis from our reporters around the country. Sign up and get <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/us/politics/on-politics-sanders-bolton-iowa.html" title="">an inside look at the 2020 campaign</a>.</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-10467732">If you have 10 minutes, this is worth it</h3>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-89bee7d">When friends share your life online</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Nora Ephron once said, “Everything is copy.” In 2020, the more apt phrasing might be, “Everything is content.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">More and more people are turning their personal lives into social media careers. But what happens when their friends don’t want to be part of the oversharing? It might be <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/style/will-you-be-my-content.html" title="">the big question of the influencer era</a>.</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-554e6082">Here’s what else is happening</h3>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Middle East peace plan: </strong>A proposal set to be released today by President Trump would <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/world/middleeast/trump-netanyahu-gantz-israel-palestinians-peace.html" title="">give Israel sovereignty over much of the Jordan Valley</a>, a strategic area on the eastern edge of the West Bank. Palestinian leaders are unlikely to support that or other elements of the plan.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Faltering campaign against Huawei:</strong> Britain said today that it <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/technology/britain-huawei-5G.html" title="">would not ban equipment made by the Chinese technology giant</a> from being used in its new high-speed 5G wireless network, a setback in the Trump administration’s efforts to isolate the company.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">A plea to remember:</strong> At a ceremony for <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/world/europe/auschwitz-memorial-anniversary.html" title="">the 75th anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz</a>, survivors expressed a fear that what happened at the Nazi death camp was being forgotten.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Climate change considerations:</strong> New Jersey will become <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/nyregion/climate-change-nj-environmental-rules.html" title="">the first state to require builders to account for climate change</a>, including rising sea levels, to win government approval for projects.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">The burden of paperwork: </strong>Do you make the kinds of mistakes that can cost poor families food or health insurance? <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/01/28/upshot/administrative-burden-quiz.html" title="">Take our quiz</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Snapshot: </strong>Above, Everglades National Park. Our Travel section <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/travel/everglades-florida.html" title="">explored the threats to Florida’s “river of grass,”</a> where a $4 billion restoration plan has lagged.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Late-night comedy: </strong>John Bolton was on the minds of many of the hosts, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/arts/television/james-corden-late-night-john-bolton.html" title="">including James Corden</a>:<strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"> </strong>“This just goes to show you that sometimes political figures will have the moral courage to go against their party as long as it’s perfectly timed with the release of a book.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">What we’re reading: </strong><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2020/02/03/the-magical-thinking-of-the-goop-lab" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">This piece</a> on Gwyneth Paltrow’s new Netflix series, “The Goop Lab.” Our television critic James Poniewozik calls it a “great debut” for The New Yorker’s new TV critic, Doreen St. Félix.</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-7ded7ef4">Now, a break from the news</h3>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Cook: </strong>A<strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"> </strong>quick <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://cooking.nytimes.com/recipes/1019925-italian-wedding-soup-with-turkey-meatballs" title="">Italian soup with turkey meatballs</a> is flavor-packed.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Listen: </strong>At the Grammy Awards,<strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"> </strong>Billie Eilish won big, Aerosmith and Run-D.M.C. made a glorious mess, and the show faced the challenge of responding to Kobe Bryant’s death. Here’s <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/arts/music/grammys-best-worst.html" title="">our roundup of the best and worst moments</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">See:</strong> The fifth annual BroadwayCon over the weekend was a haven for passionate musical theater fans. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/theater/broadwaycon.html" title="">Some arrived in full costume</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Smarter Living: </strong>Because small luxuries are sometimes the most essential, we have <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/realestate/shopping-for-bathmats.html" title="">a guide to bathmats</a>.</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-15767e9b">And now for the Back Story on …</h3>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-545a9ac7">Halting the Great Plague</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">For some British readers, news of <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/23/world/asia/china-coronavirus.html" title="">travel restrictions intended to stop the spread of a deadly virus in central China</a> might have brought to mind a somewhat incongruous image: <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.visitpeakdistrict.com/explore/towns-and-villages/eyam-p680381" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">a village in the English Peak District</a>, where <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.visitpeakdistrict.com/whats-on/eyam-well-dressing-p751941" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">the wells are decorated with flowers each summer</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">This village, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.eyam-museum.org.uk/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">Eyam</a>, became a symbol of self-sacrifice because of its role in <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/education/resources/great-plague/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">England’s last major outbreak of bubonic plague, in 1665</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">That autumn, plague-bearing fleas arrived in Eyam in a bale of cloth from London. As deaths began to mount, the rector of the village church, William Mompesson, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-35064071" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">gathered the villagers and asked them to quarantine themselves</a> to stop the infection from spreading.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Further encouraged by the previous rector, Thomas Stanley, the villagers agreed, and stuck by their agreement, even as <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.eyam-museum.org.uk/assets/files/Eyam-Plague-victims-in-chronological-order.pdf" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">whole families died</a>. (Mr. Mompesson survived, apparently against his expectations, but his wife, Catherine, did not.)</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">When the outbreak ended the following November, 260 people in Eyam had died — by many accounts, that was more than half of the population.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But the lives they saved, in villages and larger towns nearby, almost certainly numbered in the thousands.</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">That’s it for this briefing. See you next time.</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">— Chris</p>, <p class="css-jwz2nf etfikam0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Thank you</strong><br/><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-z8q5kNbEoU" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">Lin-Manuel Miranda</a> provided this morning’s soundtrack, while Mark Josephson and Eleanor Stanford provided the break from the news. Peter Robins, an editor in our London newsroom who grew up about 40 miles from Eyam, wrote today’s Back Story. You can reach the team at <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="mailto:briefing@nytimes.com" title="">briefing@nytimes.com</a>. </p>, <p class="css-jwz2nf etfikam0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">P.S.</strong><br/>• We’re listening to “<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/thedaily" title="">The Daily</a>.” Today’s episode is about the ripple effects of John Bolton’s coming book.<br/>• Here’s today’s <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/crosswords/game/mini" title="">Mini Crossword</a>, and a clue: What causes Pinocchio’s nose to grow (five letters). <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/crosswords" title="">You can find all our puzzles here</a>.<br/>• The Research &amp; Development team at The Times is working in collaboration with IBM on the <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.newsprovenanceproject.com/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">News Provenance Project</a>, whose aim is to diminish the spread of misinformation.</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-a2f1d13" itemprop="headline"><span>Taiwan Reports First Case of Domestic Coronavirus Transmission</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">TAIPEI — Taiwan reported its first case of domestic transmission of the new coronavirus on Tuesday and raised its travel warning for China, saying people should avoid going unless absolutely necessary following the outbreak of the virus there.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Taiwan and China have close economic and cultural ties, and the island has reported eight confirmed cases of the virus. All of the more than 100 deaths from the virus have been in China, centered on Wuhan, the capital of Hubei province.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Taiwan's Central Epidemic Command Centre said the latest patient, the eighth, was the first case of transmission on the island as in all the previous cases the people had been infected first in China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The new patient, a man in his 50s from central Taiwan, was infected by his wife after she returned from working in China and before she was subsequently diagnosed, the command center said. The man is in a stable condition, it said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Separately, the command center said it would extend to the rest of China an earlier warning not to go to Hubei province unless totally necessary, though Hong Kong and Macau are excluded.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Taiwan has also restricted the vast majority of Chinese visitors.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Last week, Taiwan's government announced a one-month ban on the export of specialist masks designed to be used for medical personnel, saying it had to look after the needs of its own people first.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Some pharmacies in Taiwan have said they face shortages of face masks. The government has said it is working to ensure supplies and announced it will release more masks, but limit each person to buying a maximum of three.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen, visiting people to extend Lunar New Year wishes, said the government was fully prepared to deal with the virus and people should not panic.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Our anti-epidemic work does not take holidays, and is taking place 24 hours a day," the presidential office quoted her as saying.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Ben Blanchard, Editing by William Maclean and Timothy Heritage)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-1fc1c71b" itemprop="headline"><span>China's Tianjin to Set Up Dedicated Hospital to Treat Coronavirus Patients</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">SHANGHAI — The city of Tianjin in northern China will establish a dedicated hospital to treat people infected by the coronavirus as part of a "wartime mechanism" to fight the disease, a government-owned paper said on Tuesday, citing the local health commission.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The city will move patients in the existing Haihe hospital to make 600 beds available at any time for potential patients.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Josh Horwitz; Editing by Kim Coghill)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <h1 class="css-1s4ffep e1h9rw200" id="link-212d3381" itemprop="headline"><span>Coronavirus, Huawei in Britain, Impeachment: Your Wednesday Briefing</span></h1>, <p class="css-1ifw933 e1wiw3jv0" id="article-summary">Here’s what you need to know.</p>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/melina-delkic"><span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Melina Delkic</span></a></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s the <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/morning-briefing" title="">sign-up</a>.)</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">Good morning.</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">We’re covering Hong Kong’s strict limits on travelers as the <strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Wuhan coronavirus </strong>spreads, Britain’s decision to let <strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Huawei</strong> help build its 5G network and why <strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Kobe Bryant</strong> made such an impression in China.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-18baf431">Hong Kong limits travel to curtail outbreak</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">As the number of known cases of the Wuhan coronavirus <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/world/asia/china-coronavirus.html" title="">rose by nearly 60 percent</a> on Monday night into Tuesday,<span class="css-8l6xbc evw5hdy0"> </span>Carrie Lam, Hong Kong’s chief executive, said <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/world/asia/coronavirus-hong-kong-border.html" title="">the territory would strictly limit travelers from mainland China</a> starting on Thursday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The move followed days of rising pressure from health care workers, experts and even lawmakers who support Mrs. Lam’s government, and reflected distrust of the mainland as evidenced both from recent protests and the 2003 SARS crisis, in which nearly 300 people died in Hong Kong alone.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Elsewhere, officials in Germany and Japan reported the first known cases of human-to-human transmission of the virus — meaning countries now have to worry not only about quarantining infected travelers, but also about keeping the virus from spreading within their borders.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Toll:</strong> At least 106 people have died, China said on Tuesday, and the number of cases increased to 4,515 on Tuesday, from 2,835 on Monday, according to the National Health Commission. The youngest confirmed case is a 9-month-old girl in Beijing.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">What’s next:</strong> China has extended the Lunar New Year holiday to Feb. 3, and some major cities have gone further, telling businesses not to open until the next week.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-24d5599">Britain declines to bar Huawei</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Chinese telecommunications giant <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/technology/britain-huawei-5G.html" title="">can be part of Britain’s new high-speed 5G wireless network</a>, the British government said, despite intense American arguments that Huawei could be used by the Chinese government as a channel for control and surveillance.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Both the U.S. and China, vying for tech supremacy, had tried to sway Britain’s decision. A Trump administration official said the U.S. was “disappointed.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The decision did not name Huawei, specifying instead that “high-risk vendors” posing “greater security and resilience risks to U.K. telecoms networks” would be able to provide equipment in some portions of the network, like antennas and base stations, but not parts of the nerve center like servers.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Implications: </strong>Britain’s membership in the so-called Five Eyes intelligence-sharing group, along with Australia, New Zealand, Canada and the U.S., gives the decision added significance. And it comes as Germany is also deciding whether to work with Huawei.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Boris Johnson’s balancing act:</strong> The prime minister is <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/world/europe/johnson-trump-hwawei-rift.html" title="">risking a rift with President Trump</a> ahead of negotiating a new trade deal with the U.S., but the potential of 5G makes the gains from a deal look paltry.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-150d461a">How an N.B.A. star dazzled Asia, too</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Over his two-decade career with the Los Angeles Lakers, Kobe Bryant <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/sports/basketball/kobe-NBA-global.html" title="">played an important role</a> in the basketball league’s international expansion.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">His stature as an international celebrity, honed by both the N.B.A. and Nike, crystallized during the opening ceremony of the 2008 Olympics in Beijing, when he was swarmed by fellow athletes. In China, he routinely had the highest sales of shoes and jerseys.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Bryant was a frequent visitor to China for basketball camps and promotional stops, and he appeared in commercials, like one with the Taiwanese pop star Jay Chou. He was also popular in the Philippines.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">The investigation: </strong>All possible causes for the helicopter crash on Sunday that killed Bryant and eight others are still being considered, but the hillsides around the flight’s destination near Los Angeles were enveloped in a nearly blinding fog at the time. The helicopter was not carrying a cockpit voice recorder, and federal investigators aren’t expected to reach a conclusion for months. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/us/kobe-bryant-death.html" title="">Here are the latest updates</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Another angle:</strong> We <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/us/kobe-bryant-lower-merion-jeanne-mastriano.html" title="">spoke to a high school teacher</a> that Bryant considered a mentor and “muse” about their remarkable friendship: “He has left such a void behind,” she said.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-44086aff">Long awaited, Trump peace plan favors Israel</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">President Trump unveiled his Middle East peace plan on Tuesday in the presence of only one party to the conflict, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">What Mr. Trump called a “win-win” <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/world/middleeast/peace-plan.html" title="">proposal would give Israel most of what it has sought</a> and create a Palestinian state with limited sovereignty. The Palestinian leadership immediately rejected the plan, which discards the idea of a full-fledged Palestinian state.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Analysts saw the document as a distraction offered by a president under impeachment working with a prime minister under criminal indictment.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">The details:</strong> The plan would guarantee Israeli control of a unified Jerusalem as its capital and not require it to uproot any West Bank settlements. Mr. Trump promised to provide $50 billion in international financing for the new Palestinian entity and to open an embassy there.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">At the impeachment trial:</strong> The president’s legal team made <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2020/impeachment-trial-live-01-28" title="">its last oral arguments</a> on Tuesday. Senators will now have 16 hours to ask questions of each side.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A vote on whether to hear witnesses in the trial is expected on Friday, with a few Republican senators appearing to favor calling John Bolton, the former national security adviser whose book manuscript corroborates a central accusation: that Mr. Trump tied Ukraine’s military aid to politically motivated investigations.</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-60157767">If you have 6 minutes, this is worth it</h3>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-10e51427">Japan’s skateboarders roll out of the shadows</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Japan has an Olympic skateboarding team that is likely to win more medals than that of any other country in the first such competition. But most of its members would not dream of taking out their boards on Japan’s streets, where the sport has long been seen as a pastime of unruly children.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">This year’s summer Olympics could give its Japanese adherents something new: <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/sports/olympics/skateboarding-olympics-tokyo.html" title="">everyday acceptance</a>.</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-554e6082">Here’s what else is happening</h3>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">India:</strong> <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/world/asia/trump-modi-india.html" title="">A state visit by President Trump</a> is planned for late February, according to Indian officials. The visit could be seen as an endorsement of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s recent policies that have deeply divided India and set off deadly nationwide protests.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Belgian king:</strong> After a court-ordered DNA test to resolve a decade-long paternity claim, King Albert II, 85, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/world/europe/belgium-king-albert-delphine-boel.html" title="">conceded that he was the biological father</a> of the artist Delphine Boël, 51, who has long said she was conceived during an affair between her mother and Albert before he ascended the throne.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Harvard intellectual theft case: </strong>The U.S. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/us/charles-lieber-harvard.html" title="">charged the chairman of Harvard’s department of chemistry and chemical biology</a> with lying about Chinese funding he received, part of an American crackdown on the theft of biomedical research from the country’s laboratories.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Snapshot: </strong>Above, a Syrian asylum seeker at a migrant camp in the Turkish-controlled part of Cyprus. The tiny island now <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/world/europe/cyprus-migrant-crisis.html" title="">hosts the most refugees per capita</a> in the European Union, the result of a loophole within its vexing political situation.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">What we’re looking at: </strong><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.theatlantic.com/photo/2020/01/photos-worst-locust-swarms-decades-hit-east-africa/605653/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">These photos in The Atlantic</a> of the locust swarms in East Africa. “For those keeping track of the plagues hitting the planet,” writes Andrea Kannapell, the Briefings editor.</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-7ded7ef4">Now, a break from the news</h3>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Cook: </strong><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://cooking.nytimes.com/recipes/1020774-creamy-farro-with-crispy-mushrooms-and-sour-cream" title="">Farro with crispy mushrooms and sour cream</a> is similar in texture to a risotto, without the constant stirring.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Read: </strong>Gish Jen’s densely imagined if static new novel, “<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/books/review-resisters-gish-jen.html" title="">The Resisters</a>,” is set in a future surveillance state known as AutoAmerica.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Go: </strong><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/travel/momcations-its-a-thing.html" title="">Momcations</a>, a getaway designed for tired mothers, are on the rise. While some see it as profiteering, others say it’s a sign of “the mainstream telling moms they deserve a break.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Smarter Living: </strong>Breaking up with a therapist can be nerve-racking. But doing it <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/magazine/how-to-break-up-with-your-therapist.html" title="">with these tips in mind</a> can turn it into an opportunity for growth.</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-15767e9b">And now for the Back Story on …</h3>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-43d3324a">Reporting in Wuhan</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">Chris Buckley, our chief China correspondent, is reporting this week from the city of Wuhan, the epicenter of the coronavirus outbreak. Mike Ives, on the Briefings team, spoke with Chris by phone.</em></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">What is it like with these unprecedented restrictions in place?</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">It may be difficult to envisage just how thoroughly people have retreated from the streets and from public life. I had to cross one of the big bridges across the Yangtze for my reporting. And there I was, on one of these Chinese share bikes that are everywhere, on an almost completely empty bridge, spanning one of China’s biggest cities, crossing its biggest river. And there were just two other people on the bridge.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A lot of people wonder how long the shutdown can last. Even now people are worrying about the jobs they may lose, the businesses that will close, the school semesters that they might miss.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">You’ve reported that </strong><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/world/asia/china-coronavirus-social-media.html" title="">the anger on Chinese social media</a></strong><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"> is intense.</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Yes, and you hear that here as well. People erupt with a kind of anger and exasperation over how it was that this dangerous pathogen was among them but they didn’t understand, in many cases, how serious it was or what was going on until the city was shut down.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But that’s leavened by a sense among many people that the most pressing thing is to <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://twitter.com/ChuBailiang/status/1222050019835969536" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">get through this crisis </a>— so that as few people die as possible and life can return to a kind of normality as soon as possible.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">What else are you seeing there?</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">You see a combination of reactions when you approach people to talk. First of all, there’s a natural wariness about getting close to anybody. But once you reassure them — you’re outside, at a distance of a good 10 feet — they can be very open and also very generous.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">How does that compare to the response you normally get?</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The reaction you get as a foreign reporter varies quite a bit across China. But I think these circumstances, where people feel that they — and, in a sense, we — are all in this together, and that you’re there somehow experiencing this as well, make it easier to create that connection.</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">That’s it for this briefing. See you next time.</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">— Melina</p>, <p class="css-jwz2nf etfikam0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Thank you</strong><br/>To Mark Josephson and Eleanor Stanford for the break from the news. You can reach the team at <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="mailto:briefing+pm@nytimes.com?subject=Briefing%20Feedback" title="">briefing@nytimes.com</a>.</p>, <p class="css-jwz2nf etfikam0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">P.S.</strong><br/>• We’re listening to “<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/thedaily" title="">The Daily</a>.” Our latest episode is about the ripple effects of John Bolton’s coming book.<br/>• Here’s our <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/crosswords/game/mini" title="">Mini Crossword</a>, and a clue: What causes Pinocchio’s nose to grow (five letters). <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/crosswords" title="">You can find all our puzzles here</a>.<br/>• Jason Polan, a New York sketch artist, produced hundreds of illustrations for the print edition of The Times. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/arts/jason-polan-dead.html" title="">He died on Monday at age 37</a>.</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-3cbeb992" itemprop="headline"><span>Swiss Seek Access to EU Early-Warning System as Coronavirus Spreads</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BERN — Switzerland needs access to a European Union early-warning system for health crises to shore up its defences against the new coronavirus in China, Swiss health officials said on Tuesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Under the EU's Early Warning and Response System (EWRS), member states share information to try to prevent or control cross-border threats to health. But Switzerland is not a member of the EU, so it is not part of the EWRS. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">With the coronavirus's emergence, Bern has sought temporary access to the system and expects Brussels eventually to agree to its request, as it did during a recent Ebola outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But permanent access to the EWRS is hindered by an impasse in protracted talks with the EU because of disagreement over a treaty that foresees Switzerland routinely adopting single-market rules, among other things, to preserve favoured-trading status.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The situation could serve as a warning to Britain as it prepares to leave the EU while keeping trade ties to the bloc.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"It's very difficult for us to know exactly what is going on in our neighbouring countries, especially which measures they are taking," Daniel Koch, head of the communicable diseases unit at the Swiss Federal Department of Health, told Reuters. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"What it shows now is that when a crisis starts, it's a little bit late to put us in, it takes too much time."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Switzerland has no confirmed cases of the respiratory illness that emerged weeks ago in Wuhan in China. But the confirmation of cases in France and Germany has made Swiss health officials anxious to get news of developments fast.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"The Europeans have expanded their early warning system," Koch said. "They communicate with each other. And it's not that they don't want to communicate with us. But it doesn't occur to them that we don't see the reports." </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">DIGITAL PLATFORM</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The EWRS is a digital platform linking the EU's executive European Commission, the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control, and health authorities across the EU to manage serious cross-border threats.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A deal giving Switzerland access is ready for signature as part of a broader health pact with the EU.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But talks are blocked by the EU's demand over single-market rules and a request by Brussels for Bern to create a more effective platform for resolving disputes. Talks are on hold until May, when Swiss voters decide whether to cancel an EU free-movement accord.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Beyond excluding the Swiss from the early-alert system, other consequences of the EU impasse include suspension of cross-border securities trading in July. Moreover, Swiss manufacturers of medical devices such as pacemakers and hip implants are warning of a potential trade logjam later this year.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Editing by Timothy Heritage)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-17822f4" itemprop="headline"><span>Moscow Imposes Special Safety Measures at Tourist Sites Over Coronavirus Fears</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">MOSCOW — Moscow city authorities have put in place special safety measures at hotels and tourist sites due to fears over the outbreak of coronavirus in China, Mayor Sergei Sobyanin said on Tuesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We have taken special control of hotels and other places where tourists gather en masse. When alarming signs appear, emergency medical teams will be sent to carry out a thorough examination," he wrote on his website.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Maria Kiselyova; Writing by Tom Balmforth; Editing by Alison Williams)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]

[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-787b5fa0" itemprop="headline"><span>Thailand Coronavirus Cases Rise to 14, All Passengers From China to Be Screened</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BANGKOK — Thailand announced plans on Tuesday to screen all arrivals from China for symptoms of the coronavirus and confirmed six more infections among such visitors, taking its tally to 14, health officials said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Thai tourist authorities meanwhile said the number of Chinese tourists to Thailand was expected to fall by 2 million to 9 million this year due to the coronavirus outbreak in China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Thais were also advised to avoid non-essential travel to China, Sukhum Kanchanapimai, the health ministry's permanent secretary, told a news conference.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The death toll from the outbreak now stands at 106, although there have been no fatalities outside China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Thailand has the second-largest number of cases outside China, though it is far lower than the 4,515 infections in China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Five of the patients among Thailand's new cases, aged between 6 and 70, came from China's Hubei province, and belonged to the same family, health official Tanarak Plipat told reporters. The sixth was from Chongqing city in southwestern China. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">One passenger from among the family of seven traveling together was taken to hospital after showing symptoms on arrival, added Tanarak, the deputy director-general of the department of disease control.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The other four family members were quarantined after showing symptoms following monitoring, he added. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Now we will expand screening to all Chinese from China and prepare equipment to screen 100%," Sukhum said. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Thailand had earlier screened passengers only from China's central city of Wuhan, the epicenter of the outbreak, its southern city of Guangzhou and northeastern Changchun across five airports, from Suvarnabhumi in Bangkok to those at Chiang Mai, Don Mueng, Phuket and Krabi. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Tourism Authority of Thailand said it expected the number of Chinese tourists to fall by 2 million to 9 million this year due to the coronavirus outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Tourism has been hit hard by China's ban on all group tours as China is Thailand's biggest source of visitors. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Reduced travel from China could result in 50 billion baht ($1.52 billion) of lost tourism revenue, the tourism ministry estimates.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">TAT will propose to the government measures to help the industry, TAT Governor Yuthasak Supasorn told a news conference.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(This story corrects to say Chongqing is a city, not a province, in China) </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Panarat Thepgumpanat and Chayut Setboonsarng; Editing by Angus MacSwan)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-17822f4" itemprop="headline"><span>Moscow Imposes Special Safety Measures at Tourist Sites Over Coronavirus Fears</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">MOSCOW — Moscow city authorities have put in place special safety measures at hotels and tourist sites due to fears over the outbreak of coronavirus in China, Mayor Sergei Sobyanin said on Tuesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We have taken special control of hotels and other places where tourists gather en masse. When alarming signs appear, emergency medical teams will be sent to carry out a thorough examination," he wrote on his website.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Maria Kiselyova; Writing by Tom Balmforth; Editing by Alison Williams)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-25232226" itemprop="headline"><span>Stores Closed, Employees Evacuated, Travel Restricted as Coronavirus Spreads</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Reuters) - Companies around the globe from Facebook to Japan's Nippon Steel have restricted travel to China, as the outbreak of a new coronavirus, which has killed over 100 people and infected more than 4,000 in the world's most populous country, sparks international alarm. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Here's how companies have responded to the outbreak, which originated in Wuhan, the capital of China's Hubei province:</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">TRAVEL ADVISORIES/EVACUATIONS/QUARANTINES:</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Facebook asked employees to halt non-essential travel to mainland China and to work from home if they had traveled there. Chinese tech giants including Alibaba and Tencent have asked staff to work from home for a week after an extended Lunar New Year break ends on Feb. 2.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Tiktok owner Bytedance asked employees who traveled during the holidays to quarantine themselves and work from home for 14 days. E-commerce firm Pinduoduo, UBS Group and property developer Country Garden have advised similar action.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Standard Chartered banned travel to Hubei and restricted travel to mainland China and Hong Kong, and asked employees returning from Hubei to work from home for 14 days. Commonwealth Bank of Australia said all non-essential employee travel to China should be avoided.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- LG Electronics and electric car battery maker LG Chem banned travel to China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- South Korean chipmaker SK Hynix urged employees to avoid non-essential trips to China as have LG Display and Japanese carmakers Honda and Toyota. Honda evacuated around 30 employees and their families from Wuhan on a government charter flight.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Nissan is planning to send back some Japanese staff working at its JV with Dongfeng Motors in Wuhan and their families on the chartered flight as well.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Samsung Electronics advised employees who recently visited Hubei to stay at home for seven days.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Japanese steelmaker Nippon Steel restricted travel to China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Singaporean conglomerate Keppel Corp, which has 170 staff in Wuhan, advised staff to avoid non-work-related visits to and from mainland China and not to travel to Hubei province. It will monitor staff in China and those who have returned to Singapore from there in the past 14 days.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Novartis said it is asking staff in China to work from home until Feb. 10 and has suspended business travel to and from Wuhan. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Nestle has deployed additional biosecurity measures at its factories, offices and distribution centers in China. It does not have manufacturing facilities in Wuhan.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Volkswagen asked staff at its China unit to work from home between Feb. 3 and Feb. 17.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Brazilian miner Vale SA has suspended travel by its employees to and from China indefinitely and said employees in China will work remotely.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Goldman Sachs has instructed staff who have been in mainland China to work from home or be out of the office for 14 days since they were last there, according to an internal notice.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">STORES SHUT:</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Starbucks Corp warned of a financial hit from the coronavirus outbreak in China, and said it had closed more than half of its stores in the country.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- McDonald's suspended business in five cities in Hubei including Wuhan. Starbucks closed all shops and suspended delivery services in Hubei.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Yum China Holdings Inc temporarily closed some of its KFC and Pizza Hut stores in Wuhan.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Luckin Coffee will keep stores closed in Wuhan throughout the Lunar New Year holidays.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Japan's Fast Retailing temporarily closed about 100Uniqlo stores in Hubei. IKEA closed its one store in Wuhan.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Walt Disney temporarily closed its Shanghai and Hong Kong theme parks and resorts during what is likely the busiest time of the year.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Imax delayed film releases in China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- H&amp;M has closed 45 stores and suspended business travel to and within China, a spokeswoman said. Staff arriving from China are recommended to stay home for 14 days before returning to work.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Swatch has closed five stores in Wuhan and suspended all travel to and from China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Apple Inc Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook said the company has currently closed one of its retail stores in China and reduced hours at others and is restricting employee travel due to the virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">AIRLINE REFUNDS/CANCELLATIONS: </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Finnish airline Finnair has suspended its routes to Nanjing and Beijing's Daxing International airport until the end of March, the first European airline to cancel flights to the country.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Hong Kong's Cathay Pacific and its Cathay Dragon will cut capacity to and from mainland China by 50% or more from Jan. 30 to end-March. The airline will also rebook, reroute or refund tickets booked on or before Jan. 28 for travel by March 31 to or from mainland China. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Australia's Qantas Airways said it will offer free refunds for tickets issued worldwide on or before Jan. 24, for journeys to and from mainland China between Jan. 24 and Feb. 29.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Air Seoul suspended all flights to China and waived refund penalty. Taiwan's China Airlines rearranged some flights and canceled others.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- China's mainland airlines, including Air China, China Southern and China Eastern, are offering free refunds across the mainland for tickets purchased before Jan. 24.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Malaysia's AirAsia will offer free refunds for tickets booked before Jan. 24, and for travel to and from mainland China until Feb. 15, and return flights between Feb. 16-29.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Air France KLM is offering to exchange or refund tickets issued for travel to or from China up until Feb. 29. BA-owner IAG is offering the same for tickets until Feb 23.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- United Airlines is cancelling some flights to China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">HOTELS:</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- InterContinental Hotels will allow customers to change or cancel stays scheduled up to Feb. 3 across mainland China, Hong Kong, Macau and Taiwan.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Hyatt Hotels said guests who had booked stays through its official channels and are cancelling due to the coronavirus outbreak, or are Chinese guests outbound to its Asia Pacific hotels, can cancel stays or change dates for free. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BOOKING PLATFORMS, AGENCIES:</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Ctrip, China's largest online booking platform, said more than 300,000 hotels on its platform had agreed to refund on bookings between Jan. 22 and Feb. 8. Refunds also include flight tickets, cruises and car rents</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Fliggy, Alibaba's booking site, offered similar refunds.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Some Chinese tour operators such as China International Travel Service offered refunds and many European tour operators canceled tours to China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Sophie Yu in Beijing, Jamie Freed in Sydney, Ritsuko Ando in Tokyo, Anna Ringstrom in Stockholm, Ben Blanchard in Taipei, Naomi Tajitsu in Tokyo, Heekyong Yang and Jane Chung in Seoul, Josh Horwitz and Brenda Goh in Shanghai, Neil Jerome Morales in Manila, Sumeet Chatterjee in Hong Kong, Paul Arnold and Silke Koltrowitz in Zurich, Laurence Frost in Paris and Uday Sampath in Bengaluru; Writing by Sayantani Ghosh and Josephine Mason; Editing by Shounak Dasgupta, Lisa Shumaker and Maju Samuel)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-1ce99347" itemprop="headline"><span>India, Bangladesh Eye Evacuating Citizens From China Coronavirus Epicenter</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">NEW DELHI — India and Bangladesh said on Tuesday they are working on evacuating their citizens from China's Wuhan, the epicenter of a new coronavirus outbreak that has killed more than 100 people.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Indian state airline Air India was on standby to evacuate an estimated 250 Indians from Wuhan in Hubei province, local media reported earlier. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We have begun the process to prepare for evacuation of Indian nationals affected by the situation arising out of Corona-2019 virus outbreak in Hubei Province, China," Indian Foreign Ministry spokesman Raveesh Kumar said in a tweet. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">He said Indian authorities were working out the logistics of moving people out of the city of 11 million people that is under a lockdown. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In Bangladesh, Foreign Minister Abdul Momen said talks were underway to bring back Bangladeshi citizens from China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The death toll from the virus rose to 106 on Tuesday as authorities scrambled globally to curb its spread and U.S. health authorities advised travelers to avoid all non-essential travel to China. A growing number of countries have said they will evacuate their citizens from Wuhan.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The virus has infected thousands of people in China and spread to more than a dozen countries, including the United States.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">There are no confirmed cases of the virus yet in India, Health Minister Harsh Vardhan said on Tuesday, adding authorities were screening suspected patients in multiple cities. All hospitals had been asked to keep those suspected to have the virus in isolation wards, he added. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We are taking all precautions against it," said Vardhan. Seven major airports in India including New Delhi and Mumbai were screening all passengers coming into India from China. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">No one in Bangladesh has been found to have the virus yet either, Bangladeshi Health Minister Zahid Maleque told reporter, but the government was prepared if infections surfaced.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">More than 400 Bangladeshi citizens, mostly students, are stranded in Wuhan under the lockdown. Many took to social media to urge Bangladeshi authorities to evacuate them.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Momen, the Bangladeshi foreign minister, told reporters that the government was keeping a close watch on people coming in Bangladesh from China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We are keeping their records so that we can track them if something goes wrong," he said. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Officially known as "2019-nCoV", the coronavirus can cause pneumonia, but it is too early to know just how dangerous it is and how easily it spreads.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Sanjeev Miglani, Ruma Paul and Zeba Siddiqui; Editing by Mark Heinrich)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-2aacdfa8" itemprop="headline"><span>Four Co-Workers in Germany Contract Coronavirus After Chinese Colleague Visits</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BERLIN — Four people who work at the same company in southern Germany have been infected with the coronavirus, and one of them contracted it from a colleague visiting their workplace in China, officials said on Tuesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The cases raise concerns about the spread of the flu-like virus that broke out in the central Chinese city of Wuhan at the end of last year and has killed 106 people and infected more than 2,800 people. It spreads in droplets from coughs and sneezes and has an incubation period of up to 14 days. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In one of the first cases of person-to-person transmission outside China, a 33-year-old man apparently contracted the virus on Jan. 21 during a training session with a Chinese colleague, the ministry said. The three additional patients were being monitored in isolation at a clinic in Munich.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"A total of around 40 employees at the company have been identified as potential close contacts. As a precaution, the people concerned are to be tested on Wednesday," Bavaria's Health Minister Melanie Huml said in a statement.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">German car parts supplier Webasto [WEBA.UL] earlier on Tuesday said an employee at its headquarters in Stockdorf, Bavaria, had become infected following the visit of an employee from China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A day earlier it said an employee from Shanghai tested positive for the virus upon returning to China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Confirmation of any sustained human-to-human spread of the virus outside of China, as well as any documented deaths, would bolster the case for reconvening the World Health Organisation's Emergency Committee to consider again whether to declare a public health emergency of international concern.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The independent panel last week twice declined to declare an international emergency.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Outside of China there have now been 45 confirmed cases in 13 countries, with no deaths so far, the WHO's spokesman Christian Lindmeier told a briefing in Geneva on Tuesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The WHO said a case in Vietnam involved human-to-human transmission outside China and a Japanese official has said there was a suspected case of human-to-human transmission there too.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">WUHAN CONNECTION</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Andreas Zapf, president of Bavaria's office for health and food safety, said on Tuesday the first person infected was 33 years old, lived in the district of Landsberg about 50 kilometres (31 miles) west of Munich and had come into contact with a Chinese lady on Jan. 21.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Zapf said the Chinese woman was from Shanghai but her parents, who are from the Wuhan region, had visited her a few days earlier.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">He added that she had arrived in Germany on Jan. 19, appearing not to have any symptoms, but began to feel ill on her flight home on Jan. 23. She sought medical treatment after landing and tested positive for coronavirus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">When that information was relayed back to the German company, a male employee said he felt like he had flu over the weekend and was on Monday advised to get medical treatment.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The head doctor at the clinic where the man is being treated told a news conference the patient was awake and responsive and he did not think the man's life was at risk.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Health Minister Jens Spahn said the risk to people's health in Germany from the coronavirus remained low. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Michelle Martin in Berlin; Additional reporting by Madeline Chambers in Berlin, Alexander Huebner in Munich, Kanishka Singh in Bengaluru and Kenneth Maxwell in Tokyo; Editing by Alexandra Hudson and Marguerita Choy)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
