[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-dd6a2e6" itemprop="headline"><span>Coronavirus Outbreak May Disrupt Apple's iPhone Production Ramp Up Plans: Nikkei</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Reuters) - Apple Inc's plan to ramp up iPhone production by 10% in the first half of this year may hit a roadblock as the coronavirus outbreak spreads across China, the Nikkei Asian Review reported on Tuesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The company has asked its suppliers, many of whom have manufacturing centers in China, to make up to 80 million iPhones in the first half of 2020, the Nikkei reported, citing people familiar with the company's plans. (https://s.nikkei.com/2O6wXuq)</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Apple has booked orders for up to 65 million of its older iPhones and up to 15 million units of a new cut-price model that it plans to unveil in March, according to the report.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">However, the mass production which is due to start in the third week of February might be delayed due to the virus outbreak, the Nikkei reported.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The coronavirus outbreak has so far killed more than 100 people and infected over 4,500 in China, stranded tens of millions during the Lunar New Year holiday and rattled global markets.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Apple's shares rose about 86% in 2019, outperforming a 29% rise in the S&amp;P 500 index. The stock closed down nearly 3% at $308.95 on Monday as coronavirus fears dragged down high-flying U.S. chip and technology stocks.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Cupertino, California-based Apple, which raked in more than $142 billion in iPhone sales in fiscal 2019, has introduced lower priced smartphone variants to woo budget conscious shoppers and check declining sales of its biggest product category.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Last October, Nikkei reported that Apple asked its suppliers to increase production of iPhone 11 models by up to 8 million units, or about 10%, hinting that demand for the recently launched versions of its flagship phone was picking up.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The iPhone maker is set to report its first-quarter earnings after markets close on Tuesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Apple did not respond to a Reuters request for comment.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Subrat Patnaik and Roshan Abraham in Bengaluru; Editing by Shounak Dasgupta)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-614d02f6" itemprop="headline"><span>Japanese Coach Driver Who Met Wuhan Tourists Catches Coronavirus: Ministry</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">TOKYO — A Japanese coach driver has been infected with the new coronavirus after coming into contact with Chinese visitors, officials said on Tuesday, the first reported case of a possible transmission inside Japan.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The man in his 60s from Nara prefecture had contact with people from the central Chinese city of Wuhan - the epicentre of the outbreak - between Jan. 8-16, Japan's health ministry said. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The case will fuel concerns about the spread of the flu-like virus that broke out in Wuhan at the end of last year and has killed 106 people and infected more than 4,500.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Confirmation of any sustained human-to-human spread of the virus outside of China, as well as any documented deaths, would bolster the case for reconvening the World Health Organisation's Emergency Committee to consider again whether to declare a public health emergency of international concern.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Both Germany and Vietnam have reported cases of the disease transmitted inside their borders.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Japanese driver began showing symptoms on Jan. 14 and was hospitalized 11 days later, according to the health ministry statement.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A ministry official, briefing reporters, said the driver had been in close contact with 18 people.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Kevin Buckland and Kiyoshi Takenaka; [<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-2427c15b" itemprop="headline"><span>Dubai Port Operator DP World Suspends Staff Travel to China</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">DUBAI — DP World, one of the world's largest port operators, has suspended all staff travel to China until further notice due to the coronavirus outbreak there.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Companies including Facebook, LG Electronics and Standard Chartered are among those restricting travel for employees to China, where the death toll from a flu-like virus rose above 100 on Tuesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"All travel to China is suspended until further notice, unless for emergency purposes. We continue to monitor WHO and Government advice," a spokesman at Dubai state-controlled DP World told Reuters on Tuesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">DP World's website shows it operates at three ports in mainland China and at another port in Hong Kong.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Chinese nationals would be permitted to travel to China if they needed to go home, the spokesman added.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"All our ports are complying with the official government health ministry directive for operations, staff health precautions and risk mitigation plans," he said, adding that ports need to continue to operate for welfare and health purposes, including the import of food and medicine.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Dubai's Emirates airline has advised its flight crew to stay in their hotels when on a layover in China due to the coronavirus, an internal notice seen by Reuters showed.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The United States has warned against travel to China, where the coronavirus outbreak has left millions of Chinese stranded during the country's biggest holiday of the year. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Alexander Cornwell, writing by Davide Barbuscia; editing by Jason Neely and Alexander Smith)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-7d864b0d" itemprop="headline"><span>South Koreans Call in Petition for Chinese to Be Barred Over Virus</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">SEOUL — More than half a million South Koreans have signed a petition calling for a ban on visitors from China as Seoul announced on Tuesday it would evacuate citizens from the epicentre of the new coronavirus outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A petition filed with the presidential Blue House last week had gathered more than 540,000 signatures by Tuesday, highlighting a growing fear in South Korea that the coronavirus could spread.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">South Korea has found four cases of the virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The first was a Chinese national but the other three are South Koreans who travelled from the central Chinese city of Wuhan, where the outbreak started.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">That has not stopped the calls for Chinese visitors to be banned.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Coronavirus is spreading from China. Even North Korea is banning Chinese people from entering," wrote the anonymous author of the petition, adding that even a temporary ban would help stop the virus from spreading too widely.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Blue House has not directly responded to the petition. When asked about other countries' bans on Chinese entries, its spokesman said only that the issue should be handled in close consultation with the World Health Organisation.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The newly identified coronavirus has created alarm because many of its details are still unknown. It can cause pneumonia, which has been deadly in some cases. It is still too early to know just how dangerous it is and how easily it spreads.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"The government must respond to the petition and come up with strong measures such as barring Chinese tourists," said a passerby in Seoul, a man in his 50s who only gave his surname Chae. He was wearing a surgical mask.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Kim Eun-kyung, 40, a social worker with two children, said she was also concerned about the outbreak but she also worried that a ban on visitors could upset China and bring "political, economic risks".</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">EVACUATION PLANS</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The South Korean government says it is making "all-out efforts" to head off an outbreak and announced it would send at least four flights to Wuhan this week to evacuate nearly 700 South Korean citizens.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We've come to this decision because our citizens there can't return on their own due to the lockdown in the region, and they were unable to get proper medical treatment as local clinics are at full capacity," vice foreign minister Lee Tae-ho told a briefing.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">People hoping to leave would be screened before they boarded the flights, he said. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The evacuated citizens are expected to be quarantined for about two weeks at two government facilities south of Seoul.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">On Tuesday, President Moon Jae-in visited a hospital that had been treating one of the four patients, and sent a message to Chinese President Xi Jinping promising to help contain the spread of the virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(This story has been refiled to correct headline to 'S.Koreans').</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Hyonhee Shin and Sangmi Cha; Additional reporting by Chaeyoun Won; Writing by Josh Smith; Editing by Gerry Doyle, Robert Birsel)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<h1 class="css-1jrl1ex">Page No Longer Available</h1>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-22cb22c7" itemprop="headline"><span>Global Stocks Rally in Big Rebound, Safe-Havens Lose Luster</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">NEW YORK — Global equity markets rebounded in a broad rally on Tuesday and some safe-haven assets eased as investors took a less pessimistic view of the potential economic fallout from China's coronavirus outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Gold fell and the Japanese yen dipped against the dollar, but risk aversion in currency markets persisted, with the Australian dollar leading losers and the greenback strengthening to an eight-week high against a basket of six rivals.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In a possible warning of a future weak economy, strong gains in U.S. Treasuries this week led key parts of the U.S. yield curve to reinvert, a trend that in the past has indicated that a recession in the United States will follow in a year or two. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Gains in technology and financial shares helped Wall Street recoup some losses from Monday's selloff, which was sparked by worries about the possible economic impact of the coronavirus outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Major European and U.S. stock indexes rebounded around 1% as President Xi Jinping said China was sure of defeating a "devil" coronavirus that has killed 106 people. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The World Health Organization's director-general said he is confident China can control the spread of the coronavirus, the Chinese Foreign Ministry said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Chinese markets will remain closed until next week, but a 0.5% overnight drop in Tokyo's Nikkei was more modest than Monday's thumping. Other Asian markets that were open rallied.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"History shows us as we look back at several different examples that these viral outbreaks tend to be short lived," said Candice Bangsund, a global asset allocation portfolio manager at Fiera Capital in Montreal.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">While markets should gyrate for awhile, the global economy will resume the improving growth it started to exhibit late last year, Bangsund said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"The economy could be ripe for a sharp snapback or a V-shaped recovery once we find out when this is contained and when the outbreak is indeed brought under control," she said. "We maintain the global economy will come back to life."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">MSCI's gauge of stocks across the globe gained 0.65%, while its emerging market index lost 0.05%.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Shares on Wall Street also surged. The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 187.05 points, or 0.66%, to 28,722.85. The S&amp;P 500 gained 32.61 points, or 1.01%, to 3,276.24 and the Nasdaq Composite added 130.37 points, or 1.43%, to 9,269.68.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Oil futures edged up after falling for five days, following the recovery in equities and talk that Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries and its allies might tighten the market amid fears the coronavirus could weigh on oil demand.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Brent futures settled up 19 cents at $59.51 a barrel, while U.S. West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude settled up 34 cents at $53.48. [O/R]</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The yield on the benchmark 10-year U.S. Treasury note bounced off three-month lows after a key part of the yield curve briefly inverted for the first time since October.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The yield fell as low as 1.57% overnight, the lowest since Oct. 10, before the 10-year note pared some losses to fall 13/32 in price and lift its yield to 1.6493%.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">An inverted curve, when longer-dated yields fall below shorter-maturity ones, has often been a precursor of a U.S. recession.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Euro zone government bond yields bounced off three-month lows to rise for the first time in over a week after U.S. consumer confidence exceeded expectations to hit its highest level since August.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Traders awaited the outcome of a two-day meeting of Federal Reserve policymakers, which started on Tuesday. The market consensus is that the central bank will keep interest rates unchanged at between 1.5% and 1.75%.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The dollar index rose 0.02%, with the euro up 0.03% to $1.1019. The yen weakened 0.24% versus the greenback at 109.15 per dollar.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">U.S. gold futures settled down 0.5% at $1,569.8 an ounce.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Herbert Lash; Editing by Bernadette Baum, Lisa Shumaker and David Gregorio)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-3b2d583b" itemprop="headline"><span>What's New in the China Virus Outbreak</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">The Associated Press</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">More than 4,500 cases of a new viral respiratory illness have been confirmed since an outbreak began last month in the Chinese city of Wuhan. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Scientists have identified the illness as a new kind of coronavirus. Coronaviruses are a large family of viruses, some of which cause the common cold. Others have evolved into more severe illnesses, such as SARS and MERS, although so far the new virus does not appear to be as deadly or contagious. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Symptoms of the new virus include fever, cough and shortness of breath.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">WHAT'S NEW:</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">— The virus has killed more than 100 people. China has cut off access to Wuhan and 16 other cities in Hubei province to try to prevent people from spreading it, trapping more than 50 million people. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">— The United States was among several other nations airlifting citizens out of Wuhan. Hong Kong's leader said it will cut all rail links to mainland China and halve the number of flights. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">— U.S. health officials moved to expand their checks of international travelers for signs of the virus, but they stressed the risk to Americans remains very low.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">— The virus is posing a threat to the fragile world economy. China, with the world’s No. 2 economy, was decelerating even before the virus hit. The virus is drawing comparisons to the SARS outbreak, which battered the economies of China and Hong Kong in 2003. Today, China represents an even bigger piece of the pie: 16% of global output now, compared with 4% in 2003, according to the World Bank.</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-b2db352" itemprop="headline"><span>U.S. Says Nothing Off the Table on China Travel Curbs Amid Virus Outbreak</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Reuters) - The United States is considering new steps to counter a coronavirus outbreak that has killed over 100 people in China and nothing is off the table in terms of possible travel restrictions for China, the U.S. health secretary said on Tuesday. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The United States, which so far has five confirmed cases of the new coronavirus, has urged Americans to reconsider travel plans to China because of the outbreak. It also warned specifically against travel to the Hubei province, the epicenter of the outbreak in China with thousands of cases. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Secretary of Health and Human Services Alex Azar said during a news conference that he had offered to send a team of U.S. infectious disease experts to China to assist with its public health efforts and urged them to be more transparent.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Beyond that, all options for dealing with infectious disease spread have to be on the table, including travel restrictions," he said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The World Health Organization said on Tuesday that China has agreed that it can send international experts "as soon as possible." </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Manas Mishra in Bengaluru and Caroline Humer in New York; Editing by Sriraj Kalluvila and Bill Berkrot)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]

[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-547e8cd2" itemprop="headline"><span>Philippines Halts Visas on Arrival for Chinese on Virus Fears</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">MANILA — The Philippines stopped issuing visas on arrival to Chinese nationals on Tuesday, in a bid to keep the southeast Asian nation free of a new virus that has killed 106 and infected more than 4,500 since emerging in China in December. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">There have been no confirmed cases in the Philippines since the coronavirus outbreak began in China's central city of Wuhan, but infections have been confirmed in Japan, Nepal, Singapore, South Korea, Taiwan, Thailand, the United States and Vietnam. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We are taking this proactive measure to slow down travel, and possibly help prevent the entry of the 2019-nCov," Jaime Morente, the commissioner of the Philippines' Bureau of Immigration, said in a statement, referring to the virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">There is no order barring Chinese nationals from entering the Philippines, however, Morente added.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">He did not say when the facility would be resumed. Chinese nationals can still apply for visas at any Philippine embassy or consulate at their places of residence.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Health authorities are monitoring more than 11 suspected cases of the new coronavirus, they said on Tuesday. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The "visa upon arrival" facility has been offered to Chinese nationals since 2017, in an effort to boost tourism. Those eligible included investors and businessmen, athletes, delegates to international conventions and tour groups. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Chinese tourists accounted for 22% of the 7.5 million visitors to the Philippines between January and November last year, making China the second top nation of origin for international travellers to the country.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Karen Lema and Neil Jerome Morales; Editing by Tom Hogue and Clarence Fernandez)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-69119f5d" itemprop="headline"><span>Finnair Cancels Some China Flights as Virus Fears Spread</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Reuters) - Finnish airline Finnair said it would suspend its routes to Nanjing and Beijing's Daxing airport until the end of March, the first European airline to cancel flights to mainland China amid growing fears about the spread of a new flu-like virus. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The move comes after Beijing suspended international group travel from the country as a part of its efforts to control the outbreak of the coronoavirus, the airline said. On Tuesday, the death toll rose to 106 people. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">It will affect the airline's three weekly flights between Finland's capital Helsinki and the Chinese capital Beijing and two weekly routes to Nanjing in Jiangsu province. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">They have a higher proportion of group travelers on them than its other routes.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">It estimated that the direct financial impact of group cancellations, ticket refunds and flight cancellations for February will be moderate.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"These cancellations are needed to manage the impacts of the recent suspension of group travel by Chinese authorities, which have a pronounced impact on the load factors of our Beijing Daxing and Nanjing flights," said Jaakko Schildt, chief operating officer of Finnair.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The airline has become popular with travelers between Europe and Asia because the flight time with a stopover in Helsinki is shorter than layovers in other parts of Europe and the Middle East.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Airlines have been cancelling and adjusting schedules as a growing number of countries raise travel warnings not just to Hubei province where the new coronavirus broke out, but also to the rest of mainland China. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Nanjing is 600 kilometers northeast of Wuhan, the epicenter of the virus outbreak in Hubei province, while Beijing is 1,200 km north of Wuhan.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Tarmo Virki, Additional reporting by Tommy Lund, Editing by Louise Heavens and Josephine Mason)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" [<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-20160e0a" itemprop="headline"><span>China's Beijing Suspends Most Bus Services to Hebei to Curb Virus Spread</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">SHANGHAI — China's Beijing Public Transport Group said it will suspend the majority of bus services into neighbouring Hebei province starting on Tuesday to contain the spread of coronavirus, according to a statement on its official Weibo account.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Winni Zhou, Josh Horwitz and David Stanway; Editing by Sandra Maler)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-3be4187a" itemprop="headline"><span>China Agrees to WHO Sending Experts to Study Virus</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">GENEVA — China has agreed that the World Health Organization will send international experts there as soon as possible to increase understanding of a new coronavirus and guide the global response to the outbreak, the U.N. agency said on Tuesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In a statement after a two-day visit by WHO director-general Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, who met Chinese President Xi Jinping as well as the health and foreign ministers, it said that a better understanding of the virus' ability to spread from person to person was urgently needed to advise other countries.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"The discussions focused on continued collaboration on containment measures in Wuhan, public health measures in other cities and provinces, conducting further studies on the severity and transmissibility of the virus, continuing to share data, and for China to share biological material with WHO," the WHO said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">This would contribute to developing vaccines and treatments.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"The two sides agreed that WHO will send international experts to visit China as soon as possible to work with Chinese counterparts on increasing understanding of the outbreak to guide global response efforts," the WHO added, without giving a time frame.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Xi said earlier on Tuesday that China was sure of defeating the "devil" coronavirus that has killed 106 people, spread across the world and rattled financial markets.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Tedros can reconvene the WHO Emergency Committee on very short notice as needed, to consider whether the outbreak constitutes an international emergency, the WHO said in the statement, which made no reference to evacuations of foreigners that both sides say were discussed in the Beijing talks. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The WHO's independent panel met twice last week, but declined to declare a global emergency.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Stephanie Nebehay; Editing by Emma Farge and Giles Elgood)</p>, The virus has killed over 100 people in China and has spread to more than 10 countries.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Josh Horwitz; Editing by Kim Coghill)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-148cbd2" itemprop="headline"><span>The Latest: Australia and New Zealand to Evacuate Citizens</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">The Associated Press</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BEIJING — The Latest on the outbreak of a new virus from China:</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">11: 15 a.m.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Australia and New Zealand will work together to evacuate their isolated and vulnerable citizens from China’s virus-hit Hubei province.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison on Wednesday could not say how many or how soon citizens would be flown by Qantas from Hubei. The departures would be arranged in consultation with China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The citizens would be sent for 14 days to a quarantine center on Christmas Island, an Australian territory in the Indian Ocean which has been used to hold asylum seekers and foreign criminals facing deportation.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Australia and New Zealand have also ratcheted up their travel advice for China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Australia has advised its citizens to reconsider their need to travel to China and not to travel to Hubei.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">New Zealand's government advised people to avoid all non-essential travel to China due to the coronavirus outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">_____</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">10 a.m.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Two Japanese men evacuated from a virus-hit Chinese city say they felt relieved but also exhausted upon their arrival in Tokyo.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">They were aboard a chartered flight Japan arranged to evacuate 206 Japanese citizens from Wuhan.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Takeo Aoyama who works for Nippon Steel Corp. and Takayuki Kato, who works for Intec, both wore masks but said they felt fine.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Kato said he was not panicking in Wuhan, but “I was shocked when all transportation systems were suspended. That’s when the situation drastically changed."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China cut off access to Wuhan and 16 other cities to try to contain the outbreak of the new type of coronavirus that has infected thousands of people.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Aoyama said many people who wish to go home to Japan are still in Wuhan, including workers at a Japanese supermarket chain staying open to supply food.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">He said it is important to step up preventive measures in Japan, but “I hope we can also provide support for the Chinese people, which I think would also help the Japanese people who are still there.”</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-337a06a7" itemprop="headline"><span>Facebook Asks Employees to Put Off Non-Essential Travel to China</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">SHANGHAI — Facebook Inc has asked employees to suspend non-essential travel to mainland China to prevent the spread of the coronavirus, a spokesman said on Tuesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The company also told employees who had travelled to China to work from home.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Out of an abundance of caution, we have taken steps to protect the health and safety of our employees," a company spokesman told Reuters. The virus has killed over 100 people in China and has spread to more than 10 countries.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Josh Horwitz; Editing by Kim Coghill)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-2009f79e" itemprop="headline"><span>Bali to Bangkok: China Virus Threatens Disaster for Tourist Hotspots</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">JAKARTA/BANGKOK — The colourful dances of Bali's annual Kintamani Festival have fallen victim to coronavirus -- and travel restrictions to halt its spread could prove costly for other places that rely on Chinese tourists.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Promoted by the Indonesian island as a draw for Chinese holidaymakers, the Feb. 8 festival to celebrate the marriage of an ancient king of Bali to a Chinese princess has been called off in anticipation of a collapse in visitor numbers.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In other Asian destinations, too, fear of the virus is accompanied by worries that business is about to disappear.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Restaurants, tourist attractions and small businesses in the villages will be affected," said Ketut Ardana, a business owner and vice-chairman of the Bali Tourism Board.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"It will have a big impact on everyone." </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">With a growing area of China in lockdown to try to stop the spread of the virus and overseas group tours banned, he said Bali had already seen nearly 10,000 tourist cancellations. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Just weeks after the disease emerged in the Chinese city of Wuhan, it has already infected more than 4,500 people and killed at least 106.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Thailand, the top destination for China's holidaymakers, forecast that Chinese tourist numbers would fall by as much as 2 million this year from 11 million in 2019. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"If they close China, we will die," complained Teerawat Buakaw, 33, who sells clothes at a Big C store popular with Chinese tourists in Bangkok, the world's most-visited city because of its Chinese tourist numbers.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"All the shops around here will go. What will we do?"</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China's boom in outbound tourism has created a pattern of international travel unprecedented in human history and driven the growth of businesses to serve Chinese travelers around the world. From a trickle in the 1980s, Chinese tourist numbers grew to estimates of more than 160 million in 2019.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Coronavirus may have pulled the plug.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">VULNERABLE</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Among the most vulnerable sectors to the Wuhan virus epidemic are the Asia-Pacific travel and tourism sectors," wrote Rajiv Biswas, Asia Pacific Chief Economist at IHS Markit.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"The Thai economy is particularly vulnerable to the new Chinese travel restrictions."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Thai stocks fell further on Tuesday to a new three-year low after slumping as much as 3% on Monday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Thailand earned an estimated $18 billion from Chinese tourists in 2019. Other countries popular with Chinese tourists include Japan, with nearly 10 million visitors, and Vietnam with around 5 million.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Tourism Authority of Thailand said it hoped other countries would make up for the lack of Chinese tourists, but Thailand must also contend with having had more coronavirus infections than anywhere outside China -- 14 so far.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Luxury tour operator Abercrombie &amp; Kent Thailand Ltd., which has no Chinese customers, said it had not had cancellations yet.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Elsewhere in the region, immigration authorities in the Philippines said they would stop issuing tourist visas on arrival to Chinese nationals to try to keep the country free of the virus -- hurting a growing business there.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Malaysian authorities said their "Visit Malaysia 2020" plan to boost tourist numbers by 5 million to 30 million would take a jolt, but they still hoped to make up the numbers. Malaysia had nearly 5 million Chinese visitors last year.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Hoteliers in the beach playground of Bali hoped the same. China has become an ever bigger source of tourists for them -- their number regularly surpassing that of the traditional Australia hordes.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Bali only has tourism. If there are no tourists, it is difficult for us," Ardana said. "We hope that other countries will still be coming."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Additional reporting by Chayut Setboonsarng, Orathai Sriring and Kay Johnson in Bangkok; Krishna N. Das and Liz Lee in Kuala Lumpur; Editing by Catherine Evans)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-721cd066" itemprop="headline"><span>Barclays Sees $2/bbl Impact to Oil Prices as Virus Fears Threaten Demand</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Reuters) - Barclays said on Tuesday oil prices will be impacted by $2 per barrel on the potential economic fallout from the coronavirus outbreak in China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">More than 100 people have died and over 4,000 cases of the new virus have been confirmed in China, leading authorities to increase preventive measures, impose travel restrictions and also extend the Lunar New Year holidays to limit the spread of the virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The bank sees a $2 per barrel downside to their full-year Brent and WTI forecasts of $62 per barrel and $57 per barrel, respectively.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Compounding the effects of the spillover to economic growth from China and the region, Barclays expects transitory oil demand erosion of about 0.6-0.8 million barrels per day (mb/d) in the first quarter of this year, or 0.2 mb/d for the full year.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"If air passenger traffic in China declined by half in first quarter of 2020, it would likely lead to a 300,000 barrels per day year on year decline in jet-kerosene demand from China," the bank said adding the fall in road transport would likely be less severe than in the past given reduced reliance on buses.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Barclays expects the Organisation of the Petroleum Exporting Countries and other allies to step in and take further measures to keep the markets tight, in case the fall in demand is more acute.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Oil prices have been down for the last six sessions, but the bank said that the market reaction was likely overdone.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Barclays said the actual economic fallout from the coronavirus could be less severe than the 2003 SARS outbreak, given that the new virus seems less lethal than SARS so far and the measures taken by Chinese authorities.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The bank said the geopolitical risks to global supplies remain high as U.S.-Iran tensions could continue to gradually escalate and oil production in Libya could fall further if the blockade of key infrastructure facilities continues.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Brent crude prices &lt;LCOc1&gt; are currently trading around $59 per barrel and U.S. WTI at around at $53 per barrel. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Sumita Layek in Bengaluru; Editing by Shounak Dasgupta)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" [<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-40d62d6b" itemprop="headline"><span>Japan Plane Evacuating Citizens Arrives Tokyo From Virus-Hit Wuhan</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">TOKYO — A chartered plane carrying 206 Japanese nationals evacuated from Wuhan, the epicenter of China's coronavirus outbreak, arrived at Tokyo's Haneda airport on Wednesday, as the death toll from the new strain rose to 132. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Japanese Foreign Minister Toshimitsu Motegi said on Tuesday that 650 Japanese citizens were hoping to come home, and the government was making arrangements for additional flights.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has stressed that the government will explore all possible measures to bring back all those citizens who want to return to Japan.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Kiyoshi Takenaka; Editing by Alex Richardson and Tom Hogue)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-3285f6a4" itemprop="headline"><span>WHO Chief and Xi Discussed Protection of Chinese, Foreigners: WHO</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">GENEVA — The head of the World Health Organization (WHO) and China's President Xi Jinping have discussed ways to protect Chinese and foreigners in areas affected by the coronavirus and "possible alternatives" to evacuations, a WHO spokesman said on Tuesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, who arrived in Beijing on Monday, will return to Geneva on Wednesday, WHO spokesman Christian Lindmeier told a Geneva briefing. The WHO Emergency Committee is being 'kept in the loop' on the evolution of the outbreak, which has spread to 13 other countries, he said. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The WHO has not seen onward human-to-human spread of the virus by travelers returning from China apart from a second family member infected by a returning relative in Vietnam, which is "good news but of course this could change", Lindmeier said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Stephanie Nebehay and Emma Farge; writing by Stephanie Nebehay; editing by)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]

[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-45b4ba46" itemprop="headline"><span>3M Forecasts 2020 Profit Below Estimates on Weak China Demand</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Reuters) - U.S. industrial giant 3M Co forecast 2020 profit below expectations after narrowly missing quarterly revenue estimates on Tuesday as weak demand from China dents overall growth. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Shares of the company, which draws a third of its revenue from Asia, fell 4.2% and were the biggest drag on the Dow Jones Industrial Average in morning trading.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Sales in Asia-Pacific region, its largest market outside the United States, fell for the fifth straight quarter, weighed by softness in China's automotive and electronics sectors, a reason that had forced 3M to cut jobs and production last year.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The company said it would cut 1,500 jobs as it continues to restructure its businesses and reduce costs. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China, the world's second largest economy, grew at its slowest pace in almost three decades in 2019 amid a trade war that hit factory production, while auto sales slumped for the 18th straight month.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We were looking at a sluggish start to China in first quarter...based on automotive, and the build rate's expected to be down mid-single digits and maybe even high single digits," Chief Executive Officer Michael Roman said in an post earnings call.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Executives, however, said the company was ramping up production of its respiratory protection products to match global demand arising from coronavirus outbreak in China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Asia-Pacific sales were down 1.7%, while Europe, Middle East and Africa reported a decline of 2%. Sales in the United States rose 7.4%.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We expect investors to generally be disappointed with the print, guidance and the new PFAS-related charges, while rapidly advancing Coronavirus concerns ultimately could pull the rug out from under the Asia recovery story," Gordon Haskett analyst John Inch said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">3M recorded a $214 million writedown for litigation related to PFAS chemicals. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Sales at its healthcare unit, which accounted for 25% to total revenue, rose about 25.4% on strength in international markets.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">3M said it expects 2020 earnings per share to be between $9.30 and $9.75, the midpoint of which was below analysts' average estimate of $9.61 per share.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Net income attributable to 3M fell 28% to $969 million, largely due to restructuring and litigation charges.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">On an adjusted basis, it earned $2.15 per share, beating expectations of $2.10, according to IBES data from Refinitiv.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Net sales fell 2.1% to $8.11 billion and missed expectations of $8.12 billion.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(This story corrects paragraph 12 to say the midpoint of 2020 earnings forecast was below Wall Street estimates, not above) </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Rachit Vats in Bengaluru; Editing by Sweta Singh and Arun Koyyur)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-743a6471" itemprop="headline"><span>Global Turmoil to Be Good for Gold-Reuters Poll</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BENGALURU — Gold prices will hold above $1,500 (1,141 pounds) an ounce this year and make modest gains in 2021 as low interest rates and geopolitical uncertainly bolster its appeal, while silver prices will begin to catch up, a Reuters poll showed on Tuesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Gold is traditionally seen as a safe store of value during times of turmoil and becomes more popular when other assets offer low returns. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Prices &lt;XAU=&gt; shot up 18% last year - the biggest annual gain since 2010 - as global economic growth faltered and central banks responded by easing monetary policy. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The metal is pushing towards $1,600 and its highest since 2013 as an outbreak of coronavirus in China threatens to disrupt economic activity.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The poll of 36 analysts and traders, mainly conducted before coronavirus hit the headlines, returned a median forecast for gold to average $1,546 an ounce this year and $1,600 in 2021. &lt;COMMODS-GOLD&gt; </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The prediction for 2020 is $34 higher than in a similar poll conducted three months ago and compares with an average price of $1,394 last year.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Gold has re-established its safe-haven status," said Standard Chartered analyst Suki Cooper. "We expect gold to test seven-year highs in 2020, even though we see the U.S. Federal Reserve on hold throughout the year."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Fed is expected to keep interest rates unchanged after cutting three times last year.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Longer-term risk-hedgers are expected to remain in the market, providing a cushion for any price weakness," said INTL FCStone analyst Rhona O'Connell.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(GRAPHIC: Gold and silver prices - https://fingfx.thomsonreuters.com/gfx/ce/7/8284/8265/GOLD%20SILVER%20POLL%20Q1%202020.jpg)</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">For spot silver &lt;XAG=&gt;, the poll returned median forecasts for prices to average $18.28 an ounce in 2020 and $19.13 next year. &lt;COMMODS-SILVER&gt; </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Silver last year rose 15% -- its biggest annual gain in three years -- and on Tuesday traded around $18. The poll three months ago predicted prices would average $18.13 in 2020. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">While it shares gold's role as a perceived safe haven asset, silver is also used in industries such as electronics and solar panels. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Weakening economic growth and industrial activity last year slowed silver's rise, with gold at one point costing 93 times more than silver -- the largest multiple since the 1992. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">That ratio will fall to an average of around 85 this year and 84 in 2021, the poll suggests, helped in part by better prospects for industrial consumption.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We anticipate that a small uptick in global industrial growth will amplify any upward pressure on silver demand," said Caroline Bain, an analyst at Capital Economics.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Eileen Soreng in Bengaluru; editing by Arpan Varghese, Peter Hobson and Barbara Lewis)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-bc853b8" itemprop="headline"><span>Hong Kong Suspends Some Rail, Ferry Links With Mainland to Curb Virus Spread</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">HONG KONG — Hong Kong leader Carrie Lam announced plans on Tuesday to suspend high-speed rail and ferry links with mainland China as the global financial hub scrambles to limit the spread of a new coronavirus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">More than 100 people have died from the flu-like virus, which emerged in China's central city of Wuhan in December, with the number of confirmed cases at 4,515 by Monday, up from 2,835 the previous day, health authorities have said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">High-speed rail services will be suspended from midnight on Thursday, Lam said, adding that the number of flights to mainland China would also be halved and personal travel permits for mainland Chinese to the city would be suspended. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"I thank the central government for supporting our work in this aspect (suspending cross-border transport) and the relevant mainland ministries and commissions for co-operating with us," she told a news conference. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Speaking just days after she announced a virus emergency, Lam, wearing a green mask, also urged Hong Kong residents to return from the mainland as soon as possible and quarantine themselves at home for 14 days. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">With Hong Kong financial markets set to reopen on Wednesday after the Lunar New Year holiday, Lam was flanked at the news conference by the city's health secretary, Sophia Chan, and its commerce secretary, Edward Yau, both also wearing masks. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Chan said the former British colony had eight confirmed infections, while 100 patients were in quarantine. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Beijing-backed Lam defended her decision not to close the entire border, saying such a move would prevent the return home of Hong Kong people, some of whom commute daily. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A union of hospital workers, the Hospital Authority Employees Alliance, gave the government until Tuesday to heed its demands, which include barring entry from mainland China, before it plans to go on strike. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The government had failed to contain the spread of the disease, a rights group, the Civil Human Rights Front, and democracy activists said in a joint statement, reiterating calls to close the border. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Citizens have to start fending for themselves as the government has been extremely slow to respond to demands and requests, implementing problematic anti-epidemic measures," they said. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"The Civil Human Rights Front and all Hong Kong people are requesting the Hong Kong ... government to close off borders to fight the epidemic at its source!"</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Hong Kong's security secretary, John Lee, said the government would relocate resources to all border checkpoints to strengthen controls against the outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The coronavirus has rattled global markets and unnerved residents of Hong Kong, still haunted by memories of the Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) that killed nearly 300 people in the city in 2003. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Jessie Pang and Felix Tam; Writing by Anne Marie Roantree; Editing by Andrew Heavens and Clarence Fernandez)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3
