See you tomorrow.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">During the West African Ebola outbreak in 2014, when a few cases turned up in the United States, some hospitals were unable to get waterproof Tyvek suits “because there was a run on them,” said Dr. Amesh Adalja, a scholar at the Center for Health Security at the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health in Baltimore.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Panicked people engage in irrational impulse buying, he said: “People like to buy duct tape during emergencies — it’s psychologically soothing.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But artificial shortages can harm those who really need the goods.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“I think public health authorities like the H.H.S. or the C.D.C. or the Surgeon General should be talking about the repercussions of a run on masks,” Dr. Adalja said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Kristen Nordlund, a C.D.C. spokeswoman, said she would ask <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.cdc.gov/about/leadership/leaders/ncird.html" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">Dr. Nancy Messonnier</a>, director of the National Center for Immunization and Respiratory Diseases to address that issue in her next public briefing.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Masks are part of the medical equipment stored in the National Strategic Stockpile, which is distributed in government-controlled warehouses around the country. But experts said they did not know how many were in storage or how long the supply was projected to last in an epidemic.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">On Tuesday, major pharmacy chains said they were seeing spot shortages but were not yet restricting sales. The CVS chain had stores running out of masks and was resupplying them “as quickly as possible,” said Stephanie Cunha, a company spokeswoman.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Walgreens and Duane Reade pharmacies saw greater demand for face masks and hand sanitizer in many stores, said Alexandra Brown, a spokeswoman for the Walgreens Boots Alliance, which owns both chains.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The company is moving supplies “to meet the needs of our customers,” she added.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Masks are not very protective when worn by healthy people, experts say. People often pull them aside for a variety of reasons.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Vapor from breath can leave masks soggy, for example. Users may want to talk on their cellphones, or put their fingers under their masks to scratch their noses. Frequent handwashing is considered more protective.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Yet there is strong evidence that masks protect health workers.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Trials in Canadian hospitals during <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3322898/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">the 2003 SARS epidemic </a>and <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jama/fullarticle/184819" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">during flu season</a> showed that nurses who wore a mask were less likely to get flu.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Nurses who wore N-95 masks — which are thicker, fit tighter to the face and are designed to filter out 95 percent of all particles — were particularly protective for those who did dangerous procedures like intubating SARS patients.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">[</em></strong><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="http://on.fb.me/1paTQ1h" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title=""><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">Like the Science Times page on Facebook.</em></a></strong><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0"> </em></strong><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">| Sign up for the </em><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="http://nyti.ms/1MbHaRU" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title=""><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">Science Times newsletter.</em></a></strong><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">]</em></strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">There is less data proving that masks keep patients from spreading germs. But this common sense notion has led many hospitals to adopt rules saying that any emergency room patient with flu symptoms is immediately handed a mask and asked to put it on.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Dr. Mark Loeb, an infectious disease specialist at McMaster University in Hamilton, Ontario, who led the SARS and flu trials, said one <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://bmjopen.bmj.com/content/6/12/e012330.long" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">relatively small study of hospitalized flu patients in Beijing</a> found that mask-wearers were less likely to infect their family members. But the effect was so small that it was considered statistically insignificant.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Another obstacle to mask-wearing is psychological.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">People who are sick and should be wearing a mask are often reluctant to do so, because it makes them stand out in the crowd. Unless these patients are ordered to wear one — as they might be in a hospital emergency room — people are reluctant to do so.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“When masks aren’t common in a culture, it does raise eyebrows,” Dr. Adalja said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The exceptions are in some Asian communities, where it is common for people to wear masks to protect themselves against germs and pollution, or because it is considered impolite to not wear a mask if one is coughing or sneezing.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Experts, including Dr. Patel of the C.D.C., said they knew of no studies of the psychology of mask usage or how reluctance could be overcome.</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-5f91e701" itemprop="headline"><span>The New Coronavirus: What Is It and How Does It Behave?</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">LONDON — Here are some key features of viruses and the new coronavirus that was identified in the central Chinese city of Wuhan in December and is causing an outbreak of disease in China and beyond.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">** Coronaviruses are a family of viruses that get their name from what they look like under a microscope - they are spherical and their surfaces are covered with "crown"-like spikes.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">** Coronavirus infections have a wide range of symptoms, including fever, coughing, shortness of breath and breathing difficulties. Mild cases can cause cold-like symptoms, while severe cases can cause pneumonia, severe acute respiratory illness, kidney failure and death.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">** Like other coronaviruses, the newly identified China coronavirus is being transmitted from person-to-person via droplets when an infected person breathes out, coughs or sneezes. It can also spread via contaminated surfaces such as door handles or railings.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">** Infection with the newly identified virus has an incubation period of between one and 14 days, and there are limited accounts that it may also be spreading before symptoms show.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">** Infectious disease and virus specialists say the scale of the current outbreak now points to "self-sustaining" human-to-human transmission. They estimate that each infected person is infecting, on average, two to three more people.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">** Animal viruses can mutate or combine with other viruses to create new strains capable of being passed to people. Scientists say the new coronavirus originated in bats and then passed to humans, possibly via an intermediary animal species.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">** Genetic data suggest the new coronavirus is the result of viral recombination - a process where more than one virus infects the same cell at the same time and creates a "recombinant" virus strain. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Kate Kelland; editing by Nick Macfie)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-689fda29" itemprop="headline"><span>Thailand to Screen Tour Guides for Coronavirus</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BANGKOK — Thai health officials said on Wednesday they will start screening tourist sector workers for coronavirus as part of measures to control the spread of the new disease that has killed 132 people in China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Thailand has seen 14 cases of coronavirus, more than any country outside of China, which has confirmed nearly 6,000 cases. All but one of them have been among Chinese visiting Thailand, a popular tourist destination.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We have to monitor Thais in professions that come in contact with foreign tourists, particularly the Chinese," said Tanarak Pipat, deputy director-general of the Department of Disease Control.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"This includes professions like guides and tour leaders that bring Chinese travelers to Thailand. If they exhibit symptoms like fever, cough or sour throat then we have to scan for coronavirus."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Tens of thousands of Chinese tourists visited Thailand in the lead-up to the Lunar New Year on Jan. 25.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">There have so far been no confirmed cases of human-to-human transmission inside Thailand, Tanarak said. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">National carrier Thai Airways Pcl said on Tuesday it was stepping up protective measures such as disinfecting the passenger cabins and cockpits of flights returning from Chinese cities and other high-risk destinations.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Thailand recorded 25,029 arrivals at five airports from Wuhan, the epicenter of the coronavirus outbreak, and other affected Chinese cities, between Jan. 3 and Jan. 27, the health ministry said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Most of those Chinese visitors are believed to have returned home, but there are no official numbers on how many may have been stranded when China's government banned most commercial flights to Wuhan last week.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Most of those people from Wuhan have gone back and we estimate that hundreds remain," Vichit Prakobgosol, president of the Association of Thai Travel Agents told Reuters.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">He said he expects most remaining Chinese tourists to leave within the next 10 days.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Tourism has been hit hard by China's ban on all group tours as China is Thailand's biggest source of visitors, accounting for 28 percent of 39.8 million arrivals last year. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Reduced travel from China could result in 50 billion baht ($1.52 billion) of lost tourism revenue, the tourism ministry estimates.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Tourism Authority of Thailand has said it expects 2 million fewer Chinese tourists this year than last year, when 11 million arrived. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Additional reporting by Chayut Setboonsarng; Editing by Catherine Evans)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" [<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-7d47b266" itemprop="headline"><span>Finland Confirms Its First Coronavirus Case</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">HELSINKI — Finland on Wednesday confirmed its first coronavirus case, on a Chinese traveler from Wuhan, the Finnish Institute for Health and Welfare said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The traveler remains in isolation in Lapland's central hospital in northern Finland, it said in a statement, adding some 15 other people may have been exposed.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Anne Kauranen; Editing by Alison Williams)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-5e1673d6" itemprop="headline"><span>Johnson &amp; Johnson Working on Vaccine for Deadly Coronavirus</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Reuters) - Johnson &amp; Johnson on Wednesday became the latest drugmaker to begin work on developing a vaccine for a new coronavirus that has already killed more than 100 people in China, as health authorities race to contain the outbreak. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">J&amp;J said its vaccine programme would utilise the same technologies used to make its experimental Ebola vaccine, which is currently being administered in the Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Three separate research teams backed by a global coalition set up to fight epidemic diseases last week said they will start work on developing potential vaccines against the new coronavirus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The research will be conducted by drug developers Moderna, Inovio Pharma, and a team at the University of Queensland, Australia.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Gilead Sciences last week said it was assessing whether its experimental Ebola treatment could be used against the coronavirus. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">J&amp;J also said it had donated its HIV drug Prezcobix to China for use in research to find a solution against the outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The United States and Japan evacuated their nationals from the quarantined city of Wuhan, while British Airways suspended flights to mainland China as deaths from a new virus leapt to 133 and a government economist predicted a huge hit to the economy.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Coronavirus infections can lead to respiratory illnesses, some of which can be severe and deadly such as Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) and Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS).</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Manas Mishra in Bengaluru; by the flu-like virus that emerged late last year in Wuhan in the central Hubei province.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Due to the ongoing coronavirus concerns, the X Games Chongli 2020 event countries while China's government has locked down most of Hubei province.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Airlines from around the world are restricting their flights into China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Sports officials have already moved a women's Olympic soccer qualifying tournament from China to Australia, while a tennis regional Fed Cup tie in Dongguan has been [<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <h1 class="css-1s4ffep e1h9rw200" id="link-5130e794" itemprop="headline"><span>Israel, Coronavirus, Huawei: Your Wednesday Briefing</span></h1>, <p class="css-1ifw933 e1wiw3jv0" id="article-summary">Here’s what you need to know.</p>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/mike-ives"><span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Mike Ives</span></a> and <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Sarah Anderson</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s the <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/morning-briefing" title="">sign-up</a>.)</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">Good morning.</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">We’re covering the reaction to <strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">President Trump</strong>’s Mideast peace plan, <strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Boris Johnson</strong>’s balancing act on trade and the kindness of strangers in <strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Wuhan</strong>.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-2d2fa4f4">Trump’s Mideast peace plan favors Israel</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/world/middleeast/israel-west-bank-annex-sovereignty.html" title="">Israel’s cabinet is set to vote this weekend</a> on plans to unilaterally annex the strategically important Jordan River Valley and all Jewish settlements on the West Bank.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel announced the planned vote on Tuesday, just as <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/world/middleeast/peace-plan.html" title="">President Trump unveiled a long-awaited peace plan</a> that would make Jerusalem the undivided capital of Israel without requiring the country to uproot any West Bank settlements.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The annexation would establish what the country’s leaders have coveted since 1967: a permanent eastern border for Israel along the Jordan River, recognized by the United States. That’s certain to further inflame Palestinians.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Context: </strong>Mr. Trump’s plan offers the Palestinians the possibility of a state with limited sovereignty and essentially dismantles 60 years of bipartisan support for a negotiated process between Israelis and Palestinians.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Response: </strong>The Palestinian Authority president, Mahmoud Abbas, immediately denounced it as a “conspiracy deal,” and <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/world/middleeast/arabs-reaction-trump-mideast-peace-plan.html" title="">none of the United States’ Arab allies formally endorsed it</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Another angle: </strong>The announcements by Mr. Trump, who is fighting impeachment charges, and Mr. Netanyahu, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/world/middleeast/netanyahu-immunity.html" title="">who is under indictment</a>, seemed designed to bolster their domestic political fortunes, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/world/middleeast/trump-netanyahu-peace-plan.html" title="">our national security correspondent writes</a>.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-4046de70">As coronavirus spreads, travel warnings pile up</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Governments and businesses around the world <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/world/asia/china-travel-coronoavirus.html" title="">issued new travel warnings for China</a> on Tuesday, as officials in Germany and Japan reported the first known cases of human-to-human transmission in those countries of a coronavirus that originated in the Chinese city of Wuhan. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/world/asia/coronavirus-china.html" title="">Here’s the latest</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Notably, the authorities in Hong Kong <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/world/asia/coronavirus-hong-kong-border.html" title="">said they would suspend high-speed train services</a> between the territory and the Chinese mainland, among other measures, starting on Thursday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Details:</strong> At least 132 people have died from the virus in China, the government said today, and the number of cases there increased to 5,974, up from 4,515 a day earlier. Here’s <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/article/what-is-coronavirus.html" title="">what we know about the virus</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">The science:</strong> Researchers are <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/health/coronavirus-vaccine.html" title="">working on a coronavirus vaccine</a>, but it’s a slow process. And we look at how bats, which could be the source of the outbreak, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/science/bats-coronavirus-Wuhan.html" title="">carry so many viruses</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Go deeper:</strong> The outbreak has <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/business/china-coronavirus-communist-party.html" title="">blown up the Chinese Communist Party’s facade</a> of a unified society, our columnist Li Yuan writes.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Opinion: </strong><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/elisabeth-rosenthal" title="">Elisabeth Rosenthal</a>, a former Times correspondent and emergency room physician, says that <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.html" title="">washing your hands is the best protection</a> against the new coronavirus.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-52de0587">Boris Johnson’s Huawei balancing act</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Prime Minister Boris Johnson of Britain is risking a rift with President Trump with a decision on Tuesday to <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/technology/britain-huawei-5G.html" title="">allow Huawei to be part of Britain’s new high-speed 5G wireless network</a> despite American concerns.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The move could jeopardize Mr. Johnson’s efforts to <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/world/europe/johnson-trump-hwawei-rift.html" title="">negotiate a new British-American trade deal</a> after Britain formally leaves the European Union on Friday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But Mr. Johnson’s show of independence played well with British commentators, and experts said he had calculated that the U.S. would not halt intelligence cooperation.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Background: </strong>Britain’s membership in the so-called Five Eyes intelligence-sharing group, with Australia, New Zealand, Canada and the U.S., gives Mr. Johnson’s decision added significance. And it comes as Germany is also <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/16/world/europe/huawei-germany-china-5g-automakers.html" title="">deciding whether to work with Huawei</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Details: </strong>British officials said intense American arguments that the Chinese telecommunications giant could be used by Beijing were not persuasive, given Britain’s plan to limit the use of Huawei’s gear to what the officials characterize as “fringe” parts of the national 5G network.</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-4f4342b7">If you have 15 minutes, this is worth it</h3>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-603f8999">A giant tax heist</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">From 2006 to 2011, “cum-ex trading,” a monetary maneuver to avoid double taxation of investment profits, enabled hundreds of bankers, lawyers and investors to siphon about $60 billion from state coffers in Germany, France and other European countries.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Proponents of cum-ex say it is perfectly legal because no law explicitly says otherwise. But the authorities in Germany call it a form of theft, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/23/business/cum-ex.html" title="">and they’re trying to claw back the money</a>.</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-554e6082">Here’s what else is happening</h3>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Impeachment trial: </strong>A question period for senators begins today, a day after President Trump’s legal team <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/us/politics/trumps-defense-team-discounts-bolton-as-republicans-work-to-hold-off-witnesses.html" title="">finished its oral arguments</a>. A vote on whether to hear witnesses in the trial — including <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/us/politics/bolton-trump.html" title="">John Bolton, the former national security adviser</a> — is expected on Friday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Kenya:</strong> The country’s high court is expected to rule Thursday on <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/world/africa/kenya-biometric-id.html" title="">whether a new biometric ID system is constitutional</a>. Civil rights groups say the system, through which nearly 40 million Kenyans have already had their fingerprints and faces scanned, discriminates against minority groups.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">King Albert II: </strong>A lawyer for the former Belgian monarch said on Tuesday that the Court of Appeal in Brussels would again hear a case in which <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/world/europe/belgium-king-albert-delphine-boel.html" title="">the artist Delphine Boël has sought recognition as his biological daughter</a>. King Albert’s lawyers said on Monday that DNA tests showed he was Ms. Boël’s biological father.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Kobe Bryant: </strong>A 2003 rape accusation against the basketball star — filed years before the #MeToo movement — ultimately <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/sports/basketball/kobe-bryant-rape-case.html" title="">did not change the trajectory of his career</a>. Here’s the latest on <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/sports/basketball/kobe-bryant-death.html" title="">the helicopter crash that killed Bryant</a> and eight others on Sunday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Snapshot: </strong>Above, skateboarding in Japan. The country’s skateboarders are top-notch, and a strong showing at the Olympics this summer in Tokyo <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/sports/olympics/skateboarding-olympics-tokyo.html" title="">could bring the sport out of the shadows of Japanese society</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">What we’re looking at: </strong><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.theatlantic.com/photo/2020/01/photos-worst-locust-swarms-decades-hit-east-africa/605653/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">These photos in The Atlantic</a> of the locust swarms in East Africa. “For those keeping track of the plagues hitting the planet,” writes Andrea Kannapell, the Briefings editor.</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-7ded7ef4">Now, a break from the news</h3>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Cook: </strong><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://cooking.nytimes.com/recipes/1020774-creamy-farro-with-crispy-mushrooms-and-sour-cream" title="">Farro with crispy mushrooms and sour cream</a> is similar in texture to a risotto, without the constant stirring.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Read: </strong>Our former Cairo bureau chief calls “<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/books/review/black-wave-saudi-arabia-iran-rivalry-kim-ghattas.html" title="">Black Wave</a>,” a new book about chaos in the Middle East by Kim Ghattas, a Lebanese-born journalist and scholar, a “sweeping and authoritative history.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Go: </strong><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/travel/momcations-its-a-thing.html" title="">Momcations</a>, a getaway designed for tired mothers, are on the rise. While some see it as profiteering, others say it’s a sign of “the mainstream telling moms they deserve a break.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Smarter Living: </strong>Breaking up with a therapist can be nerve-racking. But doing it <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/magazine/how-to-break-up-with-your-therapist.html" title="">with these tips in mind</a> can turn it into an opportunity for growth.</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-15767e9b">And now for the Back Story on …</h3>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-43d3324a">Reporting in Wuhan</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">Chris Buckley, our chief China correspondent, is reporting this week from the city of Wuhan, the epicenter of the coronavirus outbreak. Mike spoke with Chris by phone.</em></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">What is it like with these unprecedented restrictions in place?</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">It may be difficult to envisage just how thoroughly people have retreated from the streets and from public life. I had to cross one of the big bridges across the Yangtze for my reporting. And there I was, on one of these Chinese share bikes that are everywhere, on an almost completely empty bridge, spanning one of China’s biggest cities, crossing its biggest river. And there were just two other people on the bridge.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A lot of people wonder how long the shutdown can last. Even now people are worrying about the jobs they may lose, the businesses that will close, the school semesters that they might miss.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">You’ve reported that </strong><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/world/asia/china-coronavirus-social-media.html" title="">the anger on Chinese social media</a></strong><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"> is intense.</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Yes, and you hear that here as well. People erupt with a kind of anger and exasperation over how it was that this dangerous pathogen was among them but they didn’t understand, in many cases, how serious it was or what was going on until the city was shut down.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But that’s leavened by a sense among many people that the most pressing thing is to <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://twitter.com/ChuBailiang/status/1222050019835969536" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">get through this crisis </a>— so that as few people die as possible and life can return to a kind of normality as soon as possible.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">What else are you seeing there?</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">You see a combination of reactions when you approach people to talk. First of all, there’s a natural wariness about getting close to anybody. But once you reassure them — you’re outside, at a distance of a good 10 feet — they can be very open and also very generous.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">How does that compare to the response you normally get?</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The reaction you get as a foreign reporter varies quite a bit across China. But I think these circumstances, where people feel that they — and, in a sense, we — are all in this together, and that you’re there somehow experiencing this as well, make it easier to create that connection.</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">That’s it for this briefing. See you next time.</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">— Mike and Sarah</p>, <p class="css-jwz2nf etfikam0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Thank you</strong><br/>To Mark Josephson and Eleanor Stanford for the break from the news. You can reach the team at <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="mailto:briefing+midnight@nytimes.com?subject=Briefing%20Feedback" title="">briefing@nytimes.com</a>.</p>, <p class="css-jwz2nf etfikam0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">P.S.</strong><br/>• We’re listening to “<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/thedaily" title="">The Daily</a>.” Our latest episode is about the ripple effects of John Bolton’s coming book.<br/>• Here’s today’s <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/crosswords/game/mini" title="">Mini Crossword puzzle</a>, and a clue: It leaves in the spring (four letters). <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/crosswords" title="">You can find all our puzzles here</a>.<br/>• Jason Polan, a New York sketch artist, produced hundreds of illustrations for the print edition of The Times. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/27/arts/jason-polan-dead.html" title="">He died on Monday at age 37</a>.</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-35846658" itemprop="headline"><span>German Minister: Too Early to Gauge Impact of Coronavirus on Economy</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BERLIN — More time and data are needed to quantify any possible negative effects of the coronavirus that broke out in China on the German economy, Economy Minister Peter Altmaier said on Wednesday. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China, which is struggling to contain the epidemic, is Germany's most important trading partner. Four coronavirus cases have been confirmed in southern Germany.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Michael Nienaber; Editing by Joseph Nasr)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-1b8652c6" itemprop="headline"><span>Osaka Resident Tests Positive for Coronavirus: Japan's NHK</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">TOKYO — A woman working as a tour-bus guide in Japan has tested positive for the coronavirus, public broadcaster NHK cited Osaka's prefectural government as saying on Wednesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The woman, a resident of Osaka city, worked on the same bus as the driver who was confirmed with the virus on Tuesday, NHK said. The bus had been carrying tourists from Wuhan, the epicenter of the epidemic, and the driver was the first reported case of a possible transmission inside Japan.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Chang-Ran Kim; Editing by Toby Chopra)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-7587c255" itemprop="headline"><span>X-Games Latest Event Affected by Coronavirus Outbreak</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Reuters) - An X-Games event scheduled for next month in Chongli in China's northern Hebei province has been postponed due to the outbreak of a new coronavirus, organizers have said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The event, the first winter X-Games to be held in China, was to take place from Feb. 21-23 in the same area as the alpine events for the 2022 Winter Olympics, which are officially being hosted by Beijing.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The outbreak has killed 132 people with almost 6,000 others affected by the flu-like virus that emerged late last year in Wuhan in the central Hubei province.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Due to the ongoing coronavirus concerns, the X Games Chongli 2020 event will be postponed until a later date," organizers said in a statement. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"The safety of our athletes, staff and spectators is our top priority, and we will continue to closely monitor the situation."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A new date has not been set for the competition.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The virus has spread to more than a dozen countries while China's government has locked down most of Hubei province.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Airlines from around the world are restricting their flights into China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Sports officials have already moved a women's Olympic soccer qualifying tournament from China to Australia, while a tennis regional Fed Cup tie in Dongguan has been switched to Kazakhstan.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">An Olympic boxing qualifying tournament has also been moved from Wuhan to Jordan and an Olympic women's basketball qualifying competition due to be held in Foshan has been transferred to Serbia. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Greg Stutchbury; Editing by Peter Rutherford)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 [<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-54f6505b" itemprop="headline"><span>Four Chinese Citizens With Coronavirus in UAE Are Tourists: Official</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">DUBAI — The four members of a Chinese family who have been diagnosed in the United Arab Emirates with the new coronavirus were tourists who arrived from the Chinese city of Wuhan on Jan. 16, UAE health ministry official Hussein al-Rand told Reuters.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Rand declined to say which of the UAE's seven emirates the family were being treated in, had visited, or which airport they arrived in. He said the government had traced those who had come into contact with the family in the UAE, with all testing negative for the virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Writing by Lisa Barrington)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-71b4d9ae" itemprop="headline"><span>Factbox: Airlines Suspend Some Flights to China Over Coronavirus</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Reuters) - Major airlines have suspended some flights to China because of the coronavirus outbreak which has killed more than 130 people in China and spread across the world. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Here are the airlines that have suspended flights:</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">LUFTHANSA</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Germany's Lufthansa said in a statement it is suspending its own, Swiss and Austrian Airlines flights to and from China until Feb. 9. The airline continues to fly to Hong Kong, but it will stop taking bookings for flights to mainland China until the end of next month.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">AIR TANZANIA</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Tanzania's state-owned carrier said it will have to postpone its maiden flights to China due to concerns over the spread of a coronavirus. Air Tanzania had planned to begin charter flights to China next month.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">AMERICAN AIRLINES</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The largest U.S. carrier said it will in the period from Feb. 9 through March 27 suspend flights from Los Angeles to Beijing and Shanghai, citing sagging demand in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BRITISH AIRWAYS </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The British airline said on Jan. 29 it had suspended all direct flights to and from mainland China after Britain warned against all but essential travel to the country.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BA.com, the airline's website, showed no direct flights to China were available to book in January and February. The airline said in an email the cancellations were in effect until Jan. 31 while it assesses the situation. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">FINNAIR</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Finnish airline Finnair said on Jan. 28 it would suspend its flights to Nanjing and Beijing until the end of March after China suspended international group travel from the country.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Finnair will suspend its three weekly flights between Helsinki and Beijing Daxing between Feb. 5 and March 29 and its two weekly flights between Helsinki and Nanjing between Feb. 8 and March 29.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">UNITED</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Chicago-based United said it was suspending 24 U.S. flights to Beijing, Hong Kong and Shanghai between Feb. 1 and Feb. 8 because of a significant drop in demand.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">AIR CANADA</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Air Canada said on Jan. 28 it was cancelling select flights to China to better match capacity with expected demand.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">CATHAY PACIFIC AIRWAYS </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Hong Kong's Cathay Pacific said it would be progressively reducing capacity to and from mainland China by 50% or more from Jan. 30 to the end of March, in line with a government directive as well as market demand.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">LION AIR</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Indonesian airline Lion Air Group said on Jan. 29 it would suspend all flights to China from February. The airline has suspended six flights from several Indonesian cities to China so far and will suspend the rest next month.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">AIR SEOUL </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">South Korean budget carrier Air Seoul said on Jan. 28 it had suspended all flights to China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">AIR INDIA</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Air India said it was cancelling its Mumbai-Delhi-Shanghai flight from Jan. 31 to Feb. 14.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Jagoda Darlak and Tommy Lund in Gdansk; editing by Larry King and David Evans)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-2eb8ad24" itemprop="headline"><span>Air Canada Cancelling Select Flights to China in Response to Coronavirus</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">MONTREAL — Air Canada said on Tuesday it is cancelling select flights to China to better match capacity with expected demand as the spread of the new coronavirus rattles travelers.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Air Canada currently operates 33 flights a week to China and the resulting capacity reduction is relatively small, a company spokesman said by email. Those customers who are affected will be notified and provided with alternate travel options.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The coronavirus that originated in Wuhan, China has killed 106 people and spread across the world.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting By Allison Lampert; Editing by Chris Reese)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]

Two U.S. officials said the administration had not taken any options off the table, including a temporary ban on flights, if public health data supported the move.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">On Monday, Republican Senator Tom Cotton urged the administration to immediately halt commercial flights from China to the United States.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Mekhla Raina in Bengaluru, David Shepardson in Washington and Tracy Rucinski in Chicago; Editing by Chris Reese)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]

[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-20f68b37" itemprop="headline"><span>Australia Gold Project Sale Delayed as Buyer Quarantined Over Coronavirus</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Reuters) - The sale of a small gold project in Australia has been delayed after a member of the Hong Kong-based buyer's family showed symptoms of coronavirus, leading to the whole family being quarantined, the vendor said on Wednesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Australia's Ausmex Mining Group said it had agreed to extend the settlement for the A$4 million ($2.7 million) sale of its Gilded Rose Gold project in Queensland to Jin Resources (HK) Ltd.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"The Principal of Jin, along with members of his family, fell ill around mid-January and have been quarantined and isolated after one of their infants showed symptoms of the coronavirus," the gold miner said in a statement.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Jin had advised that settlement was imminent, it added.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Reuters was not able to contact Jin Resources.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The death toll from the coronavirus outbreak in China rose to 132 on Wednesday, leading some airlines to reduce flights to China and global companies to restrict travel, while many stores and offices in affected areas have closed.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Australia has reported five cases of coronavirus. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Nikhil Kurian Nainan in Bengaluru; editing by Richard Pullin)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-7d5b7454" itemprop="headline"><span>Novartis Predicts Rising Sales and Minimal Disruption From Coronavirus</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BASEL, Switzerland — Novartis boss Vas Narasimhan expects higher sales and profitability this year, lifted by its broad range of drugs, and minimal disruption to its supply chain from the coronavirus outbreak in China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Swiss drugmaker's upbeat outlook and quarterly results on Wednesday outshone the previous day's results from Pfizer and set the bar for rival Roche, which is expected to report higher 2019 sales and profit on Thursday. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Novartis shares were up 1.5% at 1337 GMT after the company said it would raise its dividend 4% to 2.95 Swiss francs per share and as Narasimhan downplayed the threat of coronavirus disruptions.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China is one of Novartis's fastest-growing markets and has research and development operations there but also obtains supplies of active pharmaceutical ingredients from Chinese suppliers. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">After the coronavirus outbreak, Novartis asked Chinese staff to work from home until Feb. 10 while suspending some business travel, but Narasimhan said he expects the company to emerge unscathed thanks to sufficient supplies to ride out interruptions.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The head of generics unit Sandoz, Richard Saynor, said the company has evaluated its stocks of ingredients and concluded that it has an adequate buffer for now. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China accounts for more than $2 billion in annual business for Novartis and last year produced double-digit growth including the launches of Cosentyx and Entresto, a drug Narasimhan predicts could top $1 billion in sales in China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Novartis's broad drugs portfolio, including treatments for cancer, arthritis and rare diseases, helped the company post fourth-quarter core net income of $2.99 billion, up 13% in constant currencies, on revenue up 9% at $12.4 billion.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The group is benefiting from a mix of products developed in-house, such as psoriasis medicine Cosentyx and heart failure remedy Entresto, as well as $2.1 million-per-patient gene therapy Zolgensma, acquired through a 2018 acquisition.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"A company of our size, with now approaching $50 billion of revenue ... has to have a diverse approach to therapeutic areas," CEO Narasimhan told a news conference in Basel. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We want to cover the unmet needs of humanity, so that ranges from cardiovascular disease and oncology, all the way to rare diseases."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">For 2020, Novartis expects net sales growth of up to high-single-digit percentages, with core operating income potentially rising even faster.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"The overall results, with the focus on the main drugs business and the strong outlook for 2020, is likely to be taken positively by investors," said Zuercher Kantonalbank analyst Michael Nawrath, who has an "overweight" rating on the stock.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Overall, Cosentyx's sales for the 12-month period rose 28% to $3.6 billion, Entresto was up 71% at $1.7 billion and Zolgensma hit $361 million after seven months on the market. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Additional reporting by John Revill; Editing by Mark Potter and David Goodman)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" [<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-39832f29" itemprop="headline"><span>Three More People in Germany Infected With Coronavirus-State Ministry</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BERLIN — Three more people in southern Germany have contracted the coronavirus and they are employees at the same company where a man became the first person in Germany to become infected with the virus, the Bavarian health ministry said on Tuesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The 33-year-old man apparently contracted the virus on Jan. 21 during a training session with a Chinese colleague, the ministry said. The three additional patients were being monitored in isolation at a clinic in Munich.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"A total of around 40 employees at the company have been identified as potential close contacts (with their Chinese colleague). As a precaution, the people concerned are to be tested on Wednesday," Bavaria's Health Minister Melanie Huml said in a statement.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Writing by Paul Carrel; Editing by Sandra Maler)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-6a1adb03" itemprop="headline"><span>Coronavirus Stokes Asian Discrimination Fears in Canada's Biggest City</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">TORONTO — Canada has identified only three cases of the new coronavirus so far, but there are fears a more serious outbreak could stoke anti-Asian sentiment in scenes reminiscent of the SARS epidemic that killed dozens in the Toronto area in the early 2000s. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">More than 9,000 people signed a petition urging one of the area's school boards to keep children whose family members recently returned from China out of classrooms, and some businesses in Toronto's Chinatown are already recording a slowdown.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">SARS, or Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome, killed 44 people in the Toronto area, causing widespread fear and making Canada the only country outside Asia to report deaths from that virus in 2002-2003. So far the new coronavirus has killed more than 100 people in China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"This is exactly what happened during SARS," Amy Go, interim national president of the Chinese Canadian National Council for Social Justice, told Reuters in reference to the school board petition.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We really, really have to check that we are not being overwhelmed by irrational fear and irrational panic," she said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The York Region School Board responded to the petition by saying it understood "that students and their families are feeling some anxiety," but cautioned that anyone can contract and transmit the virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The situation "can regrettably give rise to discrimination based on perceptions, stereotypes and hate," the board said. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Health Minister Patty Hajdu on Tuesday said there was a risk Chinese Canadians could feel "somewhat targeted" because of the origin of the virus, and that it could hurt their businesses if people shun them out of fear.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But the Asian community is also among the most concerned about the virus, said Polly Chow, a Chinese-Canadian mother from Toronto.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">She said she agreed with the board petition, and with her son's private school "emergency order" that children be self-quarantined for 15 days if their families had travelled where there were confirmed cases.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Chow described an atmosphere of fear and protectiveness among parents, and said many students in her son's class did not attend school on Monday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"All the kids who didn't attend were all the Asian kids," she told Reuters. "When you're Asian, you get exposed to news through the Asian media. You see more graphically what's happening in China, so that increases the fear."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The South Asian and Chinese communities are the two largest visible minorities in Canada, and some 1.8 million people, or just under 5% of the country's total population, are of Chinese descent.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">On Tuesday, authorities in British Columbia reported Canada's third case of the novel coronavirus in Vancouver. The first two to contract the virus in Canada - a husband and wife - live in Toronto. All three recently returned from Wuhan, the epicentre of the outbreak. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Tonny Louie, chair of Toronto Chinatown Business Improvement Area, said business activity had already slowed due to concern over the virus, and scenes like the one Tuesday at Toronto's Chongqing Liuyishou Hot Pot, where all the employees wore surgical masks meant to protect them from contagion, do not help. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"The numbers are down," Louie said. "There's not that many people in the street."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Denise Paglinawan and Moira Warburton in Toronto; additional reporting by Kelsey Johnson in Ottawa and Tessa Vikander in Vancouver; Writing by Steve Scherer; Editing by Tom Brown)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]

China is Germany's most important trading partner.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Germany's economy minister raised the economic growth outlook for the country but cut expectations for 2021.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">British shares closed flat as a slip in oil prices weighed on oil majors.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">LVMH, Louis Vuitton owner, was one of the biggest drags on the STOXX 600 as slowing sales growth in the fourth quarter dented shares. Luxury stocks, which derive a chunk of their demand from China, had attempted a recovery on Tuesday. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Investor attention now turns to central bank meetings from around the world. The U.S. Federal Reserve is almost certain to keep interest rates on hold at the end of a two-day policy meeting later in the day, while expectations of a rate cut by the Bank of England on Thursday stand at 50%.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Friday will mark the UK's official departure from the European Union. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Susan Mathew and Medha Singh in Bengaluru; Editing by Bernard Orr and Matthew Lewis)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]

The measures will run until at least Feb. 29.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Other international airlines including Lufthansa and British Airways announced earlier Wednesday that they were temporarily scrapping all flights to China. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Anthony Deutsch; Editing by Bernadette Baum)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-1aa686a1" itemprop="headline"><span>China's Sichuan Province Reports First Death From Coronavirus-State Media</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BEIJING — China's Sichuan province reported its first death from coronavirus, state media reported on Wednesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">As of 8 a.m. (0000 GMT) Wednesday, the southwestern province had reported 108 confirmed cases. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Beijing newsroom; Writing by Chen Aizhu; Editing by Alison Williams)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-2a250d81" itemprop="headline"><span>Apple's iPhone Back to Growth as Company Braces for Coronavirus Impact</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Reuters) - The iPhone is back. But Apple is girding for more disruptions in virus-hit China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Apple Inc on Tuesday reported sales and profits for the holiday shopping quarter above Wall Street expectations, thanks to rising iPhone sales for the first time in a year and soaring demand for add-ons like AirPods wireless headphones.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The performance outweighed concerns about the coronavirus outbreak in China, a major market and manufacturing hub for Apple, and a slight revenue miss in the company's services business, which includes the new Apple TV+ streaming offering.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Shares of Apple rose 2% in after-hours trade.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Apple forecasted revenue for the quarter ending in March above Wall Street expectations.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Chief Executive Tim Cook told Reuters the company used a wider-than-normal prediction range because of the uncertainty created by the coronavirus. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We have limited travel to business-critical situations as of last week," he said. "The situation is emerging, and we’re still gathering lots of data points and monitoring it very closely."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Apple has suppliers in the Wuhan area, the heart of the outbreak, but has alternatives, Cook said. Factories outside Wuhan area will not reopen after the Lunar New Year holiday until Feb. 10, Cook said, but Apple built the delayed restart into its wider revenue forecast.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Apple has shut one store in China, he said, and reduced hours at others because of lower foot traffic, Cook said. Third-party stores that sell Apple products are also facing some closures, Cook said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Apple is "forecasting a stronger Q2 than analysts predicted, but the fact that the coronavirus is spreading in unpredictable ways in China, where Apple has most of its hardware built, could upset this optimistic forecast," said eMarketer principal analyst Yoram Wurmser.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">SERVICES MISS BUT GROWING</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The number of active iPhones, computers and other devices owned by customers, called Apple's installed base, grew by 100 million to more than 1.5 billion over the past year. Apple executives set a new target of 600 million paid subscribers for music, TV, gaming and other services by the end of calendar 2020. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Apple’s share price has more than doubled since Cook warned a year ago that the company was likely to miss financial targets for its biggest sales quarter of its fiscal 2019. In the year since, Apple slashed prices in China, one of its most important markets, to rekindle sales there.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Apple posted $91.8 billion (69.8 billion pounds) in revenue for the quarter ended Dec. 28, compared with analyst estimates of $88.5 billion, according to IBES data from Refinitiv. Apple reported earnings per share of $4.99, compared with analyst estimates of $4.55 per share. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The company forecast $63.0 billion to $67.0 billion in revenue for the quarter ending in March, ahead of estimates of $62.4 billion, showing it believes that its phones and other devices such as AirPods wireless headphones will continue to sell well during what is often a slow time of year. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Apple has made a push into paid services, rolling out a credit card with Goldman Sachs and subscription gaming and television services last year. Services revenue was $12.7 billion, below analyst estimates of $13 billion, and up from $10.9 billion the year before.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Services are important, but the trajectory is heading on target. I feel they’ve made good progress on that front," said Hal Eddins, chief economist for Apple shareholder Capital Investment Counsel. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The shift towards services, however, depends on Apple continuing to grow its base of users and sign them up for recurring subscriptions that analysts view as potentially more lucrative than hardware sales. Apple said it now has more than 1.5 billion active installed devices and 480 million subscribers to both its own and third-party paid services, compared with 1.4 billion devices and 360 million subscribers a year earlier.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Cook said the company's Apple TV+ subscription streaming video service released last fall was a "rousing success" and that it is "very strong, both the people that are getting it in the bundle and the people that are paying for it that haven't bought a new device." </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">IPhone sales of $55.96 billion beat analyst estimates of $51.6 billion and year-before sales of $52 billion, snapping a yearlong trend of major sales declines for Apple’s biggest-selling hardware product. Cook said that the iPhone 11 and iPhone 11 Pro models drove the growth and also factored into the company's forecast, calling the devices "the strongest iPhone lineup we've ever had."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But Apple’s wearables segment – which, along with AirPods, also includes the Apple Watch – hit $10.0 billion in revenue versus estimates of $9.5 billion, up sharply from $7.3 billion the year before. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Cook told Reuters that Apple could not make enough AirPods and Apple Watch Series 3 devices to meet demand during the fiscal first quarter and continues to be short on both. Cook said Apple does not have an estimate for when it will be able to fulfil demand for AirPods.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We're working on both of those very hard," Cook told Reuters.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">GRAPHIC: Apple's valuation, https://fingfx.thomsonreuters.com/gfx/breakingviews/1/1305/1864/APPFWDVAL.jpg</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Stephen Nellis in San Francisco; additional reporting by Munsif Vengattil in Bengaluru; Editing by Peter Henderson and Lisa Shumaker)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-33967934" itemprop="headline"><span>Coronavirus Outbreak Forces AFC to Swap Home Games of Chinese Clubs</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Reuters) - The Asian Football Confederation (AFC) has changed the order of home matches to be played by Chinese clubs in the AFC Champions League group stage due to the outbreak of a new coronavirus in the country, Asian soccer's governing body said on Wednesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The move follows consultation with the Chinese Football Association (CFA) and means that home games of the four Chinese clubs on the first three match days will be rescheduled and played away by swapping the order with their opponents.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"The decision, which was also made in conjunction with the competing clubs from the respective groups, is a precautionary measure to ensure the safety and well-being of all participating players and teams," the AFC said in a statement.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The outbreak has killed over 130 people with almost 6,000 others affected by the flu-like virus that emerged late last year in Wuhan in the central Hubei province.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">According to the revised schedule, Beijing Guoan will open their campaign at FC Seoul on Feb. 11 and visit Melbourne Victory on March 3.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Shanghai SIPG's second group match will be at South Korea's Jeonbuk Motors on Feb. 19 and they face Yokohama F Marinos away after that, while Shanghai Shenhua will travel to Ulsan Hyundai for their second match on Feb. 18.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Chinese Super League champions Guangzhou Evergrande will travel to Suwon Bluewings on Feb. 12.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The AFC added it will monitor the situation before deciding further on the home matches of Chinese clubs on the next three match days.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Shanghai SIPG entered the group stage by winning a playoff match against Thai side Buriram United, a match played behind closed doors on Tuesday to reduce chances of infection.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Shrivathsa Sridhar in Bengaluru; Editing by Christopher Cushing)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2
