It could include recommendations on trade and travel, although the WHO generally tries to avoid disruptive trade restrictions.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Emergency Committee deliberations are secret and its members have been told not to speak about their debate, several WHO officials told Reuters.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus and Chinese President Xi Jinping met in Beijing on Tuesday to discuss how to protect Chinese citizens and foreigners in areas affected by the virus and "possible" evacuation alternatives, Lindmeier said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China has agreed that the WHO can send international experts there as soon as possible to increase understanding of the new coronavirus and guide the global response to the outbreak, the WHO said at the end of Tedros' two-day visit.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Some experts believe the Geneva-based health agency is in a difficult position, having drawn fire in the past for acting either too quickly or too slowly.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Essentially the WHO is between a rock and a hard place," said Jeremy Farrar, an expert in infectious disease epidemics and director of the Wellcome Trust global health charity.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Farrar noted that the organisation was criticised for having called an early emergency in 2009 for the H1N1 flu pandemic, which proved mild, and then for being too late in declaring the Ebola epidemic in West Africa in 2014.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Writing by Stephanie Nebehay; editing by Mike Collett-White)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-6ab6baaa" itemprop="headline"><span>WHO Weighs Science and Politics in Global Virus Emergency Decision</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">GENEVA/LONDON — Most of the World Health Organization's (WHO) criteria for declaring a global emergency have been met, but it is awaiting clear evidence of a sustained spread of the new coronavirus outside China before doing so, some experts and diplomats said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The U.N. agency is seeking to balance the need to ensure China continues to share information about the virus while also giving sound scientific advice to the international community on the risks, according to several public health experts and a Western diplomat who tracks the WHO's work.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The WHO has declared five global emergencies in the past decade, including the ongoing Ebola epidemic in the Democratic Republic of Congo.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Doing so can hurt host countries because it may lead to flight cancellations and travel or trade restrictions, dragging on the economy.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In the latest case, the WHO declined to declare China's coronavirus a public health emergency of international concern (PHEIC) twice last week, although its Emergency Committee was split "50-50" over whether to do so.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"What was lacking for them to declare an international emergency were deaths abroad and human-to-human transmission outside of China," said the Geneva-based diplomat following the agency.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"If there was proof of human-to-human spread among the 'imported' cases, the panel would lean towards another finding."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">WHO spokesman Christian Lindmeier declined to comment beyond what he told a news briefing earlier on Tuesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">He restated that the WHO's criteria for a global emergency include a "serious or unusual" health situation that affects other countries and may require a coordinated international response.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In reply to a question, he added: "It is not 'wildly spreading' outside of China."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">While the vast majority of the 4,500 or so confirmed cases and all 106 deaths so far have been in China, cases in Germany, Vietnam, Taiwan and Japan where the virus has spread person-to-person have heightened concerns.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"As information is coming in, it seems to be confirming our worst fears," Lawrence Gostin, university professor at Georgetown Law in Washington, DC, told Reuters.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"So I do believe that the WHO is going to have to declare an emergency and is going to have to take the lead ... You can't leave this to China."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">'A ROCK AND HARD PLACE'</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The WHO's 16-member expert panel is being "kept in the loop" and could be reconvened at any time to reassess the outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Just because of rising numbers in China now this would not automatically trigger an Emergency Committee," Lindmeier told the briefing.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A declaration would lead to boosting public health measures, funding and resources to prevent and reduce global spread. It could include recommendations on trade and travel, although the WHO generally tries to avoid disruptive trade restrictions.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Emergency Committee deliberations are secret and its members have been told not to speak about their debate, several WHO officials told Reuters.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus and Chinese President Xi Jinping met in Beijing on Tuesday to discuss how to protect Chinese citizens and foreigners in areas affected by the virus and "possible" evacuation alternatives, Lindmeier said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China has agreed that the WHO can send international experts there as soon as possible to increase understanding of the new coronavirus and guide the global response to the outbreak, the WHO said at the end of Tedros' two-day visit.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Some experts believe the Geneva-based health agency is in a difficult position, having drawn fire in the past for acting either too quickly or too slowly.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Essentially the WHO is between a rock and a hard place," said Jeremy Farrar, an expert in infectious disease epidemics and director of the Wellcome Trust global health charity.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Farrar noted that the organisation was criticised for having called an early emergency in 2009 for the H1N1 flu pandemic, which proved mild, and then for being too late in declaring the Ebola epidemic in West Africa in 2014.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Writing by Stephanie Nebehay; editing by Mike Collett-White)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-3b2d583b" itemprop="headline"><span>What's New in the China Virus Outbreak</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">The Associated Press</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">About 7,700 cases of a new viral respiratory illness have been confirmed since an outbreak began in the Chinese city of Wuhan. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Scientists have identified the illness as a new kind of coronavirus. Coronaviruses are a large family of viruses, some of which cause the common cold. Others have evolved into more severe illnesses, such as SARS and MERS, although so far the new virus does not appear to be as deadly or contagious. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Symptoms of the new virus include fever, cough and shortness of breath.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">WHAT'S NEW:</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">— The virus has killed 170 people, and the virus has now infected more people in China than were sickened there during the 2002-2003 SARS outbreak. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">— World health officials expressed worry that the virus is starting to spread between people outside of China. Meanwhile, scientists said there is evidence that the virus has spread person-to-person among close contacts since mid-December. They estimate that each infection led to 2.2 others on average, suggesting considerable effort may be needed to control its spread. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">— Several countries moved to bring residents home from China. About 200 Americans flown out of Wuhan on a plane chartered by the U.S. government were undergoing three days of monitoring at a Southern California military base. In Tokyo, the second group of Japanese evacuees arrived aboard a government-chartered flight. The European Union was working to bring back 600 citizens from 14 countries.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">— Sporting events in China were postponed and Olympic qualifying tournaments were moved elsewhere. The country's women's soccer team was quarantined in Australia ahead of an Olympic qualifying tournament. None of the players has shown symptoms.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">— Airlines around the world suspended or significantly cut back service to China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">— A family of four Chinese tourists in the United Arab Emirates became the Mideast’s first cases of the virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">— The outbreak kept many indoors and at home in China’s capital during what is usually one of the busiest periods for tourism. Beijing cultural landmarks such as the Great Wall and Forbidden City closed to visitors, while shopping malls, restaurants and subway stations were nearly empty. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">— Villages on the outskirts of Beijing closed themselves off to outsiders, with residents blocking roads with piles of earth and standing guard to prevent outsiders and their vehicles from entering. </p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-5aca8bd7" itemprop="headline"><span>China's Jan Factory Activity Seen Stalling as Virus Adds to Risks-Reuters Poll</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">SINGAPORE — Growth in China's sprawling manufacturing sector likely stalled in January after two months of modest gains, with an outbreak of a new virus adding to risks facing the already struggling economy, a Reuters poll showed.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">More than 130 people have died from the virus in China in the last few weeks and nearly 6,000 have been infected, prompting widespread transport curbs and tough public health measures that are weighing heavily on the travel, tourism and retail sectors.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The official Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) for January is expected to fall to a neutral 50.0 from 50.2 in December. The 50-mark separates expansion from contraction on a monthly basis, according to the median forecasts of 29 economists. The data is expected to be released on Friday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China will also release a similar survey on activity in the non-manufacturing sector, which may give a better reading of the initial economic damage. Shops, restaurants and movie theatres are expected to see a slump in sales as people avoid crowded areas.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The timing of the long Lunar New Year holiday, which began on Jan. 25 this year, had already been expected to dampen factory activity to some extent after a stronger-than-expected showing in December.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Many businesses cut back operations or shut completely for a week or more to allow millions of workers to return home for celebrations, and authorities have extended the break by several days this year in a bid to contain the virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Health officials say it is too early to know just how dangerous the coronavirus is and how easily it spreads, but some analysts say the blow to the economy could be similar to that seen during an outbreak of Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) in 2002-03.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Even if the coronavirus outbreak is brought under control quicker than SARS was in 2003, the economic impact now looks likely to be of at least a similar scale," Capital Economics said in a note to clients this week.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We estimate that SARS lowered China's growth by three percentage points in the worst-affected quarter, though the economy soon bounced back."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Much of the "lost" spending during SARS was recouped by early 2004, workplaces generally stayed open and industrial activity was not affected, the consultancy noted.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China's economic growth is already near 30-year lows. It softened to 6.0% last year from 6.7% in 2018 under pressure from weak domestic demand and the escalating Sino-U.S. trade war. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But there were signs late last year that businesses were getting back on more solid footing, as the economy slowly responded to a series of stimulus measures.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Writing by Kim Coghill; Editing by Sam Holmes)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-3195bfa1" itemprop="headline"><span>Chinese Students Return to Virus Quarantine in Singapore</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">SINGAPORE — Students in Singapore have been hurriedly clearing out dormitory rooms to be used as quarantine facilities for their peers as the city-state ramps up precautionary measures against the fast-spreading coronavirus. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The city-state said this week it is contacting some 2,000 people with recent travel history to China's Hubei province - the center of an outbreak that has claimed over 130 lives - and will isolate some at home or other facilities like campuses, military barracks or outdoor centers. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The travel and tourism hub was one of the worst hit countries outside China during a similar outbreak of the Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) virus in 2003 and has reported seven coronavirus cases to date. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Gao, a first-year student at Nanyang Technological University from China, said she was quarantined on Tuesday almost immediately on her return from Hubei province.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"I actually went to my lab session...but was chased out of class as they said that I need to be isolated. I think the quarantine period will be a little boring," Gao said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Gao said she had concerns about missing class but said the quarantine would protect her friends. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Mainland Chinese are one of the largest groups of international students in Singapore, according to a U.N. report, attracted by the city-state's top-ranked universities, cultural similarities and widely-spoken Mandarin.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">When Reuters visited Gao's university on Tuesday, a stream of Chinese students returning after Lunar New Year holidays wheeling suitcases and carrying bags were being ushered by private security officers wearing surgical masks into the 400-room block being used as a quarantine zone.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Other students could be seen carrying boxes as they cleared out rooms.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Singapore said it is clearing out areas at two other universities, while local press have reported military facilities and an outdoor center are also being set aside.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">People who do not comply with quarantine orders could be fined up to S$10,000 or jailed for up to 6 months or both, authorities have said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The education ministry and NTU did not immediately comment on the number of students quarantined.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Jenny Liu, a 22-year-old student from China, said she received an email on Monday by the university telling her to clear out her stuff.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"They gave us boxes to pack our things, and campus also called some movers to help us move to our new room," Liu said. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"All in just one day, it was such a short time."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Additional reporting by John Geddie and Aradhana Aravindan; Editing by Michael Perry)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-5e8d0e65" itemprop="headline"><span>The Latest: Rival Koreas Close Liaison Office Over Outbreak</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">The Associated Press</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BEIJING — The Latest on the outbreak of a new virus from China:</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">10 a.m.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The rival Koreas have agreed to suspend operations at their liaison office in North Korea until the new virus outbreak comes under control.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">South Korea’s Unification Ministry said Thursday it plans to bring back 58 South Korean officials and workers from the office in the North Korean border town of Kaesong as soon as possible.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The ministry says the Koreas have agreed to establish new telephone and fax lines between Seoul and Pyongyang to perform liaison duties.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">South Korea has reported four cases of the illness. North Korea hasn’t officially reported a case, but its state media have called for intensive national efforts to prevent the virus from spreading to the country.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">___</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">8:35 a.m. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The death toll has risen to 170 in the new virus outbreak in China, with 7,711 cases reported within the country. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Thursday’s figures cover the previous 24 hours and represent an increase of 38 deaths and 1,737 cases. Of the new deaths, 37 were in the epicenter of the outbreak in Hubei province and one in the southwestern province of Sichuan. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The news comes as the 195 Americans evacuated from Wuhan, the Hubei province city of 11 million where the outbreak originated, are undergoing three days of testing and monitoring at a Southern California military base to make sure they do not show signs of the virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">World health officials expressed “great concern” Wednesday that the virus is starting to spread between people outside of China. The new virus has now infected more people in China than were sickened there during the 2002-2003 SARS outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> ___</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">12:10 a.m. Thursday</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A plane evacuating 201 Americans from the Chinese city at the center of the virus outbreak has arrived in California. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The jet landed Wednesday morning at March Air Reserve Base east of Los Angeles after all passengers passed health screenings during a refueling stop in Anchorage, Alaska. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The passengers will undergo additional screenings in California and be placed in temporary housing. Officials have not said how long they will stay there.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">___</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">11:45 p.m.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">An 80-year-old Chinese tourist is on artificial respiration in a Paris hospital with a new virus that is rapidly spreading, after two French hospitals initially declined to test him for the sickness.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">France has four confirmed cases of the deadly coronavirus, including two people in intensive care, and is seeking to repatriate hundreds of people from China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The 80-year-old arrived in France last Thursday and went to an emergency room in southern Paris on Saturday with a fever, said Dr. Yazdan Yazdanpanah, infectious diseases chief at Bichat Hospital.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The man had a fever but no signs of respiratory trouble, and is not from the Chinese city of Wuhan, the epicenter of the virus, but about 400 kilometers (240 miles) north of there, Yazdanpanah told reporters Wednesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Because he “didn’t fulfill the definition” of someone at risk of having the virus, two hospitals decided it was unnecessary to test him, Yazdanpanah said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“If we have to hospitalize all patients who have a fever and come from China, that’s dangerous for our hospital system in general,” he said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The tourist developed respiratory trouble on Wednesday, and tested positive for the virus. The hospitals held an emergency meeting to identify any personnel or patients who had been in touch with the man, who was put on artificial respiration and has a severe case of the virus, Yazdanpanah said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Bichat Hospital is leading French efforts to treat patients with the virus but hospital officials said it only has nine beds equipped for infected patients.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">___</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">11 p.m.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Germany’s Lufthansa and its subsidiaries Austrian Airlines and Swiss are suspending flights to mainland China through Feb. 9 as fears spread about a new virus that has killed more than 130 people.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Lufthansa said in a statement Wednesday that the airlines will fly one last time to their destinations in China, giving passengers a chance to catch their flights and bringing crews back to Germany, Switzerland and Austria.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The airlines will continue to fly to Hong Kong as scheduled.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">British Airways has also halted all flights to China and American Airlines has suspended flights to and from Shanghai and Beijing. They joined several Asian carriers that are either suspending or significantly cutting back service to China as fears spread about the coronavirus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Air India and South Korean budget carrier Seoul Air are also halting all flights to the country, and Indonesia’s Lion Air plans to do the same. Other carriers including Finnair, Hong Kong-based Cathay Pacific, and Singapore-based Jetstar Asia are slashing service.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">___</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">8:30 p.m.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Russian President Vladimir Putin has urged the country’s government to be prepared to deal with a possible outbreak of a new virus from China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“It is a new phenomenon, and the question is how well we are prepared for this challenge,” Putin said during a meeting with several Cabinet members.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Russia shares a long border with China. Up to 2 million tourists from China visit Russia every year, with about the same number of Russian tourists traveling to China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">So far there haven't been any confirmed cases of the virus in Russia.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Since the start of the outbreak of the coronavirus in China, officials have reported testing 1.3 million people who returned from China. More than 130 of them have been hospitalized with suspected coronavirus, but in the end were diagnosed with other conditions.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">___</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">8 p.m.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">German auto parts maker Webasto said Wednesday it has temporarily shut its headquarters near Munich after four members of its staff were confirmed to have been infected with a new virus earlier this week. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The infections are believed to have occurred following contact with a Chinese employee from Wuhan who had traveled to Germany to lead a training session. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The company said most of the 1,000 staff at the site in Stockdorf are working from home for the time being. Webasto has an annual turnover of about 3.4 billion euros from the sale of panoramic car roofs and other auto parts, about half of which goes to China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">___</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">7:45 p.m.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China has reported more infections from a new virus than it had from an outbreak of SARS in 2002-2003, although the death toll is still lower.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China said it has confirmed 5,974 cases of the new virus, compared to 5,327 cases of SARS. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">It also reported another large jump in cases on Wednesday and a rise in the death toll to 132. That compares to 348 people killed in China during SARS. Severe acute respiratory syndrome killed nearly 800 people worldwide.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Scientists say there are still many critical questions to be answered about the new virus, including just how transmissible and severe it is. More than 50 cases have been reported outside China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">___</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">7:30 p.m.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The British government is preparing to fly citizens back from the Chinese city at the center of the outbreak of a new virus, and will put them in quarantine for two weeks.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Health Secretary Matt Hancock tweeted Wednesday that “anyone who returns from Wuhan will be safely isolated for 14 days, with all necessary medical attention.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Britain’s Press Association news agency reported that the returning Britons will likely be held on a military base.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">There are an estimated 200 British citizens in Wuhan, and a flight is expected to bring them home on Thursday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">At least 132 people have died and more than 6,000 have been infected with a new type of coronavirus that appeared in Wuhan in December.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The British government has advised against all but essential travel to mainland China, and British Airways on Wednesday said it is suspending flights to and from the country, apart from Hong Kong.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">___</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">7 p.m. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Kazakhstan has suspended all flights, train and bus services to neighboring China and stopped issuing visas to Chinese nationals due to the outbreak of a new virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The government announced halting all flights to China starting Monday and all trains as of Saturday. Passenger bus service was suspended earlier Wednesday. Kazakhstan, a vast nation in Central Asia, shares a long border with China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Kazakh authorities have also rejected a proposal by the International Tennis Federation to move a series of the Federation Cup games to Kazakhstan from China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Thirty-five people who recently traveled to China remain hospitalized in Kazakhstan, but none has been confirmed to be suffering from coronavirus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">___</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">6:15 p.m. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Four members of a Chinese family who traveled to the United Arab Emirates are being treated for a new virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The statement from health officials, carried by the state-run WAM news agency, comes after authorities earlier acknowledged the first cases Wednesday in the country that's home to Dubai and Abu Dhabi.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Earlier, it said the family came from Wuhan, the epicenter of the outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">It did not explain how or when the family traveled from Wuhan to the UAE, the home of long-haul carriers Emirates and Etihad Airways. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">___</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">5 p.m.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Australian health officials say the Chinese women's national soccer team is being quarantined in Brisbane city over concerns about the possible spread of a new virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Queensland state Chief Health Officer Jeannette Young says 32 people — including players and staff — traveled through the virus-effect Chinese city of Wuhan a week ago.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The team will be kept in isolation in a Brisbane hotel until Wednesday next week. The group arrived in Brisbane on a flight from Shanghai on Tuesday before border officials placed them in isolation.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">They are travelling with a team doctor and none has shown symptoms. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">___</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">4:15 p.m. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">British Airways says it's immediately suspending all of its flights to and from mainland China after the U.K. government warned against unnecessary travel to the country amid a virus outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BA said in a statement Wednesday that “we apologize to customers for the inconvenience, but the safety of our customers and crew is always our priority.” </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The airline operates daily flights from London's Heathrow Airport to Shanghai and Beijing. It took the measure a day after Britain's Foreign Office updated its travel advice on China, warning against “all but essential travel” to the mainland, not including Hong Kong and Macao.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China has cut off access to Wuhan and 16 other cities to prevent people from leaving and spreading the virus further. The outbreak has killed more than 130 people.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">___</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">11: 15 a.m.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Australia and New Zealand will work together to evacuate their isolated and vulnerable citizens from China’s virus-hit Hubei province.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison on Wednesday could not say how many or how soon citizens would be flown by Qantas from Hubei. The departures would be arranged in consultation with China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The citizens would be sent for 14 days to a quarantine center on Christmas Island, an Australian territory in the Indian Ocean which has been used to hold asylum seekers and foreign criminals facing deportation.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Australia and New Zealand have also ratcheted up their travel advice for China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Australia has advised its citizens to reconsider their need to travel to China and not to travel to Hubei.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">New Zealand's government advised people to avoid all non-essential travel to China due to the coronavirus outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">_____</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">10 a.m.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Two Japanese men evacuated from a virus-hit Chinese city say they felt relieved but also exhausted upon their arrival in Tokyo.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">They were aboard a chartered flight Japan arranged to evacuate 206 Japanese citizens from Wuhan.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Takeo Aoyama who works for Nippon Steel Corp. and Takayuki Kato, who works for Intec, both wore masks but said they felt fine.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Kato said he was not panicking in Wuhan, but “I was shocked when all transportation systems were suspended. That’s when the situation drastically changed."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China cut off access to Wuhan and 16 other cities to try to contain the outbreak of the new type of coronavirus that has infected thousands of people.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Aoyama said many people who wish to go home to Japan are still in Wuhan, including workers at a Japanese supermarket chain staying open to supply food.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">He said it is important to step up preventive measures in Japan, but “I hope we can also provide support for the Chinese people, which I think would also help the Japanese people who are still there.”</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-1821a3d3" itemprop="headline"><span>UK Stocks Cling to Gains; Oil Majors Underperform</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Reuters) - UK shares rebounded for a second straight day after a steep sell-off earlier this week on rising fears over the impact from the coronavirus, though the bounce lost some punch as oil majors dipped alongside crude prices on U.S. stockpile data.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The FTSE 100 index, which had risen as much as 0.5% earlier, ended only marginally higher. Shell and BP lagged after inventory and stockpiling data from the U.S. Energy Information Administration.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The FTSE 250, which had slumped more than 2% on Monday, rose for the second consecutive session and added 0.2%.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"If yesterday's positive move was down to a combination of short covering and bargain hunting, the muted session today might be a sign that buyers are running out of steam," CMC Markets analyst David Madden said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Avast underperformed with a 5.5% drop, bringing its losses for the week to nearly 20%. It denied media reports and assured users that none of their personally identifiable information had been sold to a third party.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The cybersecurity company also said it was reviewing options for its trend analytics service which is at the centre of the data privacy concerns.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Both British benchmark indexes have shed more than 2% since last week, when news of the coronavirus flare-up first emerged. Dealers are still mulling over how the outbreak will affect the global economy.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Markets will be yearning for signs that the outbreak is stabilising," FXTM analyst Han Tan said, but warned that a meaningful recovery in equities could be months away.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Market strategists at Societe Generale estimated global stock markets could fall 10% if the situation around the fast-spreading virus, which has killed more than 130 people, worsens.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Traders are also eyeing a U.S. Federal Reserve policy meeting, in which the bank is likely to leave interest rates unchanged, but may address future headwinds due to the virus outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In other stock moves, wealth manager Quilter jumped nearly 9% to top the midcaps after a rise in assets under management prompted upgrades by at least two brokerages.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But transport operator Stagecoach slid 6.3% after HSBC downgraded the stock and Britain said it would nationalise Northern Rail, ahead of a review of railway services due to be published in weeks.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Its shares suffered their worst day in almost seven months.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">McCarthy &amp; Stone Plc skidded 6% on its worst day since June 2018, as its biggest shareholder plans to slash its stake in the retirement homebuilder.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Shashwat Awasthi in Bengaluru; Editing by Shounak Dasgupta and Matthew Lewis)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-7ff7e886" itemprop="headline"><span>China Virus Turns Macau Into Gambling Ghost Town</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">HONG KONG — The Chinese territory of Macau has become a near-ghost town during what is typically the busiest time of year in the world's biggest casino hub, after authorities announced a raft of measures to keep visitors away and contain the new coronavirus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The local government late on Tuesday said it would curb its individual visit scheme through which visitors gain entry from mainland China, days after it suspended inbound package tours. Since Friday, arrivals have dropped 69%, latest figures showed.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The steps come as deaths from the coronavirus reached 132 in China on Wednesday with 1,500 new cases. The flu-like virus emerged late last year in the eastern city of Wuhan and cases have since been reported worldwide including seven in Macau.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The virus has added to concerns in the former Portuguese colony over the impact of a slowing Chinese economy and anti-government protests in neighbouring Hong Kong.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">However, the outbreak also coincides with the Lunar New Year holiday during which Macau seasonally enjoys record visitation, prompting analysts to forecast a decline in gaming revenue of at least 30% for as long as visiting restrictions are in place.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Casino operators' share prices plunged on Wednesday, by as much as 6% for MGM China Holdings Ltd, 5.7% for Sands China Ltd, 4.8% for Wynn Macau Ltd and 4.7% for Galaxy Entertainment Group Ltd.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The special administrative region is China's only location where casino gambling is legal, and over 90% visitors come from Greater China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Transport links with mainland China have been curtailed, however, with dozens of flights and ferry services cancelled. The local government has also extended the Lunar New Year break to the end of the week, keeping banks and businesses closed. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">On Tuesday, one of Macau's busiest tourist draws - the towering stone facade dubbed the Ruins of St Paul - was deserted, while renowned shopping and dining streets were empty as local residents also stayed at home.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Casinos were open though operators shuttered restaurants and cancelled all shows. Macau Chief Executive Ho Iat Seng said casinos could close if the virus continues to spread.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Also known as "2019-nCoV", the virus was first reported in Wuhan, a major transportation hub and capital of central Hubei province with a population of 11 million people.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Macau's government has instructed all tourists from Hubei to leave the city. Around 270 remain, officials said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Farah Master; Editing by Anne Marie Roantree, Christopher Cushing and Michael Perry)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-56f1e13d" itemprop="headline"><span>Human Spread of Virus in Three Countries Outside China Worrying: WHO Chief</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">GENEVA — The person-to-person spread of the new coronavirus in three countries - Germany, Vietnam and Japan - is worrying and will be considered by experts reconvened to consider declaring a global emergency, the World Health Organization said on Wednesday. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">WHO director-general Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, speaking to a news conference in Geneva on return from China, said of his meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping: "I was very encouraged and impressed by the President's detailed knowledge of the outbreak and his personal involvement in the outbreak, this for me is real leadership". </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Tedros, asked about an international team agreed to be sent to China, said it would be composed of WHO staff and countries should make "bilateral arrangements" to send their own experts. He would like to reform the current system for declaring international emergencies to have a three-phase system.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Stephanie Nebehay; editing by Emma Farge)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-3d83e4eb" itemprop="headline"><span>WHO Lauds Chinese Response to Virus, Says World 'at Important Juncture'</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">GENEVA — The World Health Organization (WHO) praised China on Wednesday for its efforts to tackle the coronavirus outbreak, but voiced "grave concern" about person-to-person spread in three other countries which led it to summon its Emergency Committee again.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The panel of 16 independent experts will meet behind closed doors on Thursday for the third time in a week to consider whether the epidemic now constitutes a global emergency. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Twice last week it declined to do so, citing a need for more information and evidence, but the virus has spread rapidly and has now been detected in 15 other countries. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"The continued increase in cases and the evidence of human-to-human transmission outside China are of course both deeply concerning. Although the numbers outside China are still relatively small, they hold the potential for a much larger outbreak," WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">There are 6,065 cases worldwide, all but some 70 in China, with 132 deaths in China, according to the latest WHO figures.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"In the last few days the progress of virus especially in some countries, especially human-to-human transmission worries us - in Germany, in Vietnam and also in Japan," Tedros told the news conference, speaking on return from China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"If this gets into a country with a weak health system then that can be problematic," he added.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Tedros was lavish in his praise of Chinese President Xi Jinping and other senior officials for their commitment to transparency during their "very candid discussions" in Beijing.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"I was very encouraged and impressed by the president's detailed knowledge of the outbreak and his personal involvement in the outbreak. This was for me a very rare leadership," said Tedros, a former Ethiopian health and foreign minister.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China agreed to WHO sending an international team of experts, which is to be composed of WHO staff, Tedros said, still giving no details or timetable for their deployment. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Asked about the Trump administration's efforts to get U.S. experts on the ground in China, he said that countries seeking to send their own experts should make "bilateral arrangements".</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Dr. Mike Ryan, head of WHO health emergencies programmes, who accompanied Tedros on the two-day trip, said that China had "a laser focus" on stopping the outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We are at an important juncture in this event. We believe these chains of transmission can still be interrupted," Ryan said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"They are taking extraordinary measures in the face of what is an extraordinary challenge," he said, referring to China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The coronavirus has remained "remarkably stable", according to Ryan, a veteran of outbreaks including the SARS epidemic in China in 2002/03 as well as Ebola outbreaks in West Africa.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Stephanie Nebehay and Emma Farge; Editing by Gareth Jones and Lisa Shumaker)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-7ff7e886" itemprop="headline"><span>China Virus Turns Macau Into Gambling Ghost Town</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">HONG KONG — The Chinese territory of Macau has become a near-ghost town during what is typically the busiest time of year in the world's biggest casino hub, after authorities announced a raft of measures to keep visitors away and contain the new coronavirus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The local government late on Tuesday said it would curb its individual visit scheme through which visitors gain entry from mainland China, days after it suspended inbound package tours. Since Friday, arrivals have dropped 69%, latest figures showed.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The steps come as deaths from the coronavirus reached 132 in China on Wednesday with 1,500 new cases. The flu-like virus emerged late last year in the eastern city of Wuhan and cases have since been reported worldwide including seven in Macau.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The virus has added to concerns in the former Portuguese colony over the impact of a slowing Chinese economy and anti-government protests in neighboring Hong Kong.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">However, the outbreak also coincides with the Lunar New Year holiday during which Macau seasonally enjoys record visitation, prompting analysts to forecast a decline in gaming revenue of at least 30% for as long as visiting restrictions are in place.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Casino operators' share prices plunged on Wednesday, by as much as 6% for MGM China Holdings Ltd, 5.7% for Sands China Ltd, 4.8% for Wynn Macau Ltd and 4.7% for Galaxy Entertainment Group Ltd.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The special administrative region is China's only location where casino gambling is legal, and over 90% visitors come from Greater China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Transport links with mainland China have been curtailed, however, with dozens of flights and ferry services canceled. The local government has also extended the Lunar New Year break to the end of the week, keeping banks and businesses closed. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">On Tuesday, one of Macau's busiest tourist draws - the towering stone facade dubbed the Ruins of St Paul - was deserted, while renowned shopping and dining streets were empty as local residents also stayed at home.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Casinos were open though operators shuttered restaurants and canceled all shows. Macau Chief Executive Ho Iat Seng said casinos could close if the virus continues to spread.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Also known as "2019-nCoV", the virus was first reported in Wuhan, a major transportation hub and capital of central Hubei province with a population of 11 million people.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Macau's government has instructed all tourists from Hubei to leave the city. Around 270 remain, officials said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Farah Master; Editing by Anne Marie Roantree, Christopher Cushing and Michael Perry)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
