Although the numbers outside China are still relatively small, they hold the potential for a much larger outbreak," WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">There are 6,065 cases worldwide, all but some 70 in China, with 132 deaths in China, according to the latest WHO figures.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"In the last few days the progress of virus especially in some countries, especially human-to-human transmission worries us - in Germany, in Vietnam and also in Japan," Tedros told the news conference, speaking on return from China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"If this gets into a country with a weak health system then that can be problematic," he added.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Tedros was lavish in his praise of Chinese President Xi Jinping and other senior officials for their commitment to transparency during their "very candid discussions" in Beijing.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"I was very encouraged and impressed by the president's detailed knowledge of the outbreak and his personal involvement in the outbreak. This was for me a very rare leadership," said Tedros, a former Ethiopian health and foreign minister.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China agreed to WHO sending an international team of experts, which is to be composed of WHO staff, Tedros said, still giving no details or timetable for their deployment. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Asked about the Trump administration's efforts to get U.S. experts on the ground in China, he said that countries seeking to send their own experts should make "bilateral arrangements".</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Dr. Mike Ryan, head of WHO health emergencies programmes, who accompanied Tedros on the two-day trip, said that China had "a laser focus" on stopping the outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We are at an important juncture in this event. We believe these chains of transmission can still be interrupted," Ryan said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"They are taking extraordinary measures in the face of what is an extraordinary challenge," he said, referring to China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The coronavirus has remained "remarkably stable", according to Ryan, a veteran of outbreaks including the SARS epidemic in China in 2002/03 as well as Ebola outbreaks in West Africa.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Stephanie Nebehay and Emma Farge; Editing by Gareth Jones and Lisa Shumaker)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-22a48be6" itemprop="headline"><span>Australia's Treasury Wine Shares Skid 25% After Profit Warning</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Reuters) - A profit warning by Australia's Treasury Wine Estates triggered a 25% tumble in the firm's shares on Wednesday as it announced a review of its U.S. operations amid stiff competition and changes to its Americas management team. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The owner of the Penfolds wine label slashed its earnings outlook for 2020 late on Tuesday, saying business would be affected by aggressive discounting and higher promotional spending in the U.S., which it says has been flooded with cheaper wine. The Americas region accounted for about 40% of Treasury's annual revenue in financial year 2019.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In a statement, Treasury said it now expects its core earnings to grow about 5-10% for 2020, compared with an earlier range of 15% to 20%. The shares plummeted as low as A$12.495 on Wednesday, touching their lowest level since August 2017. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">At least two brokerages - JP Morgan and Credit Suisse - downgraded their ratings for Treasury, citing continuing headwinds as the company's guidance did not factor in the possibility of weaker demand due to risks from the outbreak of the new coronavirus in China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China is one of Treasury's biggest markets, with the company's latest annual profit scaling a record in August due to robust demand for its premium wines there.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Despite the setback in the U.S. this half ... we remain confident ... to deliver growth in this business in the foreseeable future," Tim Ford, Chief Operating Officer, and incoming Chief Executive Officer said during an analyst call. Treasury ruled out an exit from the U.S. market.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Treasury in December announced the appointment of Ben Dollard as president of its operations in the Americas, replacing Angus McPherson. The change came after McPherson notified the company he was unable to relocate to the United States as planned due to unforeseen personal circumstances.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Management said during the call that its guidance did not take into account any potential impact from the coronavirus outbreak in China, as it would be "premature" to do so at this point of time. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Deep discounting had been an issue for Treasury in 2014, when outgoing CEO Michael Clarke was brought in to rethink the company's strategy and tasked with turning around fortunes after strained profits and a troubled foray into the U.S. wine market.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Clarke has since then led the company through a phase of rapid growth in China, and a major acquisition of the U.S. assets of the world's largest spirits group Diageo Plc </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The company had also warned that drought, heat and fires in Australia could drive up the cost of its 2020 Australian vintage wine, which is currently in harvest.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">While Treasury's vineyards remained unscathed from Australia's monster fires, some of its suppliers in the Adelaide Hills were not so lucky. Higher temperatures and water prices in the aftermath of the fires would likely mean production costs in Australia would rise.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Shriya Ramakrishnan in Bengaluru; Editing by Sandra Maler and Kenneth Maxwell)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-31a250b0" itemprop="headline"><span>U.S. Evacuees From China Placed on 72-Hour 'Hold' at California Military Base for Medical Evaluation</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Reuters) - Nearly 200 Americans airlifted from China in the midst of the coronavirus outbreak arrived on Wednesday at a U.S. military base in California, where they will remain isolated for at least 72 hours of medical evaluation, public health officials said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The group, mostly U.S. diplomats and their families, were evacuated from Wuhan at the epicenter of the outbreak aboard a U.S. government-chartered cargo jet that stopped to refuel in Alaska on Tuesday night before flying on to March Air Reserve Base, about 60 miles (97 km) east of Los Angeles.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Foreign governments have begun flying their citizens out of Wuhan as the death toll has risen and the city has entered into a virtual quarantine, with Chinese authorities trying to contain the virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The 195 passengers at March air base were medically screened by Chinese government and U.S. State Department officials before boarding the plane in Wuhan, and again during the refueling stop by a team from the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, CDC officials said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">All the passengers have agreed to remain voluntarily in special housing at the military base, cordoned off from base personnel, for 72 hours.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"These people are not under federal quarantine orders," said Dr. Christopher Braden, deputy director of the CDC's National Center for Emerging and Zoonotic Infectious Diseases.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"I personally talked to them when they were disembarking and going through their first screening checks. They were happy to be here. They were very cooperative with the questions," Braden told a news conference at the Riverside University Health System Medical Center, near the base. "They want to protect themselves. They want to protect others."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">NO ONE SHOWED SYMPTOMS</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The U.S. evacuees, who underwent another round of screening on arrival in California, will be given further medical evaluations, including a blood test for exposure to the virus, over the next three days, the officials said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">None of the arriving passengers has so far exhibited any signs of illness such as fever, cough or other respiratory symptoms, the officials said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The screening in Alaska included a questionnaire to check for factors that would deem them to have been at high risk of infection, including exposure to someone diagnosed with coronavirus or close contact to someone living with a person who was sick.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"There were no individuals who responded to the questions indicating they were high-risk," said Dr. Nancy Knight, director of the CDC's Division of Global Health Protection. "We are reassessing that now."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">One individual on the original evacuation manifest was barred from boarding the plane in China because the person had a fever. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The State Department ordered its personnel evacuated from the U.S. Consulate in Wuhan and welcomed other American citizens onto the flight because there was excess room on the plane, CDC officials said. The group included an unspecified number of children, ranging from a month-old infant to teenagers, they said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The plan is to allow the evacuees to return to their homes once the initial evaluation period is over, provided there is no indication of exposure or illness, the officials said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">At that point, absent any symptoms or a positive test result, an individual would be considered non-infectious and be permitted to travel on public transportation without putting others at risk, Braden said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">FREE TO LEAVE?</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">People who may be incubating the infection before any symptoms appear are not believed to be contagious, Braden said. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Health authorities will continue "active monitoring" of all the passengers through the end of a 14-day incubation period, and plans are in place to isolate any individual who shows signs of illness after going home.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">If any evacuees test positive or fall ill in the next three days, they would be transferred to the Riverside Medical Center for isolation and treatment, and authorities would decide what measures need to be taken for the rest of the group, Braden said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Asked if someone in the group who tested negative before the 72-hour hold was over would be free to leave the base early, Knight said that would lead to a conversation that "would be discussed up to the highest levels within the U.S. government."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"If we think a person is a danger to the community, we can institute an individual quarantine for that person, and we will," Braden added. "If we think it's risky, then we have the tools to protect the public and we will use them."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">So far, five cases of coronavirus have been diagnosed in the United States, none of them fatal, Braden said. A further 165, other than the plane passengers, are under evaluation.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"There's no indication we have any transmission from those cases, and therefore the risk for people in the United States, we believe, is low," Braden said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Omar Younis; Additional reporting by Steve Gorman in Culver City, Calif. and Andrew Hay in New Mexico; Writing by Steve Gorman; Editing by Bill Tarrant, Rosalba O'Brien and Peter Cooney)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-2f324bea" itemprop="headline"><span>Three Japanese Evacuees From Wuhan Test Positive for Virus, Two Had No Symptoms</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">TOKYO — Three Japanese evacuated from Wuhan on a government-chartered flight have been confirmed to be infected with the coronavirus - including two who had not shown any symptoms, the health ministry said on Thursday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The two were the first cases in Japan of people without symptoms being confirmed to have been infected with the virus, the ministry said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Japan on Tuesday designated illness caused by the new virus as "designated infectious disease", which would allow compulsory hospitalization and the use of public funds to treat such patients. But the designation - which takes effect on Feb. 7 after ordinances are issued - does not apply to those without symptoms.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Inaugurating the government's special task force for the coronavirus, Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said the government would take all steps possible to prevent the spread of the virus. Among the measures, the government would confirm contact information of all entrants into Japan who have a record of staying in Wuhan and conduct health checks.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Japan now has confirmed 11 cases of the virus, including a tour bus driver who was infected after coming into contact with Chinese visitors.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The three new cases were among 206 Japanese who were evacuated to Tokyo on Wednesday from Wuhan, the epicenter of the epidemic.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Of those evacuees, 12 were hospitalized because they had symptoms such as fever and coughing, and two refused to be taken to the hospital for checks but were escorted home. The remaining 201 all tested negative, a ministry official told a briefing.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Asked about concerns over the possible transmission of the virus from people who have not shown symptoms, the official said it was not clear whether that had happened.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Shigeru Omi, head of the Japan Community Health Care Organization, told the same briefing that there were reports of such transmission cases in China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Chinese National Health Commission Minister Ma Xiaowei on Sunday said the virus was infectious during incubation, which can range from one to 14 days, which was not the case with Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS).</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Abe told parliament it was regrettable that two of Wednesday's returnees had declined to be tested but said there were limits to what the government could do legally.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"It is extremely unfortunate that they declined to be tested," Abe told a parliamentary panel. "There are no legal constraints (on those without symptoms). There are civil rights aspects and there are limits to what we can do."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Abe also said the government would keep an eye on the possible economic fallout on tourism and other areas and would do everything necessary to protect people's lives and health.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A second charter flight carrying 210 Japanese nationals arrived at Tokyo's Haneda airport on Thursday morning. Chief Cabinet Secretary Yoshihide Suga told a news conference that 13 who returned on Thursday felt unwell.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Chang-Ran Kim, Ami Miyazaki and Kiyoshi Takenaka; Writing by Linda Sieg; Editing by Kim Coghill and Sam Holmes)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-779fab6" itemprop="headline"><span>Freeport CEO 'Looking Forward' to Deals Once Expansion Projects Done</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Reuters) - Freeport-McMoran Inc, the world's largest publicly traded copper producer, would consider acquisitions, mergers or other deals once three ongoing expansion projects finish by 2022, Chief Executive Richard Adkerson said in an interview on Tuesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Demand for copper is projected to surge this decade because of the rising popularity of electric vehicles, which use twice as much copper as internal combustion engines. That, in turn, is expected to fuel an M&amp;A wave across the sector. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Despite that, Phoenix, Arizona-based Freeport's shares are worth half what they were in 2010, dragged down by uncertainty over the company's stake in a major Indonesian mine and debt from an ill-fated oil and gas venture.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But those issues are largely behind the company, which is about to open a copper mine in the United States, is expanding Indonesia's Grasberg mine and has launched an analytics program to boost production in Peru.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Those projects should double the company's cash flow and boost the company's stock price, giving the company ammunition to consider deals, Adkerson told Reuters. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"I'm looking forward to having a new experience in my career toward accessing alternatives and deciding which way we go," said Adkerson, an accountant by training who became CEO in 2003.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Those alternatives could include buying part or all of another company, building new mines or other deals, he said. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We don't have a clear directive now on what that direction could be, but we will be attractively situated and will have an opportunity to add value through investments," said Adkerson. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">According to recent news reports, Barrick Gold Corp CEO Mark Bristow has spoken favorably of Freeport's assets and a potential combination.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Adkerson declined to comment. A Barrick spokeswoman declined to comment. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Adkerson, 73, said he has no plans to retire and is in good health. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"This is not a time that I'm thinking about walking away," he said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Adkerson called the outbreak of a deadly coronavirus in China a "real black swan event." The term is a reference to the book "Black Swan," which looks at the potentially catastrophic effects of unpredictable events.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Copper prices &lt;CMCUc1&gt; have dropped more than 10% this month on concerns the virus could affect the global economy. Copper prices are closely linked to global economic health because the metal is used for construction and manufacturing.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Freeport's stock dropped more than 9% last Thursday due in part to virus concerns even as the company posted better-than-expected quarterly results. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Its shares were 2.5% higher at $11.175 in afternoon trading, along with a broad rally in global equity markets as investors took a less pessimistic view of the potential economic fallout from the coronavirus outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Ernest Scheyder; Editing by Marguerita Choy)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-3bce6c95" itemprop="headline"><span>Stocks Lose Steam in Wake of Fed Statement</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">NEW YORK — The S&amp;P 500 ended slightly lower on Wednesday, as an initial boost from the likes of Apple, Boeing and General Electric following their quarterly results faded in the wake of a policy announcement from the Federal Reserve.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Stocks initially showed little reaction to the Fed's policy statement but steadily lost ground on the heels of a news conference by chairman Jerome Powell. The Fed held rates steady as expected while offering no new guidance on its balance sheet, but Powell noted "uncertainties about the outlook remain" and noted the coronavirus outbreak in China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Since the Fed's last rate cut in October, its third reduction of 2019, policymakers have agreed to keep their target policy rate in the current range of 1.50% and 1.75%. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Apple Inc gained 2.09% after the iPhone maker late on Tuesday reported earnings for the holiday shopping quarter that topped analysts' expectations, even as it braced for more disruptions in virus-hit China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Boeing Co rose 1.72% after the planemaker forecast nearly $19 billion in costs related to the grounding of its 737 MAX jets, smaller than what many analysts had expected, and helping offset the company's report of its first annual loss since 1997.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Several companies have warned of disruption to their operations due to the coronavirus outbreak, and a Chinese government economist was quoted as saying the country's economic growth may drop to 5% or even lower.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"I don’t mean to minimize the human impact of the virus but what is more concerning to me is not that the market has not responded to the virus but rather that it was up so strongly in the first 2-1/2 weeks of January after a very, very strong 2019," said Ellen Hazen, portfolio manager at F.L.Putnam Investment Management in Wellesley, Massachusetts. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"The market does seem to have gotten ahead of itself." </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 11.6 points, or 0.04%, to 28,734.45, the S&amp;P 500 lost 2.84 points, or 0.09%, to 3,273.4 and the Nasdaq Composite added 5.48 points, or 0.06%, to 9,275.16.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">As earnings gather pace, analysts expect profit for S&amp;P 500 companies to be flat in the fourth quarter, an improvement over the 0.6% decline estimated at the start of the season, according to Refinitiv data.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">General Electric jumped 10.32% after the industrial conglomerate set a higher cash target for 2020.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Starbucks Corp dropped 2.12% after warning of a financial hit as it closed thousands of restaurants and adjusted operating hours in China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Advancing issues outnumbered declining ones on the NYSE by a 1.01-to-1 ratio; on Nasdaq, a 1.62-to-1 ratio favored decliners.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The S&amp;P 500 posted 46 new 52-week highs and 8 new lows; the Nasdaq Composite recorded 80 new highs and 65 new lows. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">About 6.88 billion shares changed hands in U.S. exchanges, compared with the 7.45 billion daily average over the last 20 sessions. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Chuck Mikolajczak; Editing by Leslie Adler and Sonya Hepinstall)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 [<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-6943a4d9" itemprop="headline"><span>China Science Database Scraps Paywall to Aid Virus Battle</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">SHANGHAI — A major scientific database run by China's Tsinghua University has made its contents available free of charge from Wednesday in order to help researchers work from home, following a virus outbreak in the central city of Wuhan. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The death toll in the epidemic rose sharply to 132 and the first case appeared in the Middle East, as concern mounts after China's health authorities said the number of confirmed cases had jumped by 1,459 to 5,974.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The China National Knowledge Infrastructure project (CNKI.net) said it would drop its paywall for all users until July 1, in an effort to help researchers share information.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"In extraordinary times, we pledge that resources and services will always be with you," it said in a statement. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">On Wednesday, the coronavirus was the term most frequently searched in the database, which has more than 120 million users who downloaded 2.3 billion full-text research reports last year, according to its website. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by David Stanway; Airlines Step Up Fight on Virus</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BANGKOK — Passengers on some flights to China will have to make do without hot meals, blankets and newspapers, as airlines step up measures to protect crew and travelers from a new virus that has killed more than 130 in the country.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Seeking to contain the spread of the coronavirus by reducing personal contact, Taiwan's China Airlines said it was encouraging passengers to bring their own drinks bottles and would limit re-usable items by replacing them with disposables.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The airline and its regional arm Mandarin Airlines stopped from Monday serving hot meals and have replaced tablecloths and napkins with paper towels on cross-strait and Hong Kong flights.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">They have also stopped providing blankets, pillows, towels, magazines and newspapers, while drinks and disposable headphones are supplied only on request.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"The seat back pocket will only contain the aircraft safety card and sick bag," said Tigerair Taiwan, also a member of China Airlines group, adding duty-free sales were also not available.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Hong Kong's Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd said on Wednesday amenities such as hot towels, blankets and magazines would not be offered on flights to and from mainland China from Thursday until further notice.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Thai Airways is spray-disinfecting the passenger cabin and cockpit on all flights returning from China and high-risk destinations. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Because we have in-flight entertainment which mean the LCD screens are being touched all the time, so we deep cleanse every flight before departure," an executive told a news conference on Tuesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Its video showing staff in hazmat suits spraying down a cabin drew praise on social media for the flag carrier's efforts, although some were alarmed by it.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Where are all the passengers on board? I think all the passengers are supposed to be kept and be monitored for one week," social media user John Honesty posted on Facebook.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"I suggest to stop all flight from China for at list 30 to 60 days. That will not kill the economy. The life of the public is more important now than the so called economy."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Thailand, the top destination for China's holidaymakers, had 11 million Chinese visitors last year. But with 14 coronavirus cases, it is the second-worst hit country outside of China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Other airlines including Singapore Airlines are allowing crew to wear masks on China flights, while American Airlines provides hand sanitizer wipes for flight attendants to use on all departures to China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Some are taking even more drastic measures with flight cancellations.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">British Airways and Indonesia's Lion Air said on Wednesday they would suspend all direct flights to China. India's IndiGo is also suspending flights to Chengdu and Hong Kong.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The announcements follow a decision by United Airlines Holdings Inc on Tuesday to suspend 24 U.S. flights to Beijing, Hong Kong and Shanghai due to a sharp drop in demand.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Writing by Aradhana Aravindan in Singapore; Additional reporting by Jamie Freed in Sydney; Editing by Miyoung Kim, Michael Perry and Mark Potter)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-7c695ca8" itemprop="headline"><span>American Airlines Joins Others in Suspending Some China Flights as Demand Sags</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">WASHINGTON — American Airlines Group Inc, the largest U.S. carrier, said on Wednesday it would suspend flights from Los Angeles to Beijing and Shanghai, as demand has sagged amid a coronavirus outbreak in China that has prompted other airlines to also cancel flights.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The United States and Japan evacuated their nationals from a quarantined Chinese city on Wednesday and British Airways suspended flights to China, where deaths from the virus have leapt to 133 and an impact to the economy predicted.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">American said its flight suspension would run from Feb. 9 through Mar. 27. The carrier, which normally operates four U.S. flights a day to China, will continue flying to Beijing and Shanghai from Dallas, Texas.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China's economic growth had helped power a global aviation boom over the last decade, but as the country curtails travel with the spread of the flu-like virus, a slowdown could hit the industry harder than ever before.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">United Airlines Holdings Inc, Air Canada, Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd and Finnair Plc were among other carriers that are cancelling flights.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by David Shepardson and Tracy Rucinski; Editing by Chizu Nomiyama and Bernadette Baum)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-3eadddc1" itemprop="headline"><span>Australia's Treasury Wine Shares Skid 25% After Profit Downgrade</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Reuters) - A profit warning by Australia's Treasury Wine Estates triggered a 25% tumble in the firm's shares on Wednesday as it announced a review of its U.S. operations amid stiff competition, a wine glut and unforeseen management changes. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The owner of the Penfolds wine label slashed its earnings outlook for 2020 late on Tuesday, saying business would be affected by aggressive discounting and higher promotional spending in the United States, which it says has been flooded with cheaper wine.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Americas region accounted for about 40% of Treasury's annual revenue in financial year 2019.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In a statement, Treasury said it now expects its core earnings to grow about 5-10% for 2020, compared with an earlier range of 15% to 20%. The shares plummeted as low as A$12.48 on Wednesday, touching their lowest level since August 2017. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">At least three brokerages - JP Morgan, Credit Suisse and UBS - downgraded their ratings for Treasury, citing continuing headwinds as the company's guidance did not factor in the possibility of weaker demand due to risks from the outbreak of the new coronavirus in China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China is one of Treasury's biggest markets, with the company's latest annual profit scaling a record in August due to robust demand for its premium wines there.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The company said its new guidance did not take into account any potential coronavirus impact, as it would be "premature" to do so. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Despite the setback in the U.S. this half ... we remain confident ... to deliver growth in this business in the foreseeable future," Tim Ford, Chief Operating Officer, and incoming Chief Executive Officer said during an analyst call. Treasury ruled out an exit from the U.S. market.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Treasury in December announced the appointment of Ben Dollard as president of its operations in the Americas, replacing Angus McPherson. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The change came after McPherson notified the company he was unable to relocate to the United States as planned due to unforeseen personal circumstances.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Deep discounting had been an issue for Treasury in 2014, when outgoing CEO Michael Clarke was brought in to rethink the company's strategy and tasked with turning around fortunes after troubles in the U.S. wine market.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Clarke has since then led the company through a phase of rapid growth in China, and a major acquisition of the U.S. assets of the world's largest spirits group Diageo Plc in 2016.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"It is perhaps no surprise that the profit weakness was in the Americas business," said Nigel Stevenson an analyst at GMT Research, which in August said Treasury may have inflated profits following its purchase of most of Diageo's wine business.<span class="css-8l6xbc evw5hdy0">   </span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Hong Kong-based research house last year argued Treasury might have used acquisition accounting to boost profits by about A$300 million (155.96 million pounds), which the company rejected.<span class="css-8l6xbc evw5hdy0">    </span>"Profitability in the Americas business may now be declining to more normal levels as the benefits of the acquisition wind down," Stevenson told Reuters in emailed remarks.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Treasury also warned drought, heat and fires in Australia could drive up the cost of its 2020 Australian vintage wine, which is currently in harvest.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Shriya Ramakrishnan in Bengaluru; Editing by Kenneth Maxwell and Lincoln Feast.)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-7c695ca8" itemprop="headline"><span>American Airlines Joins Others in Suspending Some China Flights as Demand Sags</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">WASHINGTON — American Airlines Group Inc, the largest U.S. carrier, said on Wednesday it would suspend flights from Los Angeles to Beijing and Shanghai, as demand has sagged amid a coronavirus outbreak in China that has prompted other airlines to also cancel flights.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The United States and Japan evacuated their nationals from a quarantined Chinese city on Wednesday and British Airways suspended flights to China, where deaths from the virus have leapt to 133 and an impact to the economy predicted.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">American said its flight suspension would run from Feb. 9 through Mar. 27. The carrier, which normally operates four U.S. flights a day to China, will continue flying to Beijing and Shanghai from Dallas, Texas.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China's economic growth had helped power a global aviation boom over the last decade, but as the country curtails travel with the spread of the flu-like virus, a slowdown could hit the industry harder than ever before.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">United Airlines Holdings Inc, Air Canada, Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd and Finnair Plc were among other carriers that are cancelling flights.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by David Shepardson and Tracy Rucinski; Editing by Chizu Nomiyama and Bernadette Baum)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-6e5fd90c" itemprop="headline"><span>UAE Confirms 4 Chinese Tourists Have Virus, First in Mideast</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">The Associated Press</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">DUBAI, United Arab Emirates — A family of four Chinese tourists in the United Arab Emirates on Wednesday became the first cases in the Mideast of a new Chinese virus that causes flu-like symptoms, with an Emirati doctor saying the first to fall ill only showed symptoms after over a week on vacation.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Dr. Hussein al-Rand, an assistant undersecretary at the UAE's Ministry of Health and Prevention, told The Associated Press that there was no reason to panic over virus. However, he acknowledged Emirati officials now were tracing the family's steps since landing in this federation of seven sheikhdoms that includes Dubai and Abu Dhabi. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“Their condition is stable, they are awake, they are all receiving all the measures,” al-Rand said. “I would say to the public: Please, don't be panicked. The health condition within the United Arab Emirates is safe.” </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Among those sick in the family are a grandmother, her daughter, the daughter's husband and the couple's 9-year-old daughter, al-Rand said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The family from Wuhan, the epicenter of the viral outbreak, entered the UAE on Jan. 16, al-Rand said. He declined to name the airline the family flew on and the airport at which they arrived. The UAE is home to long-haul carriers Emirates and Etihad Airways and is a hub for global air travel. Al-Rand also declined to say which cities they visited during their vacation.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Authorities at Abu Dhabi's airport and Dubai International Airport, the world's busiest for international travel, began screening passengers and crew from incoming China flights on Jan. 23. That's the day China shut down Wuhan's airport and other transportation in the city to stop the spread of the virus. The lockdown has since expanded to include 17 cities with more than 50 million people in all.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">That same day, Jan. 23, the grandmother among the family fell ill and sought medical care, al-Rand said. Public awareness about the virus had spread widely and doctors tested the grandmother for the new coronavirus and got a positive result. Authorities admitted the other three shortly after and they too tested positive. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">On Wednesday, six days after the grandmother fell ill, the UAE announced the cases, initially providing little information. They later confirmed the number of those ill and their nationality. The World Health Organization, which is keeping track of those who fall ill from the new virus, reported the four cases in the UAE late Wednesday night. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Emirati officials are taking "all the necessary precautions in accordance with the scientific recommendations, conditions and standards approved by the World Health Organization," the Health and Prevention Ministry said. “The general health condition is not a cause for concern."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">State-run and government-supporting media in the UAE carefully announced the news Wednesday, stressing that authorities said they had the situation under control. However, reports quickly emerged of face masks selling out at pharmacies as a popular online retailer had them as a top trending item.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">At Arab Health, a major trade show happening this week in Dubai, a few Emiratis and others attending wore surgical masks while walking among the crowds. A few tourists also wore face masks while visiting sites in Dubai.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Al-Rand declined to name the Emirati hospital the four now are receiving treatment. He also declined to say how many people Emirati health authorities had contacted while tracing the family's travel in the UAE.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Emirates meanwhile said it continued its flights to Beijing, Guangzhou, and Shanghai, as well as Hong Kong.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“We are providing masks and hand sanitisers to all crew on our flights to China,” the company said in a statement. “Our crew who serve passengers with any symptoms have been advised to wear masks onboard.” </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The new type of coronavirus first appeared in the central Chinese city of Wuhan in December. It causes flu-like symptoms, such as cough and fever and in severe cases pneumonia, that are similar to many other illnesses. It's from the coronavirus family, which includes those that can cause the common cold as well as more serious illnesses such as SARS and MERS.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The viral outbreak that began in China has infected more than 6,000 people in the mainland and more than a dozen other countries. China's death toll has passed 130. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Several countries have confirmed cases of the virus, with most of them being Chinese visitors, people who visited Wuhan or family members in close contact with the sick.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The source of the virus and the full extent of its spread are still unknown. However, the WHO said most cases reported to date “have been milder, with around 20% of those infected experiencing severe illness.” </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Facing lower oil prices and a slumping housing market, the UAE has been aggressively pursuing more Chinese tourists to this country home to the world's tallest building. Chinese visitors to the country can get visas on arrival to the UAE. Malls in Dubai now have Chinese on their signs alongside Arabic and English, with tour groups tramping through and high-end shoppers targeting luxury stores. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Dubai alone welcomed 989,000 tourists from China in 2019, up 15% from 857,000 in 2018, according to the city-state's tourism department.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">___</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Follow Jon Gambrell on Twitter at www.twitter.com/jongambrellAP. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">___</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Associated Press writers Fay Abuelgasim and Kamran Jebreili in Dubai contributed to this report. </p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-714a97ee" itemprop="headline"><span>Keep Calm and Work at Home: Order Prevails at Virus-Hit German Firm</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">STOCKDORF, Germany — Four of their co-workers have contracted the coronavirus after a colleague from China visited the firm and their factory has been temporarily closed, but staff at German auto parts supplier Webasto insist they are not worried, even as the global death toll rises.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Their calm is shared by locals in Stockdorf, a village of some 4,000 people just 10 km (6 miles) southwest of Munich, where Webasto's [WEBA.UL] plant of 1,000 is based.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Updates on the condition of the four - three men aged 33, 27 and 40 and a 33-year-old woman - are positive.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Clemens Wendtner, chief doctor at the Munich Schwabing clinic where they are being cared for, said: "The four patients are free of symptoms and in good clinical condition. This is really good news."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"They are currently still with us for clinical observation. As they are isolated, there is no risk of infection for other patients and visitors to the Munich Clinic Schwabing".</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Speaking outside Webasto's factory gates by the deserted carpark, company spokeswoman Nadine Schian said a group of managers were working out how staff could work from home.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Inside, the crisis committee is meeting: management, communications, IT. It's about two dozen people," she said. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In one of the first cases of person-to-person transmission outside China, a 33-year-old man who worked at Webasto apparently contracted the virus on Jan. 21 during a training session with a Chinese colleague.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The firm later announced three additional co-workers had tested positive for the flu-like virus. It suspended all business trips to and from China for at least two weeks and closed its Stockdorf plant until Feb. 2.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">SANGUINE MOOD</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">One Webasto employee, who declined to give his name but said he was 54 and lived nearby, came out of the building headed for his car. "I picked up my laptop to work from home," he said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Was he worried about contracting the virus? "No, I'm not worried. I also don't know which colleagues have been infected with the virus. One colleague I know went to the doctor with flu symptoms. But that's normal for this time of year."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The sanguine mood ran through the village.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Webasto employees come here for lunch and coffee," said Ludwig Harter, 33, who runs his family confectionary business with his brother and mother.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Today, of course, there is less activity than usual. I'm not worried about my health. I have 100 percent confidence in the authorities."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Outside the local supermarket, pensioner Lore Puhlmann shared Harter's confidence: "I feel safe really, because I take great care to wash my hands when I come back from shopping."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In Berlin, the government is planning a special military flight in the coming days to evacuate healthy German citizens from the area around Wuhan in China, the epicenter of the coronavirus epidemic, a Foreign Ministry spokesman said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">There are now some 5,974 confirmed cases in China and 133 people have died. About 60 cases, but no deaths, have been reported in 15 other countries, including Germany.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In Stockdorf, innkeeper Michael Behringer, 52, complains about the lack of business from Webasto workers.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"No one is here today," he says, but he is not worried about his health. "Disinfection, washing your hands, that's a given in our restaurant business."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Writing by Paul Carrel; Editing by Alexandra Hudson)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-7aa41d0b" itemprop="headline"><span>Beijing Drugstore Fined for Hiking Mask Prices Amid Virus Outbreak</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BEIJING — A drugstore in the Chinese capital will be fined 3 million yuan ($434,530) for hiking the price of masks by almost six times the online rate amid a spreading virus outbreak, the Beijing municipal market regulator said on Wednesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The coronavirus outbreak, which started in the central city of Wuhan late last year, has killed 132 people, with nearly 6,000 infected in China. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">An administrative penalty notice has been issued to the Beijing Jimin Kangtai Pharmacy for sharply raising the price of N95 masks, the regulator said in a statement on its website.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The store raised the price of a box of 3M brand masks to 850 yuan while the online price was just 143 yuan, state television said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Since Thursday, the regulator has investigated 31 price violation cases, it said, as it boosted supervision of prices of protective gear and punished illegal activities, such as hoarding or fabricating information about price hikes. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In the commercial capital of Shanghai, the municipal market regulator has ordered the closure of a drug store that sold sub-standard masks, the city government said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The regulator has asked the store to refund buyers and dispose of unsold ones, it said on its official account on the Weibo app. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Judy Hua, Leng Cheng and Tony Munroe; Editing by Michael Perry and Clarence Fernandez)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-7aa41d0b" itemprop="headline"><span>Beijing Drugstore Fined for Hiking Mask Prices Amid Virus Outbreak</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BEIJING — A drugstore in the Chinese capital will be fined 3 million yuan ($434,530) for hiking the price of masks by almost six times the online rate amid a spreading virus outbreak, the Beijing municipal market regulator said on Wednesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The coronavirus outbreak, which started in the central city of Wuhan late last year, has killed 132 people, with nearly 6,000 infected in China. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">An administrative penalty notice has been issued to the Beijing Jimin Kangtai Pharmacy for sharply raising the price of N95 masks, the regulator said in a statement on its website.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The store raised the price of a box of 3M brand masks to 850 yuan while the online price was just 143 yuan, state television said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Since Thursday, the regulator has investigated 31 price violation cases, it said, as it boosted supervision of prices of protective gear and punished illegal activities, such as hoarding or fabricating information about price hikes. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In the commercial capital of Shanghai, the municipal market regulator has ordered the closure of a drug store that sold sub-standard masks, the city government said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The regulator has asked the store to refund buyers and dispose of unsold ones, it said on its official account on the Weibo app. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Judy Hua, Leng Cheng and Tony Munroe; Editing by Michael Perry and Clarence Fernandez)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-416a0875" itemprop="headline"><span>Blink and You Miss It: The U.S. Yield Curve Inverts Again</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">NEW YORK — A closely watched bond market phenomenon has again flashed yellow, but investors are loathe to give it much weight. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Yields on the 10-year Treasury note briefly fell below those of the 3-month bill early Tuesday for the first time since October, on concerns over the economic impact of the coronavirus. An inverted yield curve has historically been an indicator of looming recession as it tends to reflect worries over future growth among bond investors.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">However, worries about the coronavirus have so far done little to shake the upbeat growth views many investors and analysts had going into 2020. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“The state of the U.S. economy seems to be steady as she goes,” said Michael Lorizio, senior fixed income trader at Manulife Asset Management. “To really forecast any chance of near-term recession I think I’d need to see more fundamental support from economic indicators, not just relying on the yield curve.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Various portions of the Treasury yield curve inverted in 2019 for the first time in years, sparking concerns that a recession may be looming. Some of those worries faded after the Federal Reserve delivered three rate cuts and said it is unlikely to tighten monetary policy in the near future, buoying prices for stocks and boosting investor bullishness: a recent UBS Global Wealth Management survey of high-net worth investors showed that 94% expected positive returns in 2020, while a fund manager poll from Bank of America Merrill Lynch showed stock allocations at their highest level in 17 months. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Tuesday’s brief inversion came as investors rushed back into Treasuries and other haven assets, sending U.S. government bond prices higher and pushing down yields. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The very front of the curve remained kinked, with bills yielding more than shorter-dated notes like 2-year, 3-year, and 5-year maturities. However, those relationships are not as closely monitored as economic bellwethers. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"You have the feeling of a fragile global economy that is relying on support from central banks and a situation where lots of risky assets appear... moderately overvalued," said Thanos Bardas, global co-head investment grade fixed income at Neuberger Berman. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">U.S. stock markets were on track to erase most of the previous day’s losses Tuesday after falling to a two-week low a day before. But investors remain concerned over how severe travel restrictions and other measures to contain the virus will impact China’s economy and ripple through the rest of the world. China’s economy - the world’s second largest - is already expected to expand at its slowest pace in three decades this year, a Reuters poll found earlier this month. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Some are also grappling with contradictory signals over growth in the United States. Lacklustre business spending and a contracting manufacturing sector have been weak spots for the U.S. economy, while inflation has also remained low. Yet jobs growth has been solid, with the jobless rate at a 50-year low, and consumer spending strong.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">At the same time, the U.S. curve has inverted before each recession in the past 50 years, offering a false signal just once in that time. Yet the inversion offers few clues on when a recession will actually hit. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The phenomenon may also be a less effective recession indicator these days, thanks to persistently low inflation expectations and unprecedented stimulus from the Fed and other global central banks. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“The market is pretty comfortable with what the Fed is going to do, and that is nothing,” said Gary Pollack, head of fixed-income trading, Deutsche Bank Private Wealth Management. “I’m in the camp still that indicator was a false one, but I could be wrong.” </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Karen Brettell and Ira Iosebashvili; writing by Ira Iosebashvili; editing by Megan Davies and and Lisa Shumaker)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-6057bde" itemprop="headline"><span>China Police Drop Case of SARS 'Rumour-Mongering' at Start of New Crisis</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">SHANGHAI — Chinese police at the center of a coronavirus outbreak that has killed 132 people have dropped a case against eight people accused of spreading rumors about deadly SARS, they said on Wednesday, as anger grows about the handling of the new crisis.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The bureau in Wuhan said the "rumor-mongering" at the beginning of the month, when a new virus had not been detected, `was not especially serious and the accused should be subject to "education" and "criticism" rather than fines or detention.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In a comment posted below the online police notice, one person said the "eight warriors" should be rewarded, not punished. Another said he or she would report the Wuhan police to China's cabinet for dereliction of duty. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">If the new virus had been treated as seriously as Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) in the first place, it wouldn't have turned into the "national disaster" it has now become, said someone with the username "Niu Erqian". </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China traditionally cracks down hard on rumour-mongering, saying that false information damages public order. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China was widely accused of covering up the SARS crisis in 2002-2003, when hundreds died. The Wuhan government has been accused by many online of covering up the new virus, but Beijing has insisted on full disclosure and transparency.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"The whole country thinks you shouldn't have arrested them," said another commentator with the username "Melody consumes less paper".</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by David Stanway; Editing by Nick Macfie)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-79d7a191" itemprop="headline"><span>Turkey to Evacuate Citizens From China's Wuhan Over Virus Outbreak: NTV</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">ANKARA — Turkey will evacuate 32 citizens and their families from China's Wuhan, at the epicenter of a new virus outbreak, in the coming days, the country's ambassador to China said on Wednesday as the death toll rose to 132.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The World Health Organization (WHO) has said it is confident in China's ability to contain the coronavirus, but concerns are mounting as its health authorities said the number of confirmed cases had jumped by 1,459 to 5,974. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The United States and Japan flew its citizens out of Wuhan on Wednesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Speaking to broadcaster NTV, Ambassador Emin Onen said Turkey had made the necessary applications to Chinese officials to evacuate the 32 citizens, adding that none of them had been diagnosed with the virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We are in touch with all our citizens," Onen said. "We will bring them back as soon as possible...with a medical or similarly-equipped plane. There will be certain quarantine conditions when they land in Turkey."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The number of cases in China now exceeds its tally from 2002 and 2003 when 5,327 people were infected with the Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) that killed about 800 people around the world.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">While some experts believe the new strain, known as "2019-nCoV", is not as deadly as SARS, it has created alarm because it is spreading quickly and key features are still unknown, including its lethality.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The government has said there are no known cases of the virus in Turkey and authorities are using thermal cameras at airports and other measures. Turkish Airlines has suspended flights to Wuhan, which has a population of 11 million. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Tuvan Gumrukcu; Editing by Jonathan Spicer)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-104a549d" itemprop="headline"><span>Factbox: Countries Evacuating Nationals From China Virus Areas</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Reuters) - Countries around the world are planning to evacuate diplomatic staff and citizens from Chinese areas hit by the new coronavirus, which is spreading quickly.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Wuhan, a city of 11 million in the province of Hubei and the epicenter of the outbreak, is in virtual lockdown and much of Hubei, home to nearly 60 million people, is under some kind of travel curb.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Following are some countries' evacuation plans, and how they are planning to manage the health risk from those who are returning. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- France's first plane to repatriate nationals from Wuhan will leave Paris on Wednesday and return the next day. The flight will carry people with no symptoms, junior transport minister Jean-Baptiste Djebarri told television channel CNews. "These people will be put under quarantine. And then there will be a second flight, at a yet undefined date, with people showing symptoms ... who will be cared for in Paris," he said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- South Korea plans to send charter flights this week to evacuate its citizens from Wuhan, Prime Minister Chung Sye-kyun said on Tuesday. The planes will arrive as early as Thursday, he told a ministerial meeting aimed at discussing efforts to prevent the spread of the new coronavirus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- The first chartered flight carrying 206 Japanese nationals evacuated from Wuhan arrived in Tokyo - four of them showing symptoms of fever or coughing. Japan has confirmed seven patients, including a Japanese tour bus driver who had been infected after coming into contact with Chinese visitors. Chief Cabinet Secretary Yoshihide Suga said the passengers evacuated with symptoms would undergo medical examinations at a hospital designated for infectious diseases, while the remaining passengers would be asked to return home or stay at a nearby hotel after a check-up at a separate hospital.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Kazakhstan has asked Beijing to allow 98 Kazakh students to leave the city of Wuhan, deputy foreign minister Shukhrat Nuryshev said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Germany will evacuate 90 citizens living in China's Wuhan region.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Morocco will evacuate 100 citizens, mostly students, from the Wuhan area.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Spain's government is working with China and the European Union to repatriate Spanish nationals from the Wuhan area, Foreign Minister Arancha Gonzalez Laya said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- The United States evacuated 220 citizens from Wuhan including 50 diplomats and contractors, a diplomatic source said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Britain is talking to international partners to find solutions to help British and other foreign nationals leave Wuhan, a spokesman for Prime Minister Boris Johnson said. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Canada has about 167 nationals in the Wuhan area, Foreign Minister Francois-Philippe Champagne said, and eight people have sought consular assistance, which is being provided. While the minister did not rule out evacuations, he did not indicate there were any planned, adding that each consular request would be evaluated on a case by case basis.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Russia has been in talks with China about evacuating its nationals from Wuhan and Hubei province, Russia's embassy said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- The Dutch government is assessing ways to evacuate 20 Dutch citizens from Wuhan, press agency ANP reported.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Authorities in Myanmar said they had canceled a planned evacuation of 60 students studying in Wuhan. Kyaw Yin Myint, a spokesman for the Mandalay municipal government, told Reuters a final decision had been made to send them back after 14 days, the incubation period of the virus, had passed.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">- Australia will help some citizens leave Hubei and quarantine them on Christmas Island, Prime Minister Scott Morrison said. He did not say how many of the 600 Australians registered in the Hubei region could be helped, adding Australia would also be working to help New Zealand and Pacific island citizens in Hubei.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Thu Thu Aung in Yangon, Geert De Clercq in Paris, Kaori Kaneko, Maki Shiraki and Norihiko Shirouzu in Tokyo, Reporting by William James and Elizabeth Piper in London, Inti Landauro and Emma Pinedo in Madrid; Compiled by Toby Chopra, Lisa Shumaker and Kenneth Maxwell)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-17b4c2ad" itemprop="headline"><span>China Virus Toll Passes 130 as U.S. Weighs Flight Ban</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BEIJING — The death toll from a new coronavirus in China rose sharply to 132 on Wednesday with nearly 1,500 new cases, heaping pressure on Beijing to control the disease as U.S. officials said the White House was weighing whether to suspend all flights to the country. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The White House is holding daily meetings on the outbreak and monitoring China-U.S. flights as a likely source of infections, sources briefed on the matter told Reuters, though it had decided against suspending air traffic on Tuesday. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Two U.S. officials said the administration had not taken any options off the table, however, including a temporary ban on flights, if public health data supported the move.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Fears of the spreading virus have already pushed airlines around the world to reduce flights to China and global companies to restrict employee travel to the country, while sectors from mining to luxury goods have been shaken by concerns for global growth in the event of a worst-case pandemic.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China's National Health Commission on Wednesday said the total number of deaths from the flu-like virus rose by 26 on Tuesday to 132, while the number of confirmed cases rose by 1,459 to a total of 5,974.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">New cases were also reported around the world, including Germany where four people from the same company were infected after one of them contracted it from a colleague while visiting their workplace in China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The German cases raise concerns about the human-to-human spread of the virus which can be transmitted in droplets from coughs and sneezes and has an incubation period of up to 14 days. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Known as "2019-nCoV", the newly identified coronavirus emerged late last year in Wuhan, a major transportation hub and capital of central Hubei province with a population of 11 million people. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China has since moved to lock down most of Hubei province, with a population around the same as Italy, to contain the epidemic.
