Respiratory droplets carrying the virus may then travel from the sick person to other people or surfaces.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Based on the transmission patterns seen in China and other countries, experts have expected to see some person-to-person spread in the United States, said Dr. Robert Redfield, director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. “We understand that this may be concerning,” Dr. Redfield said. “But our assessment remains that the immediate risk to the American public is low.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The disease is not spreading widely in the U.S. and people who have not had close contact with someone who recently traveled to China are unlikely to get infected.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-6a63a9b7">213 people have died. About 9,800 cases have been confirmed.</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">◆ Forty-three more deaths in China were announced early Friday, bringing the toll to 213. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">◆ Nearly 2,000 new cases were recorded in China in the past 24 hours, raising the worldwide total to nearly 9,800, according to Chinese and World Health Organization data. The vast majority of the cases are inside China; 98 cases have been confirmed in 18 other countries.<span class="css-8l6xbc evw5hdy0"> </span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">◆ Tibet has reported its first confirmed case. This means that all of China’s provinces and territories have now been touched by the outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">◆ Thailand has reported 14 cases of infection; Japan has 11; Hong Kong and Singapore have 10; Taiwan has eight; Australia, Malaysia and Macau each have seven; France and the United States have six; South Korea, Germany and the United Arab Emirates each have 4; Canada has three; Vietnam and Italy each have two; and India, the Philippines, Nepal, Cambodia, Sri Lanka and Finland each have one.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">◆ Confirming India’s first case, the government said the patient, in the southern state of Kerala, was a student at Wuhan University. It said arriving passengers with a history of travel to China were being screened at 20 airports, up from seven earlier in the week.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">◆ Cases recorded in Taiwan, Germany, Vietnam, Japan and France involved patients who had not been to China. There have been no reported deaths outside China.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-176c6ec1">As the virus spreads, so has anti-Chinese sentiment.</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The rapid spread of the coronavirus has unleashed a wave of panic and, in some cases, outright <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/30/world/asia/coronavirus-chinese-racism.html" title="">anti-Chinese sentiment across the globe</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In Japan, the hashtag #ChineseDon’tComeToJapan has been trending on Twitter.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In Singapore, tens of thousands of residents have signed a petition calling for the government to ban Chinese nationals from entering the country.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In Hong Kong, South Korea and Vietnam, businesses have posted signs saying that mainland Chinese customers are not welcome.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">And in France, a <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://twitter.com/GillesKLEIN/status/1222084973638885379/photo/1" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">front-page headline</a> in a regional newspaper warned of a “Yellow Alert.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">At a time when China’s <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/11/25/world/asia/china-world-power.html" title="">rise as a global economic and military power</a> has unsettled its neighbors in Asia as well as its rivals in the West, the coronavirus is feeding into latent bigotry against the people of mainland China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“Some of the xenophobia is likely undergirded by broader political and economic tensions and anxieties related to China, which are interacting with more recent fears of contagion,” said Kristi Govella, an assistant professor of Asian studies at the University of Hawaii, Manoa.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-5b3865e5">The effects of the outbreak are rippling through the arts world.</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">With China’s emergence as a major cultural market in recent years, the effects of the coronavirus outbreak quickly rippled through the arts world.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Boston Symphony Orchestra announced Thursday morning that it was canceling a tour of Asia that had been scheduled to begin next week. The Hong Kong Philharmonic <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.hkphil.org/concert/jaaps-beethoven-2-rudolf-buchbinder" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">called off a pair of Beethoven concerts</a> this weekend under the baton of its music director, Jaap van Zweden, who holds the same post at the New York Philharmonic, after its venue was closed. Film shoots were <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://variety.com/2020/film/news/hengdian-studios-china-coronavirus-donnie-yen-1203484260/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">shut down</a>; movie premieres<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-china-health-movie/chinese-movies-scrap-lunar-new-year-premieres-due-to-virus-outbreak-idUSKBN1ZM1KJ" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title=""> postponed</a>; a dozen concerts by the Cantopop star Andy Lau were canceled; and some <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-30/dealers-call-on-art-basel-to-cancel-hong-kong-show-on-virus-fear" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">prominent galleries</a> were calling for Art Basel Hong Kong, the prestigious international art fair scheduled for March, to be canceled.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Boston Symphony called off its tour, which was to have featured the pianist Yefim Bronfman, after learning that one of the halls it planned to play at, the Shanghai Oriental Art Center, had canceled its performances, and amid rising concerns about the spread of the virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Tours are hugely expensive undertakings for large symphony orchestras, and the Boston Symphony, which does not carry insurance for tour concert interruptions, will now begin discussions about costs with various vendors — including for its flights, cargo, and hotels — as well as with the concert presenters.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The National Symphony Orchestra, of Washington, is scheduled to perform in Beijing and Shanghai with its music director, Gianandrea Noseda, after several dates in Japan.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Gary Ginstling, the orchestra’s executive director, said that the orchestra had been conferring with government officials, presenters and medical experts as it monitors the situation. </p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-64f383bc">The U.S. commerce secretary sees a silver lining in China’s woes.</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said on Thursday that China’s loss might be America’s gain, because the coronavirus outbreak could prompt employers to move jobs to the United States.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“I don’t want to talk about a victory lap over a very unfortunate, very malignant disease,” Mr. Ross said in an interview on Fox Business. “I think it will help to accelerate the return of jobs to North America. Some to the U.S., probably some to Mexico as well.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Mr. Ross cited previous disease outbreaks in China, suggesting that a prevalence of diseases there would become a factor in businesses leaving the country and relocating to North America.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“You had SARS, you have the African swine virus there, now you have this,” Mr. Ross said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">His remarks may be seen as insensitive to a country in crisis, and he has faced such criticism in the past. During the government shutdown in early 2019, Mr. Ross suggested that furloughed workers should take out loans while they went without pay for more than a month.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"></p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-7c9a7a3d">Russia orders partial closure of its border with China and limits visas.</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Russia prepared for a partial closure of its 2,600-mile border with China as fears about the coronavirus outbreak mounted in Moscow.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Prime Minister Mikhail Mishustin on Thursday ordered 16 of the approximately 25 crossing points that Russia operates on the Chinese border to be closed as of midnight local time. He said the closures would be part of a new raft of measures to stop the infection from spreading to the country from Russia’s southeastern neighbor.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Russia’s Foreign Ministry<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.mid.ru/ru/foreign_policy/news/-/asset_publisher/cKNonkJE02Bw/content/id/4013950" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title=""> urged</a> Russians to postpone all travel to China and suspended the issuance of electronic visas for Chinese citizens.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Russian officials say that no cases of coronavirus infection have been confirmed in Russia.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“We have to do everything to protect our people,” Mr. Mishustin said in televised<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="http://government.ru/news/38878/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title=""> remarks</a> at a cabinet meeting. “We will inform everyone about the relevant actions being taken to close the border in the Far Eastern region and other measures being taken by the government.”</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-bee2170">Wuhan residents lashed out over handling of the outbreak.</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Anger and frustration have escalated in Wuhan, the center of the outbreak, as the city’s overwhelmed hospitals pleaded for urgent help to replenish diminishing supplies.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A relative of a coronavirus patient assaulted a doctor at a hospital in Wuhan, pulling and damaging the doctor’s mask and protective clothing, the state broadcaster CCTV reported on Thursday, citing the local police. The Beijing Youth Daily, a state-owned newspaper, reported that two doctors had been attacked at the hospital, including one who was threatened and had his protective gown torn off.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In the face of rising public anger, the central government has sought to present itself as intervening to hold accountable local officials in areas that have been hit hard by the epidemic.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">CCTV aired footage on Thursday showing a central government inspection team grilling officials in Huanggang, a city about 50 miles from Wuhan, about the number of beds they had set aside for coronavirus patients. As the two local health officials fumbled their responses to seemingly basic questions, the visiting inspectors’ questions took on a more impatient tone.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Unusual in its blunt portrayal of inadequate government response, the report was quickly shared on Chinese social media sites with the hashtag “one question, three don’t knows.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Officials say medical supplies are running dangerously low in central China, despite gear being delivered in bulk from around the world. The Huazhong University of Science and Technology in Wuhan wrote on Weibo, a social media platform, that the city had received 240,000 masks, 25,000 protective gowns and 4,000 pairs of medical goggles from its alumni group in Germany. The Chinese community in Singapore sent 75,000 medical masks.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Photographs posted online showed hospital workers, many still in protective gear, slumped over their desks and on the floors in exhaustion.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-74e27f0e">In eerily quiet Wuhan, few people are venturing out except for food.</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">From Chris Buckley, our chief China correspondent, on the ground in Wuhan:</em></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Since the central Chinese city of Wuhan went under official lockdown last week, most shops have shut, few cars venture onto the roads and fear has kept most people in their homes.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">When Wuhan residents do step outside, it’s mostly to the supermarkets, food stores and pharmacies that have stayed open as part of a government effort to sustain the city. Senior officials have promised that residents need not worry about supplies of vegetables, fruit or other staples, even as large swaths of the province, Hubei, are also locked down to curtail the outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Yet Wuhan residents complained about price hikes, and expressed fear that a prolonged shutdown might choke off food supplies. Poorer people, both in urban Wuhan and in the countryside, would suffer more acutely from tightening supplies.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“If we can’t bring in produce, it will become more expensive, or we might even have to close up,” said Zuo Qichao, who was selling piles of cucumbers, turnips and tomatoes. As he spoke, a woman accused him of unfairly raising the turnips’ price.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“Every county, every village around here is now putting up barriers, worried about that disease,” Mr. Zuo said. “Even if the government says it wants food guaranteed, it won’t be easy — all those road checks.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"></p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-7bfdc01">Anger in Taiwan as China refuses its evacuation request.</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In Taiwan, anger has been growing over China’s refusal this week to let Taiwan evacuate about 300 of its people from Wuhan, even as it has given the United States, Japan and other countries permission to do so.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China’s ruling Communist Party considers Taiwan, a democratically governed island, to be part of China, and the two sides have no formal ties. Referring to the rebuffed evacuation request on Tuesday, Ma Xiaoguang, a spokesman for China’s Taiwan Affairs Office, said in a statement that Taiwanese people in Hubei Province, which includes Wuhan, were receiving “appropriate care.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Kolas Yotaka, a spokeswoman for Taiwan’s government, said China was prioritizing politics over lives. Many of the Taiwanese seeking evacuation from Wuhan were tourists or on business trips, while others were residents of the city who suffered from chronic diseases, Ms. Kolas said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“We call on the Chinese government to demonstrate basic humanity and agree to our request as soon as possible,” she said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">As part of its campaign to isolate Taiwan diplomatically, China has blocked it from participating in international bodies like the World Health Organization — a fact that has also angered Taiwanese people this week, as they try to prepare along with the rest of the world for the possibility of a worsening epidemic.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"></p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-3fb43dad">Investors dump stocks and buy gold on coronavirus fears.</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Fears that a fast-moving virus in China could impact the global economy drove investors in Asia to dump stocks on Thursday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Money fled riskier assets like stocks and oil and flowed instead into investments that are considered safe havens, like gold, as growing numbers of policymakers, economists and corporate executives sounded alarms. Major benchmarks across the region fell by more than 1 percent.<span class="css-8l6xbc evw5hdy0"> </span>China’s markets remain closed for an extended holiday until Feb. 3.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Brent crude oil, the international benchmark, hit its lowest price this year before paring some of its losses. It was trading at about $59 a barrel. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">European markets finished higher, and the S&amp;P 500 closed up 0.3 percent. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A growing number of companies have<span class="css-8l6xbc evw5hdy0"> </span>warned they <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/business/china-coronavirus-economy.html" title="">will have to close or shift operations</a> and could take a financial hit from widespread business disruptions in China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"></p>, <p class="css-jwz2nf etfikam0">Reporting was contributed by Russell Goldman, Austin Ramzy, Tiffany May, Elaine Yu, Alexandra Stevenson, Motoko Rich, Christopher Buckley, Anton Troianovski, Isabella Kwai, Chris Horton, Megan Specia, Christopher Cameron, Makiko Inoue, Daisuke Wakabayashi, Karen Weise, Iliana Magra, Elisabetta Povoledo, Mike Isaac, Knvul Sheikh, Roni Caryn Rabin, Donald G. McNeil Jr., Karen Zraick and Neil Vigdor. Elsie Chen, Zoe Mou, Albee Zhang, Amber Wang, Yiwei Wang and Claire Fu contributed research.</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <h1 class="css-1s4ffep e1h9rw200" id="link-4829353e" itemprop="headline"><span>Wall St. Shrugs Off Risks Related to Viral Outbreak in China</span></h1>, <p class="css-1ifw933 e1wiw3jv0" id="article-summary">Global stocks fell as economists revised their outlooks on the impact of the virus, but the S&amp;P 500 was up slightly by the end of the day.</p>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/alexandra-stevenson"><span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Alexandra Stevenson</span></a> and <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/matt-phillips"><span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Matt Phillips</span></a></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Wall Street shook off growing fears that a mysterious and fast-moving virus in China could hurt the global economy, even as international markets were hit by those concerns on Thursday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">After an early decline, the S&amp;P 500 staged an afternoon rally to close 0.3 percent higher. The market was buttressed by strong earnings from blue-chip companies including Microsoft, Coca-Cola and Hershey as well as a rally in financial shares.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In recent days, the global economic outlook has darkened in the face of the expanding outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The vast majority of people infected by coronavirus are in China, but governments around the world are taking steps to contain the disease, and the risk to investors is that those efforts dampen economic activity. Russia closed part of its 2,600-mile border with China on Thursday, and a number of countries have <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/30/world/asia/coronavirus-china.html?action=click&amp;module=Top%20Stories&amp;pgtype=Homepage#link-3daeee32" title="">discouraged their citizens from traveling there</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A growing number of companies have warned that they <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/business/china-coronavirus-economy.html" title="">will have to close or shift operations</a> and could take a financial hit from widespread business disruptions in China. Several others say it is too early to tell what the impact will be.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Overnight, investors fled riskier assets like stocks and oil and turned instead to investments that are considered safe havens like gold and Treasury bonds. Major benchmarks in Europe and Asia were down more than 1 percent. Prices for key industrial raw materials such as crude oil, copper and iron ore all fell.</p>, <h1 class="g-headline" id="g-inlineguide-headline">The Coronavirus Outbreak</h1>, <h2 class="g-inlineguide-list-header g-optimize-type">What do you need to know? Start here.</h2>, <p class="g-inlineguide-date">Updated Feb. 10, 2020</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“What you’ll see take place is a significant further slowdown in Chinese economic growth, and Chinese growth has been so important,” said Edward Alden, a senior fellow at the Council on Foreign Relations. “You’re already seeing this in commodities prices.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In the bond markets, yields on longer-term United States government securities fell below those on shorter-term Treasury bills, an unusual situation known as an inversion that is considered <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/06/25/business/what-is-yield-curve-recession-prediction.html" title="">one of the more reliable indicators of economic recession</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“An inversion suggests the market is sniffing out some future trouble, and is a well-known signal in financial circles (and so gets a lot of attention, which can affect confidence),” Don Rissmiller, chief economist at Strategas Research, wrote in a research note spotlighting the phenomenon.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But Wall Street’s recovery suggests that investors still doubt global woes will wash up on American shores. And they seem to have little reason to worry. The American labor market remains strong, and growth, while unspectacular, has been steady.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">On Thursday, the Commerce Department reported that <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/30/business/economy/gdp-numbers.html" title="">the American economy grew at a 2.1 percent annual rate</a> from October to December, the same as the previous three months.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Even if a virus-related slump did hit, the stock market in the United States has shown a knack for shrugging off inconvenient issues in recent years.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Stocks rose 28.9 percent in 2019 despite a sharp slowdown in profit growth, a wobbly global economy, and the noisy trade war between the United States and China, the world’s two largest economies.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Much of those gains were driven by actions taken by the Federal Reserve, which in January last year swiveled away from plans to lift rates and later cut rates three times.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">There are some indications that markets are beginning to price in the growing odds of Fed rate cuts this year. In recent weeks, the market-based probability — derived from prices in the Fed funds futures market — of a rate cut at the Fed’s June meeting jumped to roughly 40 percent from 15 percent, according <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.cmegroup.com/trading/interest-rates/countdown-to-fomc.html" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">to data from CME</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In part, that could reflect investor confidence that the Fed would respond if the growing outbreak in China truly did threaten the outlook for economic growth.</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-265f1f01" itemprop="headline"><span>Latest on the Coronavirus Spreading in China and Beyond</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Reuters) - A coronavirus outbreak that began in Wuhan, the capital of China's central province of Hubei, has spread to more than 8,100 people globally, surpassing the total from the 2002-2003 SARS epidemic. The new virus has killed 170 people.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Here is what we know:</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">** By Thursday, the death toll in China had risen to 170. Another 8,100 people across the world had been infected.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">** There are 104 confirmed cases of infection outside mainland China, including 14 cases in Thailand, 11 in Japan, 10 in Hong Kong and Singapore, eight in Taiwan, seven in Macau, Australia and Malaysia and five in the United States and France. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">** No deaths have been reported outside China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The previously unknown coronavirus strain is believed to have emerged late last year from illegally traded wildlife at a market in Wuhan, a city of 11 million.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">** The World Health Organisation will meet on Thursday to decide whether its rapid spread amounts to a global health emergency. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">** Several Chinese cities have levied strict travel curbs.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Global airlines have suspended or scaled back direct flights to China's major cities. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">** Countries including Australia, Canada, France, Germany, Indonesia, Italy, Japan, Singapore, South Korea and the United States are working to evacuate citizens from Wuhan or have already started.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">** Nearly 200 evacuated Americans arrived at a U.S. military base in California to be isolated for at least 72 hours.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">** Three Japanese evacuated on a government-chartered flight proved to be infected, including two who had not shown symptoms.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">** The Chinese Football Association said it would postpone domestic games in 2020.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">** The World Athletics Indoor Championships scheduled in the Chinese city of Nanjing in March have been postponed until 2021.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">** Alphabet Inc's Google and Sweden's IKEA said they were temporarily shutting all offices and stores in China over the outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">** Some experts believe the virus is not as dangerous as the 2002-03 Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) that killed nearly 800 people, or the Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS), which has killed more than 700 people since 2012. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Compiled by Stephen Coates; Editing by Clarence Fernandez and Nick Macfie)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-45100632" itemprop="headline"><span>France Confirms Fifth Case of Infection With Coronavirus</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">PARIS — France has confirmed a fifth case of infection by the new coronavirus from China, the French health minister said on Wednesday, adding the patient was the daughter of an 80-year-old man already hospitalized with the disease.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Agnes Buzyn also said the first flight, which will later repatriate French nationals from the Chinese town of Wuhan - the epicentre of the virus - would depart France for China later on Wednesday, with a second flight to follow on Thursday or Friday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">France confirmed its first three cases of the Wuhan coronavirus on Friday, and a fourth case on Tuesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We now have five cases, out of which two are under surveillance," Buzyn said at a press conference.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The virus has killed more than 130 people and sickened more than 6,000, the vast majority of them in China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Benoit Van Overstraeten; Editing by Christian Lowe and Bernadette Baum)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-a770eac" itemprop="headline"><span>Factbox: Latest on the Coronavirus Spreading in China and Beyond</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Reuters) - A coronavirus outbreak that began in Wuhan, the capital of China's central province of Hubei, has spread to more than 9,800 people globally, surpassing the total from the 2002-2003 SARS epidemic. The new virus has killed 213 people.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Here is what we know:</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">*There are 129 confirmed cases in 22 countries and regions outside mainland China, including Australia, France, Germany, Hong Kong, Japan, Thailand and the United States.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">*No deaths have been reported outside China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">*The World Health Organization declared the outbreak a public health emergency of international concern on Thursday. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">*The United States reported its first case of person-to-person transmission. Germany, Japan, Vietnam and South Korea have also recorded similar transmissions, which suggest greater potential for the virus to spread.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">*Several Chinese cities have levied strict travel curbs.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">*The U.S. State Department told Americans in an updated travel advisory not to travel to China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">*Global airlines have suspended or scaled back direct flights to China's major cities. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">*Countries including Australia, Canada, France, Germany, Indonesia, Italy, Japan, Singapore, South Korea and the United States are working to evacuate citizens from Wuhan or have already started.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">*A charter flight carrying 367 South Koreans from Wuhan landed in Seoul, after protests broke out against plans to use facilities in Asan and Jincheon south of the capital to quarantine the evacuees.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">*China will release winter and spring vegetable reserves in major northern cities to ease supply shortages amid the new coronavirus outbreak, state news agency Xinhua reported.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">*The Chinese Football Association said it would postpone domestic games in 2020.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">*The World Athletics Indoor Championships scheduled in the Chinese city of Nanjing in March have been postponed until 2021.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">*The coronavirus should have little impact on the U.S. economy, President Donald Trump's chief economic adviser said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">*Some experts believe the virus is not as dangerous as the 2002-03 Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) that killed nearly 800 people, or the Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS), which has killed more than 700 people since 2012.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Compiled by Stephen Coates; Editing by Bill Berkrot and Christopher Cushing)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-7f44e00b" itemprop="headline"><span>Two First Coronavirus Cases Confirmed in Italy: Prime Minister</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">ROME — Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte on Thursday said there were two confirmed cases of coronavirus in Italy, the first two in the country since the emergency exploded.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Conte said Italy had closed air traffic to and from China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We have two confirmed cases of coronavirus in Italy," the prime minister told a news conference, adding two Chinese tourist from China had contracted the virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">On Thursday, the World Health Organization declared that the coronavirus epidemic in China now constitutes a global public health emergency.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Angelo Amante and Elvira Pollina; Editing by Sandra Maler)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-7f44e00b" itemprop="headline"><span>Two First Coronavirus Cases Confirmed in Italy: Prime Minister</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">ROME — Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte on Thursday said there were two confirmed cases of coronavirus in Italy, the first two in the country since the emergency exploded.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Conte said Italy had closed air traffic to and from China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We have two confirmed cases of coronavirus in Italy," the prime minister told a news conference, adding two Chinese tourist from China had contracted the virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">On Thursday, the World Health Organization declared that the coronavirus epidemic in China now constitutes a global public health emergency.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Angelo Amante and Elvira Pollina; Editing by Sandra Maler)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-3e16bae0" itemprop="headline"><span>China Halts Domestic Soccer to Contain Coronavirus Spread</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">SHANGHAI — The Chinese Football Association (CFA) said on Thursday it is postponing all domestic games due to the rapidly spreading coronavirus epidemic as the total number of confirmed deaths from the newly identified pathogen in the country rose to 170.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Chinese health authorities said there were 7,711 confirmed cases of infection as of the end of Wednesday, mostly in Hubei province, while infections have been reported in at least 15 other countries.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The virus has had a major impact on China's sporting landscape, with several events canceled and the country's Olympic women's soccer team quarantined in Australia.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">On Thursday, the CFA said in a statement on its website that football games at all levels would be postponed in order to help control the virus spread.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"The Chinese Football Association will continue to maintain close communication with national authorities ... and make reasonable adjustments to the organization, schedule and scale of matches where necessary," it said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Chinese women's soccer team had traveled to Australia to play in an Olympic qualifying tournament but will remain quarantined in a Brisbane hotel.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Queensland Chief Health Officer Jeannette Young said the players were healthy and being checked every day.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Several members of the local Chinese communities have canceled Lunar New Year celebrations following the outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"I thank the Chinese community for their proactive response for how they’ve dealt with this," Young said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Olympic tournament had originally been scheduled to be held in Wuhan, where the virus is believed to have originated, before it was switched to Nanjing and later transferred out of China to Sydney.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Chinese team, who were scheduled to play their first match on Feb. 3, arrived in Brisbane on Wednesday and have been told to remain in their hotel rooms until Feb. 5.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Late on Wednesday, the World Athletics Indoor Championships, scheduled to take place in Nanjing in March, was postponed until 2021 over fears related to the coronavirus outbreak, the sport's governing body said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The governing bodies of several other sports, including skiing, badminton, tennis and basketball, have also been forced into rearranging events, weighing possible changes or monitoring the implications of the outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Amlan Chakraborty in New Delhi; Additional reporting by Reporting by Samuel Shen and David Stanway; Editing by Shri Navaratnam/Peter Rutherford)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-5044684" itemprop="headline"><span>Anti-China Sentiment Spreads Abroad Along With Coronavirus</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">JAKARTA/HANOI — The coronavirus outbreak has stoked a wave of anti-China sentiment around the globe, from shops barring entry to Chinese tourists, online vitriol mocking the country's exotic meat trade and surprise health checks on foreign workers.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The virus, which originated in China, has spread to more than a dozen countries, many of them in Southeast Asia which has sensitive relations with China amid concerns about Beijing's vast infrastructure spending and political clout in the region and sovereignty disputes in the South China Sea.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But as far away as France, a newspaper has come under fire for its "Yellow Alert" headline, echoing a historic Western racist term "Yellow Peril" used to sow fear of Asian influence, while authorities and schools in Toronto, Canada, have warned against discrimination against Chinese Canadians.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Orientalist assumptions plus political distrust plus health concerns are a pretty powerful combination," said Charlotte Setijadi, and anthropologist who teaches at Singapore Management University.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Chinese authorities have said the virus emerged from a market selling illegally traded wildlife, giving rise to widespread social media mocking of China's demand for exotic delicacies and ingredients for traditional medicine.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Stop eating bats," said one Twitter user in Thailand, the top destination for Chinese tourists. "Not surprising that the Chinese are making new diseases," another Thai user posted alongside a video clip that showed a man eating raw meat. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China's foreign ministry did not immediately respond to a faxed request for comment. China has said the virus outbreak should not be politicized.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Because your country is beginning (to) spread disease...we do not accept to serve the guest from China," read a sign in English outside the Danang Riverside hotel in the central Vietnamese city of the same name. Authorities later told the hotel to remove the sign, its manager said in a Facebook post. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Vietnam, which was under Chinese occupation centuries ago and contests Beijing's sweeping maritime claims in the South China Sea, has particularly fraught relations with China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But it is not alone in the region.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Over 60% of respondents to a poll of Southeast Asian officials, academics and other professionals said in a survey this month that they distrusted China. Nearly 40% said they thought China was "a revisionist power and intends to turn Southeast Asia into its sphere of influence". The survey did not mention the virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">TRAVEL BANS</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Many countries have imposed visa restrictions on travelers from Hubei province - the epicenter of the virus - while some airlines have suspended all direct flights to mainland China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But this is not enough for hundreds of thousands of people in South Korea and Malaysia who have signed online petitions urging authorities to ban Chinese from visiting their countries.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In an unusual move, Samal Island in the southern Philippines on Thursday banned not just tourists from China but from all countries affected by the coronavirus to the popular beach spot. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China's boom in outbound tourism has created a pattern of international travel unprecedented in human history and driven the growth of businesses to serve Chinese travelers around the world. From a trickle in the 1980s, Chinese tourist numbers grew to estimates of more than 160 million in 2019.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But earlier this week, a group of Chinese tourists in Padang, in Indonesia's West Sumatra, were met by locals holding a banner that read: "We, the West Sumatran Communities, reject the visit of Chinese tourists."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In Myanmar, officials launched surprise health checks on Chinese workers in the northwestern Sagaing region after a local lawmaker accused them of spreading the virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Aung May Yee, a regional MP, posted on Facebook that five cars filled with Chinese workers had arrived at a copper mining project near Letpadaung town from across the border and it was her "national duty" to alert authorities.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"At first, I suspected that they are coming illegally and hiding in there because of the virus," she told Reuters by phone, adding that checks had found they were traveling on legitimate documentation and had no symptoms of illness.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Stanley Widianto in Jakarta, Khanh Vu and Phuong Nguyen in Hanoi, Chayut Setboonsarng in Bangkok, Karen Lema in Manila, Thu Thu Aung in Yangon, Joseph Sipalan in Kuala Lumpur and Josh Smith in Seoul; Writing by John Geddie in Singapore; Editing by Nick Macfie)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-6367b3a9" itemprop="headline"><span>Factobox: Commodity Market Impact From the Coronavirus in China</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">SINGAPORE — A new coronavirus that has killed 170 people in China and spread to over a dozen other countries has roiled global commodity markets, raising fears of weaker demand and disrupting raw material supply chains in the world's most populous country.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">All but around 100 of the nearly 8,000 cases so far identified have been in mainland China, but the virus has caused global alarm because it is still too early to know how dangerous it is and how easily it spreads among people.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The World Health Organisation will meet on Thursday to decide whether its rapid spread amounts to a global health emergency.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">WHAT COMMODITY MARKETS BEEN IMPACTED MOST?</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Oil prices slumped to 3-month lows this week in response to the widening spread of the virus in China, the world's top oil importer, prompting OPEC to look to extend current oil output cuts until at least June from March, as well as consider deeper cuts if oil demand is badly hit. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China is the second-largest oil refiner and a critical growth engine for the global economy, so any material contraction in Chinese economic activity is expected to have far-reaching repercussions across several industries. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The aviation sector was a high-profile coronavirus casualty, with scores of flights to and from China cancelled this week.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Jet fuel prices and production margins in Asia slumped in response, hurting refiners and fuel exporters.. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Greatly reduced mobility within China also hit gasoline demand, with Asia's benchmark gasoline price falling the most in four years on Tuesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">OTHER COMMODITY MARKETS AFFECTED</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Palm oil prices slumped as much as 10% on Tuesday as traders reacted to the widening shutdowns of offices, malls and factories within China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Palm oil is used mainly in food courts and by catering companies in China, the second-largest palm importer behind India, so reduced consumption is expected over the near to medium term.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Graphic: Commodities prices under pressure as China grapples with the coronavirus link: https://fingfx.thomsonreuters.com/gfx/ce/7/8311/8292/CoronavirusCommodities.png)</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Base metals have also taken a hit as manufacturing plants and factories take protracted Lunar New Year breaks while they assess the fallout from the virus. Toyota Motor Corp and other firms announced extended plant shutdowns.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Industrial bellwether copper fell to near a fourth-month on Thursday and was set for an 11th straight session of losses on fears of an economic slowdown in the world's top metals consumer.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Commodities futures exchanges have also remained shut longer than planned due to the virus, with the Shanghai Futures Exchange (ShFE) and Dalian Commodity Exchange (DCE) announcing extended closures.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Safe haven gold has won some support during a time of uncertainty, hitting a three-week high early in the week, and analysts expect the precious metal to remain bid while worries about the virus persist.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Writing by Gavin Maguire; editing by Richard Pullin)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-642e57e" itemprop="headline"><span>Factbox: Commodity Market Impact From the Coronavirus in China</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">SINGAPORE — A new coronavirus that has killed 170 people in China and spread to over a dozen other countries has roiled global commodity markets, raising fears of weaker demand and disrupting raw material supply chains in the world's most populous country.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">All but around 100 of the nearly 8,000 cases so far identified have been in mainland China, but the virus has caused global alarm because it is still too early to know how dangerous it is and how easily it spreads among people.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The World Health Organisation will meet on Thursday to decide whether its rapid spread amounts to a global health emergency.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">WHAT COMMODITY MARKETS BEEN IMPACTED MOST?</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Oil prices slumped to 3-month lows this week in response to the widening spread of the virus in China, the world's top oil importer, prompting OPEC to look to extend current oil output cuts until at least June from March, as well as consider deeper cuts if oil demand is badly hit. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China is the second-largest oil refiner and a critical growth engine for the global economy, so any material contraction in Chinese economic activity is expected to have far-reaching repercussions across several industries. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The aviation sector was a high-profile coronavirus casualty, with scores of flights to and from China cancelled this week.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Jet fuel prices and production margins in Asia slumped in response, hurting refiners and fuel exporters.. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Greatly reduced mobility within China also hit gasoline demand, with Asia's benchmark gasoline price falling the most in four years on Tuesday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">OTHER COMMODITY MARKETS AFFECTED</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Palm oil prices slumped as much as 10% on Tuesday as traders reacted to the widening shutdowns of offices, malls and factories within China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Palm oil is used mainly in food courts and by catering companies in China, the second-largest palm importer behind India, so reduced consumption is expected over the near to medium term.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Base metals have also taken a hit as manufacturing plants and factories take protracted Lunar New Year breaks while they assess the fallout from the virus. Toyota Motor Corp and other firms announced extended plant shutdowns.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Industrial bellwether copper fell to near a fourth-month on Thursday and was set for an 11th straight session of losses on fears of an economic slowdown in the world's top metals consumer.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Commodities futures exchanges have also remained shut longer than planned due to the virus, with the Shanghai Futures Exchange (ShFE) and Dalian Commodity Exchange (DCE) announcing extended closures.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Safe haven gold has won some support during a time of uncertainty, hitting a three-week high early in the week, and analysts expect the precious metal to remain bid while worries about the virus persist.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">For a graphic on Commodities prices under pressure as China grapples with the coronavirus:</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">https://fingfx.thomsonreuters.com/gfx/ce/7/8311/8292/CoronavirusCommodities.png</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Writing by Gavin Maguire; editing by Richard Pullin)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <h1 class="css-1s4ffep e1h9rw200" id="link-a24b782" itemprop="headline"><span>Impeachment, Coronavirus, Brexit: Your Thursday Briefing</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/christopher-stanford"><span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Chris Stanford</span></a></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s the <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/morning-briefing" title="">sign-up</a>.)</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">Good morning.</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">We’re covering <strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">the 16-hour Q. and A. session</strong> at President Trump’s impeachment trial, <strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Britain’s withdrawal</strong> from the European Union, and Americans’ <strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">increasing life expectancy</strong>.</p>, <p class="css-fi6ht2 e6idgb70">Developing</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Russia signaled that it was planning to <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/30/world/asia/coronavirus-china.html" title="">close its 2,600-mile border with China</a> amid fears about the coronavirus outbreak.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-6b8d1e44">Republicans push for a speedy end to trial</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Senator Mitch McConnell, the majority leader, and other Republicans sound increasingly confident that <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/us/politics/trump-impeachment.html" title="">they have the votes needed to block witnesses</a> and bring President Trump’s impeachment trial to an end as soon as Friday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">They’ve offered multiple rationales for refusing fresh testimony, but <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/us/politics/republicans-impeachment-witnesses.html" title="">our chief Washington correspondent says</a> that Republicans are worried that hearing from John Bolton, the former national security adviser, would lead to a cascade of other witnesses. That would tie up the Senate indefinitely when Mr. Trump’s acquittal is not in doubt.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">On Wednesday, the Senate began a two-day question-and-answer session with the House impeachment managers and the president’s legal team. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/us/politics/impeachment-trial-trump.html" title="">Here are six takeaways</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Closer look:</strong> One of Mr. Trump’s lawyers, Alan Dershowitz, offered a strikingly broad defense, arguing that a president cannot be removed from office for actions to improve re-election prospects if he believes his re-election is in the national interest.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“Every public official I know believes that his election is in the public interest,” Mr. Dershowitz said. “Mostly, you’re right.” Our congressional editor <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/30/podcasts/the-latest-impeachment-alan-dershowitz.html" title="">discussed his comments on The Latest</a>, our podcast about the impeachment investigation.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">What’s next:</strong> <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2020/trump-impeachment-trial-01-30" title="">Here’s what to expect</a> when the trial resumes at 1 p.m. Eastern today. A vote on whether to hear from new witnesses is expected on Friday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Another angle:</strong> The White House has said it reviewed a draft of Mr. Bolton’s coming book, but Mr. Trump’s lawyers insisted on Wednesday that they were <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/us/politics/bolton-book-classified.html" title="">unaware that it contradicted the president’s impeachment defense</a>.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-5cff1037">Rushing to halt the spread of the coronavirus</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A World Health Organization committee is set to meet for the second time in a week to decide whether the outbreak is a global health emergency. Today’s meeting comes as the number of confirmed cases surpassed 7,700 worldwide, most of them in China. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/30/world/asia/coronavirus-china.html" title="">Here are the latest updates</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">More than a dozen countries, including the U.S., are <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/health/china-coronavirus-outbreak.html" title="">isolating patients and screening travelers from China</a>. Nobody has died from the disease outside mainland China, where the death toll rose today to 170.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Closer look: </strong>The outbreak is a reminder of how dependent the world’s economy is on China, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/business/china-coronavirus-economy.html" title="">our business correspondent in Hong Kong writes</a>. Global brands including Ford, Ikea and Starbucks are shutting down factories and stores, while Apple is rerouting supply chains.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Related:</strong> Public health experts in the U.S. fear that <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/health/coronavirus-masks-hoarding.html" title="">the hoarding of surgical masks</a> could raise the risk of a domestic outbreak. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/article/what-is-coronavirus.html" title="">Our guide to the virus includes safety tips</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">The Daily:</strong> <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/thedaily" title="">Today’s episode</a> is about the virus.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-43330917">Brexit is finally happening</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Britain is scheduled to formally withdraw from the European Union on Friday, after more than three years of confusion, political division and missed deadlines.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/business/brexit-scotland-trade-eu.html" title="">a potentially volatile new chapter</a> — in which London and Brussels try to hash out a trade deal by the end of the year — is just beginning.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Go deeper:</strong> While Brexit has produced some unity among the 27 other European Union members, it stands to weaken the bloc’s diplomatic clout and highlight internal divisions, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/world/europe/brexit-brussels-eu.html" title="">our senior diplomatic correspondent in Europe writes</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Quotable:</strong> “It’s a defeat for everyone — for the European project, for Britain’s position in the world and for American interests, since the U.S. was the beneficiary of Britain in the E.U.,” said Ian Lesser, a former American diplomat.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-8d8a5ea">Which Democrat agrees with you most?</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">As primary season begins, you might be unsure which presidential candidate best matches your views and priorities.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">To help, we’ve produced <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/01/30/us/politics/democratic-presidential-candidates-quiz.html" title="">a 10-question quiz</a> to determine the Democratic hopeful with whom you most align.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Closer look:</strong> Joe Biden has highlighted his work during the Obama administration to help widen access to health care and revive the economy. But to many labor union officials, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/30/business/economy/joe-biden-labor-unions.html" title="">those years were a disappointment</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Another angle:</strong> Iowa State University <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/30/us/iowa-caucus-chalking.html" title="">has prohibited political slogans written in chalk</a> on sidewalks after students complained that the messages had become discriminatory and divisive. A group has sued the school, saying the ban violates the First Amendment.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Related:</strong> Michael Bloomberg’s presidential campaign <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/30/us/politics/bloomberg-super-bowl-ad.html" title="">released an $11 million ad today</a> that will promote his record on gun control. The 60-second commercial is scheduled to air during the Super Bowl.</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-fdfe371">If you have some time, this is worth it</h3>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-7a77b9fe">Loyal to China, but locked up anyway</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">From Beijing’s perspective, Zulhumar Isaac, above, a Uighur woman from the region of Xinjiang, grew up in a model ethnic-minority family: Her mother was a Communist Party cadre, and her father worked at a newspaper that toed the official line.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But when President Xi Jinping’s government began cracking down on Uighurs, her parents were detained. Our writer spent nearly a year documenting <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/magazine/uyghur-muslims-china.html" title="">her effort to get them back</a>.</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-554e6082">Here’s what else is happening</h3>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Living longer:</strong> Life expectancy for Americans <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/30/us/us-life-expectancy.html" title="">has increased for the first time in four years</a>, the government reported today. After a decline driven by a surge in drug overdoses, the benchmark rose to 78.7 years in 2018.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">New York’s crumbling facades:</strong> Scaffolding surrounds about 1,400 buildings in the city because of safety concerns. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/30/nyregion/nyc-scaffolding-building-facades.html" title="">An investigation by The Times</a> found that landlords flout laws on building exteriors and ignore enforcement, including $31 million in fines.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Get crackin’: </strong>A sculpture outside C.I.A. headquarters contains an encrypted message that hasn’t been fully decoded for almost 30 years. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/01/29/climate/kryptos-sculpture-final-clue.html" title="">Its creator has offered a new clue</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Snapshot: </strong>Above, the surface of the sun, pictured by a telescope in Hawaii. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/science/daniel-inouye-solar-telescope-pictures.html" title="">The high-resolution image released on Wednesday</a> revealed cell-like “kernels,” each about the size of Texas, that carry heat from inside the sun to the outside.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Late-night comedy: </strong>At the impeachment trial, senators have to submit questions written on a card. “It looks like the card you fill out before singing karaoke,” <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/30/arts/television/trevor-noah-late-night-impeachment-bolton.html" title="">Jimmy Fallon said</a>.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">What we’re reading: </strong><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.thecut.com/2020/01/does-dopamine-fasting-work.html" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">This account of an attempt to do the Silicon Valley dopamine fast</a> in The Cut. Melina Delkic of the Briefings team calls it “hilarious and weird,” adding, “I’m not sure what I just read, but I liked it.”</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-7ded7ef4">Now, a break from the news</h3>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Cook: </strong>There’s only one rule for <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://cooking.nytimes.com/recipes/1020775-cheesy-cornbread-muffins-with-hot-honey-butter" title="">cheesy cornbread muffins</a>: Don’t overmix.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Watch: </strong>We spoke to <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/movies/george-mackay-1917-trench-run.html" title="">the actor George MacKay</a> about how he pulled off the thrilling final run in the film “1917.”</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Read:</strong> “A Very Stable Genius,” by the Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists Philip Rucker and Carol Leonnig, is a No. 1 debut on our <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/books/best-sellers/hardcover-nonfiction/2020/02/09" title="">hardcover nonfiction</a> and <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/books/best-sellers/combined-print-and-e-book-nonfiction/2020/02/09" title="">combined print and e-book nonfiction</a> best-seller lists.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Smarter Living: </strong>Not everyone develops social skills as a child. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/23/smarter-living/adults-guide-to-social-skills.html" title="">Here’s a primer for adults</a>.</p>, <h3 class="css-1b8te77 e1gnsphs0" id="link-15767e9b">And now for the Back Story on …</h3>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-549b5492">Gandhi’s mantle</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">Today is the 72nd anniversary of the death of Mohandas Gandhi, who helped win India’s independence from Britain with a campaign of nonviolence and who enshrined protections for all religions. Protesters </em><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/30/world/asia/india-gandhi-modi-citizenship.html" title=""><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">challenging Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s Hindu-nationalist agenda</em></a><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0"> have been evoking Gandhi’s legacy — </em><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/02/opinion/modi-mahatma-gandhi.html" title=""><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">as has Mr. Modi</em></a><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">. </em><a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://twitter.com/Abihabib" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title=""><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">Maria Abi-Habib</em></a><em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">, a South Asia correspondent for The Times, spoke with Mike Ives of the Briefings team about the clash.</em></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">How have the protests changed since they started a few months ago?</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">They’re <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/24/world/asia/india-protests-modi.html" title="">a lot broader</a>. It’s not just Muslims or a bunch of liberal students, it’s people who see the India that Gandhi built, one of secularism and religious coexistence, giving way to a government that is bent on a sectarian narrative at a time when the economy is sputtering.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Do any scenes spring to mind?</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Some protesters held a placard that read: “Dear Hindus, We rejected an Islamic state in 1947. Now it’s your turn to reject a Hindu state. Sincerely, Secular India.” That really spoke to me because 1947 was the partition, when Hindus in Pakistan decided to stay or flee to India, and Muslims in India had a similar choice.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">India chose secularism in 1947. It was majority Hindu and said its strength was its diversity, and that it would embrace Christians and Muslims and Sikhs just as much as its Hindu citizens.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Why is one protest in particular — a highway sit-in by Muslim women in New Delhi’s Shaheen Bagh neighborhood — seen as so significant?</strong></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Over all, India’s Muslim community has not been well organized in recent decades, but <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/04/world/asia/india-protests-modi-citizenship.html" title="">these protests have mobilized it</a>. Shaheen Bagh has become a symbol of that. And women’s place in Indian Muslim homes has tended to be a conservative stereotype: They don’t come onto the streets, they don’t protest, they don’t mobilize. So Shaheen Bagh has really changed the game.</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">That’s it for this briefing. See you next time.</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">— Chris</p>, <p class="css-jwz2nf etfikam0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Thank you</strong><br/>Mark Josephson, Eleanor Stanford and Chris Harcum provided the break from the news. You can reach the team at <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="mailto:briefing@nytimes.com" title="">briefing@nytimes.com</a>. </p>, <p class="css-jwz2nf etfikam0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">P.S.</strong><br/>• We’re listening to “<a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/thedaily" title="">The Daily</a>.” Today’s episode is about the coronavirus outbreak.<br/>• Here’s today’s <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/crosswords/game/mini" title="">Mini Crossword</a>, and a clue: Highly capable (five letters). <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/crosswords" title="">You can find all our puzzles here</a>.<br/>• <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/business/media/ben-smith-buzzfeed-new-york-times.html" title="">The Times has named Ben Smith</a>, the editor in chief of BuzzFeed, as its next media columnist.</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <h1 class="css-1s4ffep e1h9rw200" id="link-7c8bb0d3" itemprop="headline"><span>Brexit, Coronavirus, Huawei: Your Thursday Briefing</span></h1>, <p class="css-1ifw933 e1wiw3jv0" id="article-summary">Here’s what you need to know.</p>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Sofia Mitra-Thakur</span> and <a class="css-brehiz e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/mike-ives"><span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Mike Ives</span></a></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s the <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/morning-briefing" title="">sign-up</a>.</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">Good morning.</p>, <p class="css-ma92ss evys1bk0">We’re looking ahead to <strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Brexit day,</strong> a World Health Organization decision on the <strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Wuhan coronavirus</strong> and Mike Pompeo’s <strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">trip to Ukraine</strong>.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-2b27bea1">Brexit’s happening. Now for the hard part.</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">European legislators on Wednesday approved the terms of Britain’s withdrawal from the European Union. It will formally take place on Friday at midnight, Brussels time, bringing three and a half years of confusion and political fighting to an end.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/business/brexit-scotland-trade-eu.html" title="">a potentially volatile new chapter</a> — in which London and Brussels try to hash out a trade deal during a transition period that lasts only until the end of 2020 — is just beginning.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">And<strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10"> </strong>while Brexit has produced some unity among the remaining 27 E.U. nations, <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/world/europe/brexit-brussels-eu.html" title="">our chief diplomatic correspondent in Europe writes</a>, it also weakens the bloc’s diplomatic clout and highlights its internal divisions (between France and Germany, for example).</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Looking ahead: </strong>Momentum is gathering for another independence vote in Scotland. An electorate that opposed leaving the E.U. worries that prolonged trade talks could hurt Scottish industries intertwined with the global supply chain.</p>, <h2 class="css-3ez4hu eoo0vm40" id="link-2ef6da8c">W.H.O. to assess coronavirus outbreak (again)</h2>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A World Health Organization committee plans to meet in Geneva today — for the second time in a week — to decide whether the Wuhan coronavirus epidemic is a global health emergency. <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/30/world/asia/coronavirus-china.html" title="">Here’s the latest.</a></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The death toll in China rose overnight to 170, up from 132, the government said this morning. Infections worldwide jumped to 7,711 from about 6,000 on Wednesday, according to the W.H.O. and Chinese officials.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"><strong class="css-8qgvsz ebyp5n10">Context: </strong>No one outside mainland China has died from the disease.
