[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-4b003e3c" itemprop="headline"><span>Kudlow Says Jobs, Trade Not Part of U.S. Coronavirus Briefings</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">WASHINGTON — White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow on Thursday said the impact of the fast-moving coronavirus on jobs and trade between the United States and China has not been part of U.S. discussions with President Donald Trump on the outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Kudlow, speaking to reporters at the White House, also separately said people should not fly to China unless it was absolutely essential but that the Trump administration for now was leaving it to U.S. airlines to voluntarily curb flights. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Alexandra Alper; writing by Susan Heavey; Editing by Chizu Nomiyama)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-45e6b590" itemprop="headline"><span>To Mask or Not to Mask: Confusion Spreads Over Coronavirus Protection</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">SINGAPORE/KUALA LUMPUR — "Do not wear a mask if you are well" read a warning plastered across the front of Singapore's main newspaper on Friday, as authorities around the world sought to calm panic buying of masks seen as a guard against the fast-spreading coronavirus. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In neighboring Malaysia, the government urged people to always have masks and hand sanitizers ready, similar to advice by authorities in Thailand and Vietnam.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Conflicting messages have sowed confusion over how to protect against an epidemic that has claimed over 200 lives in China and spread to over 20 countries, with some experts saying wrong handling of masks could even increase infection risk.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Wearing a mask only when u feel unwell? Then why do u need soldiers when there isn't war? It's better to be safe than sorry" Facebook user Kenny Chan Wai Kong posted in Singapore, where authorities have announced plans to give four masks to every household as retailers' stocks run dry across the island.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In parts of Asia, wearing face masks is common when people are sick or to counter urban pollution.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Official guidance from the World Health Organisation and the Centre for Disease Control and Prevention makes no mention of wearing a face mask as a preventative measure against the virus - but their websites do not specifically advise against them.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Australia and Taiwan have said healthy people don't need masks, but Australia has released 1 million masks from the national medical stockpile, and masks are widely worn in Taiwan's capital Taipei where the government has imposed purchase limits and an export ban on masks. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Taiwan Railway Administration said on Friday that if the virus continues to spread it will refuse to carry passengers not wearing masks. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">MASKS MUST BE FITTED CORRECTLY</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Coronavirus can be transmitted from person to person, although it is not clear how easily. Most cases have been in people who have been in the Chinese city of Wuhan at the center of the outbreak, family members of those infected, or medical workers.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Transmission is likely through contact with an infected person via particles in the air from coughing or sneezing, or by someone touching an infected person or object with the virus on it and then touching their mouth, nose or eyes.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Situations that require a mask are when you are in a crowd...or if you are caring for a sick person. If it makes you feel better, wear a surgical mask," Angela Rasmussen, virologist at the Center for Infection &amp; Immunity at Columbia University said on the Reuters Global Markets Forum.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Other experts have said disposable surgical masks may not fit the face tightly enough to prevent infection, while some have pointed out that wrong handling of masks such as touching the front could increase the likelihood of infection spread. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In Hong Kong, a lawmaker who chairs the city's government health services panel was slammed over a short video she posted showing people how to steam and re-use disposable face masks.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">More unusual advice has seen India's government suggest a traditional concoction that includes ginger and holy basil as virus protection, while a Myanmar minister was rebuked for sharing a Facebook post that advised people to eat more onions. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Some overseas Chinese have been buying masks to send to friends and relatives in China, where some stocks have been running out. Chinese citizens living in Vietnam, Thailand and Malaysia sent 150,000 masks back to their home province of Gansu on Thursday, China's Xinhua news agency reported. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In China, where nearly 10,000 cases have been reported so far, Zunyou Wu, chief epidemiologist at the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention, told state broadcaster that people need to wear masks when taking public transport. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by John Geddie, Aradhana Aravindan and Keith Zhai in Singapore, Joseph Sipalan in Kuala Lumpur, Khahn Vu in Hanoi, Jiraporn Kuhakan and Panu Wongcha-um in Bangkok, Ben Blanchard in Taipei, Anne Marie Roantree in Hong Kong, Euan Roche in Mumbai, Thu Thu Aung in Yangon and Jonathan Barrett in Sydney; Writing by John Geddie; Editing by Michael Perry)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-1984f7b7" itemprop="headline"><span>Trump Says Coronavirus Outbreak Is 'Very Well Under Control'</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">WARREN, Mich. — President Donald Trump said on Thursday the United States was working very closely with China on the coronavirus outbreak and he believed it was under control.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We're working very closely with (China) and with a lot of other people and a lot of other countries" on combating the outbreak, Trump said in a speech at an auto parts manufacturer in Warren, Michigan.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We think we have it very well under control. We have very little problem in this country at this moment," he said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Jeff Mason; Writing by Eric Beech; Editing by Tim Ahmann)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-52d0de9c" itemprop="headline"><span>China Says Death Toll From Coronavirus Outbreak Rises to 213</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BEIJING — China's National Health Commission (NHC) said on Friday the death toll from the coronavirus outbreak in the country rose to 213 as of end-Thursday, with another 1,982 new cases confirmed.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in China reached 9,692 as of end-Thursday, NHC said in a statement.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Muyu Xu in BEIJING and Brenda Goh in SHANGHAI; Editing by Muralikumar Anantharaman)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-33fafaad" itemprop="headline"><span>Electrolux Shares Slump After Warning of Coronavirus Impact</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">STOCKHOLM — Electrolux warned on Friday the coronavirus outbreak in China would hit its sourcing of products and components from the country, while lingering U.S. production issues would push its North American arm into a first-quarter loss.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The cautionary near-term guidance from the home appliances maker eclipsed a smaller-than-expected fall in fourth-quarter earnings, sending its shares down 4.5% by 1014 GMT to trade around a near four-month low.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Swedish maker of brands such as Electrolux, Frigidaire and AEG said the fast-spreading virus could have a "material financial impact" if its Chinese suppliers were further affected.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"As we are sourcing significant volumes of finished products and components from China to all our business areas, we are now implementing contingency plans to mitigate a potential extended period of supply disruptions," CEO Jonas Samuelson said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China is Electrolux' single biggest sourcing hub, supplying not only components but complete products. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Samuelson said a dedicated team was working to secure alternative suppliers and shipping routes, an easier task with parts than finished goods. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In some categories, such as vacuum cleaners, air conditioners and small home appliances, China accounts for nearly the entire global supply for the industry, leaving alternatives scarce if not non-existent, Samuelson told Reuters. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"One week is manageable, we can make up for that. But if the closures are extended, then we face a bigger challenge."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Along with the prospect of a loss in North America and a gloomier outlook for efficiency gains this year, the supply chain uncertainty was likely to lead to lowered profit expectations for the group, Citi said in a research note.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">U.S. LOSS </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The rival of U.S.-based Whirlpool said adjusted operating earnings fell to 960 million Swedish crowns ($101 million) from 1.67 billion, but that beat the 903 million on average expected by analysts, Refinitiv Eikon data showed.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The results excluded its Professional Products business which is due to be spun out to shareholders and listed separately in the first quarter.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The company warned in December that earnings in North America would be hit to the tune of $70 million in the fourth quarter, mainly due to the slower-than-anticipated start-up of a new refrigerator and freezer plant in Anderson, South Carolina.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Given this situation, lower volumes and higher costs will impact earnings for the first quarter 2020 resulting in a loss for business area North America," Samuelson said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Electrolux's North American arm accounted for just over a quarter of group sales in the final three months of last year.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">During his years at the helm Samuelson has led a push towards greater efficiency and nimbler and more automated production to boost margins, and the December warning led to Electrolux shares losing a tenth of their value in a single day.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Against the backdrop of its lingering North American production issues, the company on Friday forecast roughly flat demand in the region this year, while seeing slightly firmer demand in both Europe and Asia.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Looking at 2020, Electrolux also said it expected little year-on-year impact from the combination of tariffs, material prices and currency swings that yielded a roughly 1.6 billion crown headwind last year. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Niklas Pollard and Johannes Hellstrom; editing by Jason Neely and David Holmes)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-5c2d0b20" itemprop="headline"><span>Vietnam to Stop Issuing Visas for Chinese Tourists Over Coronavirus Concerns</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">HANOI — Vietnam will stop issuing visas for Chinese tourists, the government said on Thursday, after the Southeast Asian country detected three new cases of coronavirus. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Cross-border trade between Vietnam and China is not encouraged at the moment, the government said in a statement. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"The outbreak is spreading rapidly, and in a serious manner," the statement said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Chinese tourists accounted for one-third of tourists visiting Vietnam last year, according to Vietnamese government statistics. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Last week, Vietnam's health ministry said two Chinese citizens in Vietnam had tested positive for coronavirus. One has since recovered.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Countries began isolating hundreds of citizens evacuated from the Chinese city of Wuhan on Thursday to stop the spread of an epidemic that has killed 170 people as worry about the impact on the world's second-biggest economy rattled markets.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Vietnam's health ministry said on Thursday that the latest three people to have contracted the virus had all recently returned from Wuhan, where the virus first emerged.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Two of the three patients are being treated in the capital Hanoi, the health ministry's official newspaper said. Another is receiving treatment in the northern province of Thanh Hoa, 160 km (100 miles) from Hanoi, the report said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Most of the border gates between Vietnam and China in the northern province of Lang Son have halted imports and exports of goods until Feb. 9, the state-run Vietnam News Agency (VNA) said on Thursday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The coronavirus outbreak has stoked a wave of anti-China sentiment around the globe, from shops barring entry to Chinese tourists, online vitriol mocking the country's exotic meat trade and surprise health checks on foreign workers.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Khanh Vu; Writing by James Pearson; Editing by Elaine Hardcastle and Hugh Lawson)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-1875870d" itemprop="headline"><span>Ethiopian Airlines Denies Suspending Flights to China Amid Coronavirus Outbreak</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">ADDIS ABABA — Ethiopian Airlines late on Thursday denied reports it had suspended all flights to China, where an outbreak of coronavirus has killed at least 170 people.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The airline, Africa's most profitable, is the main gateway between China and Africa and suspension of its service would significantly disrupt air travel. The carrier runs six flights to China daily across five Chinese destinations. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A statement issued by the airline said all flights were operating normally, contradicting the carrier's passenger call center that had told Reuters earlier in the day that flights to the Asian country had been suspended.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We are operating our regular flights to all of our five gateways in China, Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Chengdu and Hong Kong with the usual supply and demand adjustment that we always make during the Chinese New Year Holidays," read the statement.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China has heavily invested in Ethiopia in recent years, as it has in other African countries.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Ethiopia's state minister for Health Lia Tadesse said in a tweet on Thursday that tests for coronavirus on four Ethiopians at a lab in South Africa came back negative.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Giulia Paravicini; Writing by Elias Biryabarema; Editing by Elaine Hardcastle and Alex Richardson)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-1875870d" itemprop="headline"><span>Ethiopian Airlines Denies Suspending Flights to China Amid Coronavirus Outbreak</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">ADDIS ABABA — Ethiopian Airlines late on Thursday denied reports it had suspended all flights to China, where an outbreak of coronavirus has killed at least 170 people.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The airline, Africa's most profitable, is the main gateway between China and Africa and suspension of its service would significantly disrupt air travel. The carrier runs six flights to China daily across five Chinese destinations. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A statement issued by the airline said all flights were operating normally, contradicting the carrier's passenger call centre that had told Reuters earlier in the day that flights to the Asian country had been suspended.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We are operating our regular flights to all of our five gateways in China, Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Chengdu and Hong Kong with the usual supply and demand adjustment that we always make during the Chinese New Year Holidays," read the statement.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China has heavily invested in Ethiopia in recent years, as it has in other African countries.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Ethiopia's state minister for Health Lia Tadesse said in a tweet on Thursday that tests for coronavirus on four Ethiopians at a lab in South Africa came back negative.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Giulia Paravicini; Writing by Elias Biryabarema; Editing by Elaine Hardcastle and Alex Richardson)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-1164fc8d" itemprop="headline"><span>Factbox: Airlines Suspend China Flights Over Coronavirus</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Reuters) - Airlines have started suspending flights to China in the wake of a new coronavirus outbreak, which as of Thursday had killed 170 people and infected almost 8,000.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Below are details (in alphabetical order):</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">AIR CANADA</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Air Canada said on Jan. 28 it was cancelling select flights to China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">AIR FRANCE</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Air France said on Jan. 30 it suspended all scheduled flights to and from mainland China until Feb. 9.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">AIR INDIA</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Air India said it was cancelling its Mumbai-Delhi-Shanghai flight from Jan. 31 to Feb. 14.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">AIR SEOUL</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">South Korean budget carrier Air Seoul said on Jan. 28 it had suspended all flights to China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">AIR TANZANIA</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Tanzania's state-owned carrier said it would postpone its maiden flights to China. It had planned to begin charter flights to China in February.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">AMERICAN AIRLINES</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The largest U.S. carrier said it would suspend flights from Los Angeles to Beijing and Shanghai from Feb. 9 to March 27.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BRITISH AIRWAYS </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BA said on Jan. 30 it had cancelled all flights to mainland China for a month.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">CATHAY PACIFIC AIRWAYS</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Hong Kong's Cathay Pacific said it would progressively reduce capacity to and from mainland China by 50% or more from Jan. 30 to the end of March.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">DELTA AIR LINES </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The U.S. airline said on Jan. 29 it was reducing flights to China to 21 per week from 42, starting Feb. 6 through April 30.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">EGYPTAIR</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Egypt's flag carrier said on Jan. 30 it would suspend all flights to and from China starting Feb. 1.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">ETHIOPIAN AIRLINES</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The African carrier on Jan. 30 denied reports it had suspended all flights to China. The airline's statement contradicted its passenger call centre, which told Reuters earlier in the day that flights to China had been suspended.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">FINNAIR</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Finland's Finnair said on Jan. 28 it would suspend its flights to Nanjing and Beijing until the end of March after China suspended international group travel from the country.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Finnair will suspend its three weekly flights between Helsinki and Beijing Daxing between Feb. 5 and March 29 and its two weekly flights between Helsinki and Nanjing between Feb. 8 and March 29.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">LION AIR</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Indonesia's Lion Air Group said on Jan. 29 it would suspend all flights to China from February. The airline has suspended six flights from several Indonesian cities to China so far and will suspend the rest next month.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">LUFTHANSA</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Germany's Lufthansa said on Jan. 29 it was suspending Lufthansa, Swiss and Austrian Airlines flights to and from China until Feb. 9. The airline continues to fly to Hong Kong, but it will stop taking bookings for flights to mainland China until the end of February.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">SAS</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Nordic airline SAS said on Jan. 30 it has decided to suspend all flights to and from Shanghai and Beijing from Jan. 31 until Feb. 9.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">SAS offers 12 regular weekly connections from and to Shanghai and Beijing.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">TURKISH AIRLINES</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Turkey's flag carrier said on Jan. 30 it would decrease frequency on scheduled flights to Beijing, Guangzhou, Shanghai and Xian between Feb. 5 and Feb. 29.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">UNITED AIRLINES</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Chicago-based United said it would implement a second phase of flight cancellations between its hub cities in the United States and Beijing, Hong Kong and Shanghai, resulting in 332 additional roundtrips being called off through March 28.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The cancellations will reduce the carrier's daily departures for mainland China and Hong Kong to four daily departures from 12.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">United had previously suspended 24 U.S. flights to Beijing, Hong Kong and Shanghai between Feb. 1 and Feb. 8 because of a significant drop in demand.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">UNITED PARCEL SERVICE INC</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">UPS has cancelled 22 China flights, as a result of the Wuhan quarantines and normal manufacturing closures due to the Lunar New Year holiday, UPS Chief Executive David Abney said on Jan. 30. He did not specify how many flights cancellations were due to the virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">VIRGIN ATLANTIC</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Virgin Atlantic said on Jan. 30 it would suspend its daily operations to Shanghai for two weeks from Feb. 2. It cited declining demand for flights and the safety of its customers and staff. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Jagoda Darlak and Tommy Lund in Gdansk; additional reporting by Ankit Ajmera in Bengaluru; editing by Elaine Hardcastle/Vinay Dwivedi/Susan Fenton)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-7b9324be" itemprop="headline"><span>U.S. Ramps Up Anti-Coronavirus Measures at Border as Impact Spreads</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">SHANGHAI/WASHINGTON — The United States ramped up its response to the coronavirus epidemic on Friday, declaring a public health emergency and saying it would halt entry to foreign nationals who had been to China within the 14-day incubation period.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">That measure followed on from an earlier travel advisory that warned Americans not to travel to China and angered Beijing.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Originating in the Chinese city of Wuhan, the flu-like virus first identified earlier in January has resulted in 213 deaths in China, according to local health authorities. Wuhan and the surrounding region of Hubei are in virtual quarantine.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">More than 9,800 people have been infected in China and more than 130 cases reported in at least 25 other countries and regions, with Russia, Britain, Sweden and Italy all reporting their first cases on Thursday or Friday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The World Health Organization said on Thursday that the epidemic constituted a public health emergency of international concern, a designation that triggers tighter global containment measures and coordination. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Following the World Health Organization's decision... I have today declared that the coronavirus presents a public health emergency in the United States," U.S. Health Secretary Alex Azar said at a public briefing on Friday afternoon.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">As of Sunday, U.S. citizens who had been in Hubei would be subject to compulsory quarantine, he said. Foreign nationals - aside from the immediate family of citizens and residents - who had traveled in China in the last 14 days would be denied entry, said Azar. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"The risk is low in the United States... but our job is to keep that risk low as much as we can," he said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The move will likely anger Beijing, which has only just started to mend tattered trade ties with Washington. Earlier on Friday, it criticized the U.S. travel warning.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"The World Health Organization urged countries to avoid travel restrictions, but very soon after that, the United States did the opposite," Chinese Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Hua Chunying said. "It's truly mean."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Other countries have also advised citizens to put off non-urgent travel to China or restricted flights. After reporting its first two cases of the illness, Russia on Friday restricted direct flights to China, its biggest trade partner.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Singapore, a major travel hub in Asia, stopped entry of passengers with a recent history of travel to China and also suspended visas for Chinese passport holders.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Many airlines have chosen to cancel or reduce flights, with airline crews pressuring carriers to act.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Governments around the world are evacuating citizens from Hubei. A plane with 83 British and 27 foreign nationals landed in Britain on Friday, while Japan, with 14 confirmed cases, has sent three flights to bring citizens home.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The United States said it would channel all flights from China through seven airports. It has put 195 Americans evacuated to California this week in quarantine.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The virus has an incubation of between one and 14 days, and there are some limited signs it may also be able to spread before any symptoms show.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">For a full coverage of the coronavirus outbreak, click: https://graphics.reuters.com/CHINA-HEALTH/0100B59Y39P/index.html</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">GLOBAL REVERBERATIONS</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">With major fallout inevitable for China's economy, which is the world's second largest, global shares posted their biggest weekly and monthly losses since August on Friday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The outbreak could "reverberate globally," Moody's said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In the latest impact to big name corporations, South Korea's Hyundai Motor said it planned to halt production of a sport utility vehicle this weekend due to a supply disruption caused by the outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Home appliance maker Electrolux issued a similar warning, French carmaker PSA Peugeot Citroen said its three plants in Wuhan will remain closed until mid-February, and tractor maker Deere &amp; Co said it was temporarily shutting its facilities in China. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">WHO's director-general, Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, has said the WHO did not support travel or trade curbs. Tedros reiterated in a series of tweets on Friday that his organization had confidence in China's capacity to control the 2019-nCoV virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Travel restrictions can cause more harm than good by hindering info-sharing and medical supply chains and harming economies. We urge countries and companies to make evidence-based, consistent decisions."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Graphic: Tracking the novel coronavirus - https://graphics.reuters.com/CHINA-HEALTH-MAP/0100B59S39E/index.html </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">VIRUS EPICENTER</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The roughly 60 million residents of Hubei province, where Wuhan is the capital, have had movements curbed to try and slow the spread of the disease. But some people were leaving and entering the area by foot on a bridge over the Yangtze river, a Reuters witness said, and infections have jumped in two cities flanking Wuhan.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China's statistics show just over 2% of infected people have died, suggesting the virus is less deadly than the 2002-2003 outbreak of the Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS). </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">But economists say its financial impact could be bigger than SARS, which killed about 800 people at an estimated cost of $33 billion to the global economy, since China's share of the world economy is now far greater.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Like other respiratory infections, the coronavirus spreads between people in droplets from coughs and sneezes. No deaths have been reported outside China, but it is still too early to know what its death rate will be.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"The issue now with this is that there's a lot of unknowns," said U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention head Robert Redfield. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The WHO has reported at least eight cases of human-to-human transmission - as opposed to people coming infected from China - in four countries: the United States, Germany, Japan and Vietnam. Thailand said it too had such a case.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Brenda Goh in Shanghai, Muyu Xu, Ryan Woo and Cate Cadell in Beijing; Martin Pollard in Jiujiang, Felix Tam and Clare Jim in Hong Kong; John Geddie and Aradhana Aravindan in Singapore; Stephanie Nebehay in Geneva; Michelle Nichols at the U.N.; Gilles Guillaume in Paris; Dylan Martinez in Brize Norton; Maria Tsvetkova in Moscow; Makini Brice and David Shepardson in Washington; Writing by Nick Macfie and Rosalba O'Brien; Editing by Timothy Heritage, Andrew Cawthorne and Jonathan Oatis)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-4070f1b0" itemprop="headline"><span>China's Coronavirus May Help Boost U.S. Jobs: Ross</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">WASHINGTON — The fast-moving coronavirus stemming from China could force companies to re-evaluate their supply chains, potentially returning some jobs to the United States, U.S. Secretary of Commerce Wilbur Ross said on Thursday. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Ross expressed sympathy for victims of the virus and their families. "But the fact is, it does give businesses yet another thing to consider when they go through their review of their supply chain, on top of all the other things," he told Fox Business Network in an interview. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"It's another risk factor that people need to take into account, so I think it will help to accelerate the return of jobs to North America - some to the U.S., probably some to Mexico," Ross added.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">While the virus has yet to be declared a worldwide health emergency, it has threatened the global economy given China's position as the world's second-largest economy after the United States.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China has locked down the epicenter of the virus, Wuhan, as well as other cities. Major companies have also closed their China operations, while airlines suspended China-bound flights.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">So far, 170 people have died from the new virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The United States and China earlier this month agreed a Phase 1 trade deal, which U.S. President Donald Trump has touted as helping fulfill his America First campaign pledge to boost the U.S. economy and workers. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The deal soothed markets at the time, though many key issues were left unresolved and pushed to planned Phase 2 talks. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Susan Heavey; editing by John Stonestreet and Hugh Lawson)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-1164fc8d" itemprop="headline"><span>Factbox: Airlines Suspend China Flights Over Coronavirus</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Reuters) - Airlines have started suspending flights to China in the wake of a new coronavirus outbreak, which as of Friday had killed 213 people. Here's what we know so far.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">AIR CANADA</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Air Canada said on Jan. 28 it was cancelling select flights to China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">AIR FRANCE</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Air France said on Jan. 30 it suspended all scheduled flights to and from mainland China until Feb. 9.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">AIR INDIA</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Air India said it was cancelling its Mumbai-Delhi-Shanghai flight from Jan. 31 to Feb. 14.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">AIR NEW ZEALAND </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Air New Zealand said on Jan. 31 it was temporarily reducing flights between Auckland and Shanghai to four return services a week from Feb. 18 to March 31 rather than the usual daily flights.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">AIR SEOUL</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">South Korean budget carrier Air Seoul said on Jan. 28 it had suspended all flights to China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">AIR TANZANIA</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Tanzania's state-owned carrier said it would postpone its maiden flights to China. It had planned to begin charter flights to China in February.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">AMERICAN AIRLINES</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The largest U.S. carrier said it would suspend flights from Los Angeles to Beijing and Shanghai from Feb. 9 to March 27.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BRITISH AIRWAYS </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BA said on Jan. 30 it had cancelled all flights to mainland China for a month.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">CATHAY PACIFIC AIRWAYS</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Hong Kong's Cathay Pacific said it would progressively reduce capacity to and from mainland China by 50% or more from Jan. 30 to the end of March.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">DELTA AIR LINES </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The U.S. airline said on Jan. 29 it was reducing flights to China to 21 per week from 42, starting Feb. 6 through April 30.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">EGYPTAIR</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Egypt's flag carrier said on Jan. 30 it would suspend all flights to and from China starting Feb. 1.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">ETHIOPIAN AIRLINES</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The African carrier on Jan. 30 denied reports it had suspended all flights to China. The airline's statement contradicted its passenger call centre, which told Reuters earlier in the day that flights to China had been suspended.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">FINNAIR</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Finland's Finnair said on Jan. 28 it would suspend its flights to Nanjing and Beijing until the end of March after China suspended international group travel from the country.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Finnair will suspend its three weekly flights between Helsinki and Beijing Daxing between Feb. 5 and March 29 and its two weekly flights between Helsinki and Nanjing between Feb. 8 and March 29.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">LION AIR</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Indonesia's Lion Air Group said on Jan. 29 it would suspend all flights to China from February. The airline has suspended six flights from several Indonesian cities to China so far and will suspend the rest next month.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">LUFTHANSA</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Germany's Lufthansa said on Jan. 29 it was suspending Lufthansa, Swiss and Austrian Airlines flights to and from China until Feb. 9. The airline continues to fly to Hong Kong, but it will stop taking bookings for flights to mainland China until the end of February.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">SAS</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Nordic airline SAS said on Jan. 30 it has decided to suspend all flights to and from Shanghai and Beijing from Jan. 31 until Feb. 9.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">SAS offers 12 regular weekly connections from and to Shanghai and Beijing.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">SINGAPORE AIRLINES </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Singapore Airlines Ltd said on Jan. 31 it would reduce capacity on some of its routes to mainland China in February.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The cuts include flights to Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Shenzhen, Chengdu, Xiamen and Chongqing, some of which are flown by regional arm SilkAir. Its budget carrier Scoot is also cutting back on flights to China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">TURKISH AIRLINES</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Turkey's flag carrier said on Jan. 30 it would decrease frequency on scheduled flights to Beijing, Guangzhou, Shanghai and Xian between Feb. 5 and Feb. 29.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">UNITED AIRLINES</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Chicago-based United said it would implement a second phase of flight cancellations between its hub cities in the United States and Beijing, Hong Kong and Shanghai, resulting in 332 additional roundtrips being called off through March 28.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The cancellations will reduce the carrier's daily departures for mainland China and Hong Kong to four daily departures from 12.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">United had previously suspended 24 U.S. flights to Beijing, Hong Kong and Shanghai between Feb. 1 and Feb. 8 because of a significant drop in demand.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">UNITED PARCEL SERVICE INC</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">UPS has cancelled 22 China flights, as a result of the Wuhan quarantines and normal manufacturing closures due to the Lunar New Year holiday, UPS Chief Executive David Abney said on Jan. 30. He did not specify how many flights cancellations were due to the virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">VIRGIN ATLANTIC</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Virgin Atlantic said on Jan. 30 it would suspend its daily operations to Shanghai for two weeks from Feb. 2. It cited declining demand for flights and the safety of its customers and staff. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Jagoda Darlak and Tommy Lund in Gdansk; additional reporting by Ankit Ajmera in Bengaluru and Jamie Freed in Sydney; Editing by Stephen Coates)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-1875870d" itemprop="headline"><span>Ethiopian Airlines Denies Suspending Flights to China Amid Coronavirus Outbreak</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">ADDIS ABABA — Ethiopian Airlines late on Thursday denied reports it had suspended all flights to China, where an outbreak of coronavirus has killed at least 170 people.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The airline, Africa's most profitable, is the main gateway between China and Africa and suspension of its service would significantly disrupt air travel. The carrier runs six flights to China daily across five Chinese destinations. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A statement issued by the airline said all flights were operating normally, contradicting the carrier's passenger call center that had told Reuters earlier in the day that flights to the Asian country had been suspended.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We are operating our regular flights to all of our five gateways in China, Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Chengdu and Hong Kong with the usual supply and demand adjustment that we always make during the Chinese New Year Holidays," read the statement.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China has heavily invested in Ethiopia in recent years, as it has in other African countries.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Ethiopia's state minister for Health Lia Tadesse said in a tweet on Thursday that tests for coronavirus on four Ethiopians at a lab in South Africa came back negative.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Giulia Paravicini; Writing by Elias Biryabarema; Editing by Elaine Hardcastle and Alex Richardson)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-7628c4e2" itemprop="headline"><span>IMF Says Too Soon to Quantify China's Coronavirus Economic Impact</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">WASHINGTON — The International Monetary Fund said on Thursday it is closely monitoring China's coronavirus outbreak, but it is too soon to quantify the potential economic impact of the virus that is halting tourism and commerce throughout the country.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">IMF spokesman Gerry Rice told a regular news briefing that the direct impact on consumer and business demand been most severe in Hubei Province, the outbreak's epicenter, and the extent of the impact depends on how quickly the virus subsides.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Rice added that China has enough fiscal space to support its economy though the crisis if necessary and ensure that households and businesses have access to credit.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by David Lawder; Editing by Chizu Nomiyama)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-664a0479" itemprop="headline"><span>Britain Lifts Risk Level From Coronavirus to Medium From Low</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">LONDON — Britain has increased the perceived risk level to the country from an outbreak of coronavirus in China to moderate from low, indicating the government should plan for all eventualities. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The UK Chief Medical Officers said in a statement they had changed the risk level in light of the increasing number of cases in China, and because they consider it prudent for the government to escalate its planning in case of a more widespread outbreak. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Kate Holton; Editing by Chris Reese)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-304405d3" itemprop="headline"><span>East African Airlines Suspend China Flights Due to Coronavirus</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">NAIROBI/KIGALI — Kenya Airways and RwandAir said on Friday that they had suspended all flights to and from China until further notice after a virus outbreak killed more than 200 people in China and spread to 18 countries.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Kenya's health ministry said samples from a person suspected of having the new coronavirus sent to South Africa for further tests had turned out negative. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The patient, a student in the epicenter of the outbreak in the city of Wuhan, China, has been isolated in a Nairobi hospital having arrived on Tuesday on a Kenya Airways flight from Guangzhou in southern China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We have temporarily suspended all flights to and from Guangzhou starting Friday until further notice," the airline said in a statement.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The World Health Organization on Thursday declared a global emergency as the virus spread to more countries. [L8N29Z82Q]</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Air transport links between Africa and China have boomed in the past 20 years, in tandem with the growth of trade, social, economic, political and cultural ties between the continent and the Asian giant. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Kenya Airways, which operates one flight daily to Guangzhou via Bangkok, joins other airlines around the world that have stopped flying to the world's second-largest economy as it deals with the outbreak that has infected at least 8,000 people.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Flights to Bangkok will continue, Kenya Airways said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">RwandAir, which operates three flights a week to Guangzhou, has also suspended the flights, the airline said on Friday, adding that the decision would be reviewed in February.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">On Thursday, Ethiopian Airlines, Africa's largest carrier, denied reports that it would suspend flights to the Asian country after its call center told Reuters that flights were canceled.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Air Tanzania, which was poised to start maiden flights from Dar es Salaam to China in February, said on Wednesday it had postponed the plan, citing concerns over the spread of the virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Kenya Airways did not respond to queries about the share of its revenue that comes from the China flights.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Omar Mohammed in Nairobi and Clement Uwiringiyinana in Kigali; Editing by Duncan Miriri and Jason Neely)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-3777ac84" itemprop="headline"><span>LPGA Event Cancelled, Olympic Soccer Qualifiers Changed Due to Coronavirus</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">SYDNEY — The outbreak of the new coronavirus caused further disruption to the international sporting calendar on Friday with the elite women's LPGA golf tour cancelling an event in China and Olympic soccer qualifying matches in Australia having to be shuffled.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">More than 200 people in China have died from the flu-like virus with almost 6,000 affected after it emerged late last year in Wuhan in the central Hubei province. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The World Health Organization on Thursday declared the outbreak a public health emergency.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The four-team women's soccer tournament involving China, Australia, Taiwan and Thailand was moved from Wuhan -- the centre of the outbreak of the virus -- and hastily rearranged to be held in Australia by the Asian Football Confederation.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Organisers were forced to change their match schedule after China's team, who arrived in Australia on Jan. 29, were placed in quarantine in Brisbane until after Feb. 5.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">None of the players has tested positive for the virus, according to the Chinese Football Association.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">They had originally been scheduled to play their first game against Thailand on Feb. 3 but organisers said on Friday they would now play their first game on Feb. 6.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">An additional match day of Feb. 12, when China play Australia, had now been scheduled, Football Federation Australia (FFA) said in a statement on Friday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"As always, the health of everyone involved, from players and officials to the fans and contractors, remains the number one priority," said FFA Chief Executive James Johnson.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"This new format allows us to stage these matches with that priority in mind and we now look forward to welcoming all teams and hosting a successful tournament."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The LPGA said its Blue Bay tournament due to be held on Hainan island from March 5-8 had been cancelled.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Given the current health concerns and significant travel restrictions put in place due to the coronavirus in China, the LPGA along with our partners in China have made the decision to cancel the 2020 Blue Bay LPGA," the Tour said in a statement.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"While we are disappointed that the tournament won't take place this season, we look forward to going back to Blue Bay in 2021 and for many years to come." </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Several other international sports events have been affected by the outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The world indoor athletics championships, which were due to be held in Nanjing from March 13-15, have been postponed until next year.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Qualifying tournaments in boxing and basketball for this year's Tokyo Olympics were also moved from China, while other events have been cancelled or postponed.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Greg Stutchbury in Wellington; Editing by Sam Holmes/Peter Rutherford)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-49cfcd0d" itemprop="headline"><span>Holiday Spots in Southern Thailand Face Hard Times After Coronavirus Outbreak</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">PHANG NGA, Thailand — Thai tourist boat company "Love Andaman" is facing a bleak February after China banned all outbound group tours this week to try to contain the coronavirus outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China is Thailand's biggest source of foreign tourists, accounting for 28 percent of the 39.8 million visitors last year, and China's ban has left many in Thailand's tourism industry worried about their future.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"I’m a bit stressed out about this. Yesterday was the first time in over 10 years working as a tour guide where there was barely any tourists," said Amie Hemthanon, a "Love Andaman" guide said on Thursday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Because China closed down a few of its cities, we took a big hit, the (Chinese) tourists are gone and 100 percent cancellations going forward."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">More than 8,100 people have been infected globally in the outbreak, mostly in China, with millions of Chinese on lockdown as the authorities rush to stem its spread. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Thailand itself has recorded 14 cases of coronavirus, all but one of them among Chinese people visiting Thailand. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Amie's company usually operates 21 to 30 boats on the Andaman Sea in the peak season, ferrying tourists out to spots on the coast of Phang Nga province and the island of Phuket.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">On Thursday only one boat had been hired by a group of Chinese tourists.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Chinese tourists are so important to our tourism industry. We hope that they could overcome these problems soon," Amie said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Tourism Authority of Thailand has said it expects 2 million fewer Chinese tourists this year than last year, when 11 million arrived.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Reduced travel from China could result in 50 billion baht ($1.52 billion) of lost tourism revenue, the Tourism Ministry estimates.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Traders at a popular market on Phuket said that almost 80% of Chinese tourists had disappeared since the coronavirus outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"But we don’t ban them, we welcome the tourists. We protect ourselves by wearing masks to cover the nose. But if they come here, we really welcome them here," Tanawan Menthongkam, a jewellery store vendor said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Writing by Panu Wongcha-um; Editing by Alison Williams)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-22d74ba8" itemprop="headline"><span>China Trade Agency to Offer Firms Force Majeure Certificates Amid Coronavirus Outbreak</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BEIJING — A Chinese international trade promotion agency said it would offer force majeure certificates to companies struggling to cope with the impact of the new coronavirus epidemic on their business with overseas partners.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The move by the China Council for The Promotion of International Trade (CCPIT), officially accredited with Beijing's Commerce Ministry, was announced late on Thursday and comes with the death toll in the country from the virus topping 200. The number of cases confirmed worldwide has risen rapidly in what the World Health Organisation has declared a global health emergency.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Some Chinese companies have suffered severe impacts on goods and logistics and may not be able to fulfil their contracts amid the coronavirus," the CCPIT said in a statement.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">It didn't identify any companies affected, and didn't disclose whether it had received any requests for force majeure certificates, which can absolve parties of liability for contracts that can't be fulfilled due to extraordinary circumstances beyond their control.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The CCPIT said companies that can provide legitimate documents, including proof of delays or cancellation of transportation, exports contracts and customs declaration, to it online system would be granted force majeure certificates. The agency says on its website that its certification is recognised and accepted overseas.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The outbreak in the world's second-largest economy has roiled global commodity markets, raising fears of weaker demand and disrupting raw material supply chains. A Chinese government economist has forecast the country's economic growth may drop to 5%, or even lower, from 6.1% in 2019.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China has extended the Lunar New Year holiday to at least Feb.2. But some regions, such as oil refining hub of Shandong province and automakers clustered Chongqing city, have asked companies not to resume operations before Feb. 10, in a bid to prevent the spread of the coronavirus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Muyu Xu and Tony Munroe; Editing by Kenneth Maxwell)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-ec2d7ce" itemprop="headline"><span>Russia's First McDonald's Scraps 30th Anniversary Giveaway Due to Coronavirus Fears</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">MOSCOW — Russia's first McDonald's restaurant has scrapped a plan to sell Big Mac burgers for virtually nothing to mark its 30th anniversary over fears it would attract huge crowds, which authorities have advised against due to coronavirus fears. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The restaurant on Moscow' central Pushkin Square, was due on Friday to sell the Big Mac for just three roubles ($0.0474) instead of its usual price of 135 roubles, and expected to draw tens of thousands of people. But on Thursday it ditched the plan after Moscow authorities issued a city-wide warning against mass public events.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Yesterday the Moscow government announced precautionary measures to prevent the spread of coronavirus," McDonald's said in a statement.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"(It) recommended refraining from holding public events in the near future in places where citizens gather en masse in order to minimize risks of infection."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">There have been no confirmed cases of the virus in Russia.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Nonetheless the country has limited rail connections and partially closed its land border with China, and announced it would temporarily stop issuing electronic visas to Chinese nationals.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The virus, which began in Wuhan, the capital of China's central province of Hubei, has killed 170 people in China and infected more than 7,800 globally.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">HISTORIC OPENING</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Big Mac cost 3 roubles on Jan. 31, 1990, when the opening of the first McDonald's in the final months of the Soviet Union drew international attention and was considered of huge significance.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">That day over 30,000 people queued around the block for a first taste of American fast food, Manu Steijaert, a vice president at McDonald's, said, adding it was a global record at the time. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The branch, located 1.5 km (0.93 miles) from the Kremlin, has since seen over 140 million visits and last year was the busiest branch of McDonald's globally. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">McDonald's has 735 restaurants in Russia and plans to cross the 800 mark in 2020, investing over $100 million in its expansion.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Writing by Polina Ivanova; Editing by Alexandra Hudson)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
