The number of cases confirmed worldwide has risen rapidly in what the World Health Organisation has declared a global health emergency.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Some Chinese companies have suffered severe impacts on goods and logistics and may not be able to fulfil their contracts amid the coronavirus," the CCPIT said in a statement.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">It didn't identify any companies affected, and didn't disclose whether it had received any requests for force majeure certificates, which can absolve parties of liability for contracts that can't be fulfilled due to extraordinary circumstances beyond their control.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The CCPIT said companies that can provide legitimate documents, including proof of delays or cancellation of transportation, exports contracts and customs declaration, to it online system would be granted force majeure certificates. The agency says on its website that its certification is recognised and accepted overseas.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The outbreak in the world's second-largest economy has roiled global commodity markets, raising fears of weaker demand and disrupting raw material supply chains. A Chinese government economist has forecast the country's economic growth may drop to 5%, or even lower, from 6.1% in 2019.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China has extended the Lunar New Year holiday to at least Feb.2. But some regions, such as oil refining hub of Shandong province and automakers clustered Chongqing city, have asked companies not to resume operations before Feb. 10, in a bid to prevent the spread of the coronavirus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Muyu Xu and Tony Munroe; Editing by Kenneth Maxwell)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-4659f77a" itemprop="headline"><span>China Has Confidence and Capability to Win the War Against Coronavirus-Foreign Ministry</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BEIJING — China has confidence and capability to win the war against the new coronavirus, said the country's foreign ministry spokeswoman in responding to the World Health Organization (WHO)'s decision to declare the virus outbreak in China as a global emergency.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Hua Chunying, the ministry spokeswoman, also said that China will continue to work with the WHO and other countries to maintain global and regional public health security.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The epidemic has killed at least 212 and infected more than 8,000 globally as of Jan 30.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Muyu Xu in Beijing and Brenda Goh in Shanghai; Editing by Sandra Maler)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-be06e2b" itemprop="headline"><span>Illinois Man Becomes First Person Infected With Coronavirus After Contact Within U.S.</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">ATLANTA — An Illinois man is the first person confirmed to have become infected with the new coronavirus emerging from China after contact with someone with the disease within the United States, health authorities said on Thursday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The infected man is the husband of an Illinois woman previously confirmed as carrying the virus after she travelled to China, said Dr. Allison Arwady, a commissioner at the Chicago Department of Public Health. Both patients are in their 60s.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"This is the first case of person-to-person transmission in the U.S.," Arwady said. Even so, she added, "there is no local emergency."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The new Illinois case brings the total number of U.S. patients infected with the fast-spreading virus to six. The other five are believed to have contracted the virus after travelling in China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Experts at the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) were not surprised by the development, telling reporters that the virus was likely to spread from person to person in the United States.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"We understand that this may be concerning, but based on what we know now, we still believe the immediate risk to the American public is low,” CDC Director Dr. Robert Redfield said in a release on Thursday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">There have been more than 7,800 reported cases of the virus and at least 170 deaths, the vast majority in and around Wuhan, China, where it is believed to have originated in a market that traded in illegal wildlife. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Symptoms include fever, cough and breathing difficulty. In sever cases, it can lead to pneumonia and death.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> The second Illinois patient has been in isolation for the past two days after he showed symptoms and was immediately hospitalized, Arwady said. The case was confirmed by the CDC on Wednesday night.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Illinois Department of Public Health said it was currently tracking 21 people who had contact with the couple. Officials said he has not recently taken public transportation or attended any large gatherings.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"If additional cases are confirmed, we will make sure to share that information as quickly as possible," said Dr. Ngozi Ezike, director of the Illinois health department. "The general public is believed to be at low risk."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Concern about the new virus has mushroomed around the world as more cases turn up outside China. Health authorities still do not know how dangerous the virus is or how easily it spreads.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Wuhan, a city of 11 million, has been on virtual lockdown since last week.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">On Thursday, the World Health Organization declared that the coronavirus epidemic in China now constitutes a public health emergency of international concern. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Many international airlines have cut or suspended flights to China as a result of the virus, and several countries, including the United States, Japan and Germany, are flying their citizens out of Wuhan.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Nearly 200 Americans arrived in a California air base on Wednesday on a flight from Wuhan. The passengers remain in voluntary isolation until Saturday and screening is underway.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The U.S. also was evacuating family members and all non-emergency U.S. government employees at the American embassy in Beijing and consulates in Chengdu, Guangzhou, Shanghai and Shenyang due to the coronavirus outbreak, a State department representative said on Thursday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The department also will fly additional evacuation flights from Wuhan, leaving on Monday or sooner, it said in a statement on its website.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Air traffic to and from China has dropped off since the discovery of the virus, U.S. Secretary of Health and Human Services Alex Azar told CNBC, with airlines cancelling flights and the U.S. warning Americans about travel to China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The new virus is similar to the deadly Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) virus that also originated in China in 2002. Both are members of the coronavirus family, which also includes the common cold.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting By Deena Beasley in Los Angeles and Manas Mishra in Bangaluru, Eric Beech in Washington and Rich McKay in Atlanta; Editing by Bill Berkrot)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-52a8a837" itemprop="headline"><span>Levi's Shuts Half Its China Stores on Coronavirus Outbreak, Expects Financial Hit</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Reuters) - Levi Strauss &amp; Co has shut about half of its stores in China due to the outbreak of a new coronavirus and will take a near-term financial hit as a result of the epidemic, Chief Financial Officer Harmit Singh said on Thursday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">This comes a few months after Levi's opened its largest store in China in the city of Wuhan, the epicentre of the coronavirus epidemic which has killed about 170 people, marring its plans to tap into the city's 11-million strong population.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"It will put a dampener on our growth objectives in the near term," Singh told Reuters in an interview about the store closures in China, which contributes about 3% to the company's revenue. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The flu-like virus has set-off alarm bells across the globe, with companies such as Starbucks Corp and Tesla Inc warning of a financial hit from slowing business in the world's most populous country. Earlier this week, Starbucks also said it closed about half its stores in China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Levi's has also stopped all employee travel in and out of China. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Singh said the coronavirus impact was not baked into the company's full year forecast, but will be quantified when it reports first quarter results in April.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Levi's forecast 2020 earnings above estimates, boosted by demand for women's apparel in its own stores and online, sending shares up 3% for the company which returned to public markets last year.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Singh pointed to the strong start to 2020 fiscal year, saying Levi's had "hit the ground running" during the crucial holiday shopping season. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The company missed fourth quarter revenue estimates, hurt by plunging sales at department stores and protests in Hong Kong which dented demand in the Asian shopping hub.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Fourth quarter net revenue fell 1.4% to $1.57 billion (1.19 billion pounds), compared with analysts' estimates of $1.58 billion, according to IBES data from Refinitiv. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Adjusted net income fell 9% to $108 million, or 26 cents per share, in the quarter ended Nov. 24, beating expectations of 21 cents per share. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The company forecast adjusted 2020 profit of $1.18 per share to $1.22 per share above Wall Street estimates of $1.17.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Aditi Sebastian and Uday Sampath in Bengaluru; Editing by Shinjini Ganguli)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-bb69883" itemprop="headline"><span>Trump Launches Coronavirus Task Force as U.S. Readies More Wuhan Evacuations</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">WASHINGTON/BEIJING — The Trump administration launched a task force with a brief to protect the United States from the fast-spreading coronavirus, as the country prepared to evacuate more of its citizens from the epicentre of the outbreak in Wuhan, China.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In a statement on Thursday, the U.S. State Department said Washington would arrange extra evacuation flights from Wuhan with capacity for private U.S. citizens, on or about Feb. 3.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">It did not say how many planes it would deploy for how many people, but that passengers would be subject to screening, health observations and monitoring requirements. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Nearly 200 Americans, mostly U.S. diplomats and their families, were evacuated from Wuhan this week and are being held in voluntary quarantine at a military base in California.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Overnight, the White House announced the formation of a presidential task force to lead the administration's response to the virus, including monitoring and containing the spread of the disease. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The 12-person group of officials, led by U.S. Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar, has been meeting daily this week and will also make Americans have the latest health and travel information, the White House said in a statement late Wednesday night. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"The risk of infection for Americans remains low, and all agencies are working aggressively to monitor this continuously evolving situation and to keep the public informed," it said.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Top officials from the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the National Institutes of Health, the Department of Homeland Security, the Transportation Department and the Department of State will also serve on the task force, according to the White House.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Susan Heavey in Washington and Se Young Lee in Beijing; editing by John Stonestreet)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 [<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-22d74ba8" itemprop="headline"><span>China Trade Agency to Offer Firms Force Majeure Certificates Amid Coronavirus Outbreak</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BEIJING — A Chinese international trade promotion agency said it would offer force majeure certificates to companies struggling to cope with the impact of the new coronavirus epidemic on their business with overseas partners.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The move by the China Council for The Promotion of International Trade (CCPIT), officially accredited with Beijing's Commerce Ministry, was announced late on Thursday and comes with the death toll in the country from the virus topping 200. The number of cases confirmed worldwide has risen rapidly in what the World Health Organisation has declared a global health emergency.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Some Chinese companies have suffered severe impacts on goods and logistics and may not be able to fulfil their contracts amid the coronavirus," the CCPIT said in a statement.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">It didn't identify any companies affected, and didn't disclose whether it had received any requests for force majeure certificates, which can absolve parties of liability for contracts that can't be fulfilled due to extraordinary circumstances beyond their control.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The CCPIT said companies that can provide legitimate documents, including proof of delays or cancellation of transportation, exports contracts and customs declaration, to it online system would be granted force majeure certificates. The agency says on its website that its certification is recognised and accepted overseas.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The outbreak in the world's second-largest economy has roiled global commodity markets, raising fears of weaker demand and disrupting raw material supply chains. A Chinese government economist has forecast the country's economic growth may drop to 5%, or even lower, from 6.1% in 2019.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">China has extended the Lunar New Year holiday to at least Feb.2. But some regions, such as oil refining hub of Shandong province and automakers clustered Chongqing city, have asked companies not to resume operations before Feb. 10, in a bid to prevent the spread of the coronavirus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Muyu Xu and Tony Munroe; Editing by Kenneth Maxwell)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]

[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-674495a1" itemprop="headline"><span>Chevron Asks Staff to Postpone All Non-Essential Travel to China</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Reuters) - U.S. oil major Chevron Corp said on Thursday it has asked its employees to postpone all "non-essential" business travel to China in the aftermath of the coronavirus outbreak.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Currently, no Chevron personnel or assets are affected," the company said in an email to Reuters. "As a precautionary measure, we have advised employees to postpone all non-essential travel to China."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Chevron employees are also required to receive approval from the company's senior management for all travel to China that is "deemed business critical", according to a memo seen by Reuters on Thursday.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Several companies have taken similar measures as precautionary steps in response to the coronavirus outbreak in China that has so far killed more than 200 and infected more than 9,800 in the country. The World Health Organization declared a global health emergency.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Shariq Khan and Kanishka Singh in Bengaluru; Editing by Subhranshu Sahu and Shounak Dasgupta)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-2dbb71" itemprop="headline"><span>Facebook Fights Spread of Misinformation About Virus Online</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">The Associated Press</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Facebook says it's working to limit the spread of misinformation and potentially harmful content about the coronavirus as bogus claims about the ongoing outbreak circulate online.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Kang-Xing Jin, Facebook's head of health, announced that the social media platform will begin removing posts that include false claims or conspiracy theories about the virus that have been flagged by health authorities. The company said it will focus on posts that discourage people from getting medical treatment, or that make potentially dangerous claims about cures.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The company will also limit the spread of posts debunked by its third-party fact checkers, and send users who shared the post a notification.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Users who search for information on the virus on Facebook, or who click on certain related hashtags on Instagram, will receive a pop-up providing authoritative information on the virus. In addition, information about the outbreak will also appear at the top of Facebook users' news feeds based on guidance from the World Health Organization.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“We will also block or restrict hashtags used to spread misinformation on Instagram, and are conducting proactive sweeps to find and remove as much of this content as we can,” Jin wrote in a post. "Not all of these steps are fully in place. It will take some time to roll them out across our platforms.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Since the outbreak began a number of misleading claims and hoaxes about the virus have circulated online. They include false conspiracy theories that the virus was created in a lab and that vaccines have already been manufactured, wildly exaggerations about the number of sick and dead, and potentially harmful claims about bogus cures.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The coronavirus has now infected more than 9,800 people around the world, based on numbers released Friday. Some 213 deaths have been reported in China, with most of the deaths in the central province of Hubei. The number of cases grew in Japan, Thailand, Singapore, Taiwan and Germany on Friday, while Russia, Italy and England reported their first cases. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The first person-to-person transmission of the virus in the U.S. was announced Thursday in Chicago. The U.S. declared a public health emergency on Friday, as the nation's seventh case was identified.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Other internet companies have announced their own efforts to stem the flow of misinformation about the disease.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Twitter users who search for information about coronavirus are now given a link to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention website on coronavirus. YouTube and Google, meanwhile, say they're promoting authoritative information about the virus to the top of search results.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Google also announced that users who search for information on the virus will see an “SOS Alert” at the top of their screen giving them links to the World Health Organization's references on the outbreak.</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-5687953c" itemprop="headline"><span>Oil Slides as Virus Outbreak Shakes Economic Growth Predictions</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Reuters</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">NEW YORK — Oil prices fell on Friday and were on track for a fourth straight weekly loss on mounting worries about economic damage from the coronavirus that has spread from China to around 20 countries, killing more than 200 people.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Prices briefly found support after Russian Energy Minister Alexander Novak said Russia was ready to bring forward a meeting of OPEC and its allies to February from March to address a possible hit to global oil demand from the virus. [nL8N2A067O]</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Novak said he was in discussions with OPEC leader Saudi Arabia and that the oil-producing nations would need several more days to assess the impact and decide on the date of the meeting. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"The cartel stands ready to act again if necessary but may accept the short-term pain for now on the expectation that the economic consequences won't be as bad as people fear and (the) price will bounce back to more acceptable levels on its own," said Craig Erlam, senior market analyst at OANDA.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Brent crude &lt;LCOc1&gt; fell 13 cents to settle at $58.16 a barrel and was down about 4% on the week. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">U.S. West Texas Intermediate (WTI) &lt;CLc1&gt; fell 58 cents to end the session at $51.56 a barrel, down 4.8% on the week. During the session, prices sank to as low as $50.97 a barrel, the lowest since early August. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Both benchmarks had risen more than $1 a barrel early in the session. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Global equity markets were poised for their first monthly loss since August and Wall Street's main averages tumbled more than 1% on Friday, as mixed corporate earnings added to worries over the impact of the coronavirus. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Disruptions in supply chains and travel curbs prompted economists to temper growth expectations for China, the world's second-largest economy.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Goldman Sachs said the outbreak was likely to shave 0.4 percentage point from China's economic growth in 2020 and could also drag the U.S. economy lower.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The outbreak could cut China's oil demand by more than 250,000 barrels per day (bpd) in the first quarter, analysts said. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"It seems almost certain that the coronavirus will curb Chinese economic growth and commodities demand this quarter," Capital Economics analysts said in a note.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">"Should the coronavirus have a comparable effect as SARS, it could reduce China's oil demand by roughly 400,000 barrels per day."</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Graphic: China oil demand year-on-year change, https://fingfx.thomsonreuters.com/gfx/mkt/13/1648/1623/corona.jpg) </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Many companies in China planned to return to work on Friday after a week-long celebration of the Lunar New Year holiday, but authorities ordered businesses in many areas to stay shut longer to contain the disease.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Growth in China's factory activity faltered in January. The Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) fell to 50.0 from 50.2 in December, China's National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) said. The 50-point mark separates growth from contraction.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">A Reuters poll on Friday indicated oil prices should remain supported near current levels this year as political risks and OPEC-led output curbs offset growing supply. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The poll of 50 economists and analysts was conducted mainly before the coronavirus outbreak. </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">(Graphic: Average 2020 Brent and WTI forecasts, https://fingfx.thomsonreuters.com/gfx/mkt/13/1637/1612/Avg%202020%20brent,%20wti%20estimates.jpg) </p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">OPEC oil output plunged in January to a multi-year low as top exporter Saudi Arabia and other Gulf members overdelivered on a new production-limiting accord and Libyan supply dropped due to a blockade of ports and oilfields, a Reuters survey found.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Still, global supplies remain abundant. U.S. crude production climbed 203,000 bpd to a record 12.9 million bpd in November, the U.S. Energy Information Administration said in a monthly report.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0"> (Reporting by Devika Krishna Kumar in New York; Additonal reporting by Bozorgmehr Sharafedin in London and Roslan Khasawneh in Singapore; Editing by David Gregorio, Matthew Lewis and Tom Brown)</p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
[<p>Advertisement</p>, <p>Supported by</p>, <p class="css-c2jxua e6idgb70"></p>, <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-718ed2c7" itemprop="headline"><span>China Decides to Postpone Start of Domestic Soccer League</span></h1>, <p class="css-1fv7b6t e1jsehar1" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">The Associated Press</span></p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">BEIJING — The Chinese Football Association has announced that all domestic matches of the 2020 season will be postponed in an effort to control the spread of the coronavirus that has now claimed more than 200 lives.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The Super League was due to run from Feb. 22 to Oct 31. A starting date for the new season has not yet been announced.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">“In order to cooperate with the nationwide prevention to curb the virus and to ensure the health of all football related people, the CFA decided to delay all levels of domestic football matches in 2020 season from now on,” read a statement from Chinese football's governing body.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">In addition, the Asian Football Confederation confirmed that all four Chinese clubs will first play three away games in the Asian Champions League group stage.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The decision comes after other sporting events in China have been postponed or cancelled due to the coronavirus. The men's alpine skiing World Cup scheduled for February 15-16 in Yanqing has been cancelled.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">The world athletics indoor championships, scheduled to be held from March 13-15 in Nanjing, have been postponed for 12 months.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">Also, the LPGA Tour has cancelled the Blue Bay tournament scheduled for March 5-8 on Hainan Island due to the virus.</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">___</p>, <p class="css-exrw3m evys1bk0">More AP sports: https://apnews.com/apf-sports and https://twitter.com/AP_Sports </p>, <p>Advertisement</p>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">Site Index</h2>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-0">news</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-1">opinion</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-2">arts</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-3">living</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-section-label-4">more</h3>, <h3 class="css-rxqrcl" id="site-index-subscribe-label">Subscribe</h3>, <h2 class="css-vz7hjd">Site Information Navigation</h2>]
